placeAddress: 1650 Richmond Ave Coral Plaza, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Great for parking. Sweetheart at the counter with homey greeting. Terrific chocolate chip muffin. Freshest I've ever had. Plenty of good seating.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: One of our go to places is Cafeteria in NYC’s Chelsea area. The Mac and Cheese sets the bar for all other places. If you sit at the bar be sure to ask for Karl. His great service and friendly personality make for an excellent experience.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: This place holds the bar for the best Mac and cheese in nyc. The chicken pillard is fresh and amazing. If you sit at the bar ask for Karl - amazing bartender and superb service. We live in the neighborhood and this is our go to restaurant on the weekends.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The burger was crazy expensive and not even grass fed- over 30.0 4 $for bacon on the burger seems a little steep even for New York- I had the french toast which was good but the fruit was a little mushy- service was good and they don't rush you which is very nice- would I go back? probably not-  fyi- the steps to the bathroom are incredibly steep and the bathroom is very dark

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Food and service was great. A really nice and lively atmosphere so not sure I understand some reviews. Lots of energy in the place. We were not given the best table but we’re moved when we asked. The meat loaf is delicious ;)

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I cannot say enough about our server!! Nick R. was fantastic! The food was amazing! I had the meatballs and Mac n cheese spring rolls! I did have to use my flashlight on my phone to read the menu because the atmosphere is darker but I love my experience at Cafeteria!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Great for any night out!! The food was  delicious and the service was impeccable! Ambience was super cool and very upbeat. Joe, the manager was top-notch as well as Justin our server. We were a large group and they met our every need with a smile and ease making everything look effortless. One of the best restaurants!!!! Highly recommend.
reviewTitle: A yes for me!!! Excellent choice!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We had heard about Cafeteria and wanted to check it out while traveling in NYC so we made a booking ahead of time online. Although online it appeared that it was going to be really busy during our Sunday morning brunch at Cafeteria it was not busy at all. I felt like Cafeteria really lacked a vibe or any character - it felt very sterile and although the food was actually pretty good our drinks were not. My latte was terrible and my daughters Matcha tasted like I would expect pond water to taste like. We love our morning drinks and there is way better in NYC. Service was okay but very slow at the beginning - not sure why as there seemed to be lots of wait staff and very few filled tables. Cafeteria was personally not the place for me.
reviewTitle: Decent Food but Lacking a Vibe

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: My daughter brought me for dinner and it was delightful! Our server Nick was so personable, warm and funny. The food was excellent and different, but it was Nick who made our night!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I used to go to this place all the time before Covid happened and let me tell you was a place to be. Now, god NO! It’s just Boring with no energy,  basically mediocre at best,  and on top of it they add 20% Gratuity on your check for not reason (table of 4). Now I understand why at 10 pm on Friday was empty. NEVER AGAIN!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Amazing place! I haven't been here in a long while and so glad it is still around. The ambiance was upbeat and friendly.  The energy was great and appropriate for catching up with friends without yelling across the table. The food was as I remembered - great presentation, not overly salty and perfect portions. I happen to be there on a Friday when the local DJ 'Lina' was spinning the tunes. Will return again soon!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Friends reunion at 7 pm on a Thursday night: full but not overly crowded, the open walls really bring in the feel of being outside. We were greeted by a gracious hostess. our wait person Nick, was pleasant, friendly, funny af and generally made our evening more special! He even took photos for us and jumped in one himself! We absolutely loved the food and HIGHLY RECOMMEND the poached peaches if they're on the specials menu again. Would definitely come back with family to enjoy.
reviewTitle: So glad we found this place!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Don’t let a name throw you off!! This place is amazing! After years of searching for the kind of restaurant you might find back when being a server or maître d’, was an honored career and restaurants took pride in serving humans. I was so pleased to find it on the coner of 7th ave and 17th street! What a jewel!! First we walked in to see the menu… met Arianna the most amazing host. We had a drive to come to see a art show, stopped in before to see if we needed reservations- her smile and kind heart made sure we would return after knowing we had found a place to eat that was clean and really quite stylish and the menu was just interesting enough for all our guests!  

Out waiter Sean did everything right! He constantly kept his eyes on our table even as the outside filled in! 

I thought i should tell the manager how great his staff has been. That was truly the butter on the toast! Matty came over - humble- sweet and proud of his staff! 

I’m so into this place by this time - I can hardly believe the experience.

Anyway- to let you know why I’m even writing this review- my Dad owned 7 restaurants- my family is 7 generations of restauranteurs. My Dad won a night-hood for  his cooking- Maitre D’ Rotisseur. He became the president of the NY restaurant association and worked with the  owners of the 21 club. His restaurant were all 5 stars. They were in westchester NY - names: Le Shack, Le Bistro, Jasons, The Jockey Club! 

Hopefully- you’ll see this and give this special place a try! Don’t forget to tell Matt and Arianna Sharon (aka Shroon) sent you!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Met friend for dinner here and was not disappointed!  It’s a busy and energetic place with lots of energy.  Friendly and unobtrusive service staff provided the right amount of attention throughout our meal.  Pork chops were perfectly cooked, and full of flavor!  Definitely will be back!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
The Cafeteria is a fun combo of American family style cafe and also a great place to meet friends. Really good menu (esp love the brunch options). They have many healthy choices but also delicious waffles and fun foods too. Cute bar. 
 Even the restrooms are fun. Had multiple different meals here this week and loved each one. Best ginger shot in town! Miguel was our server and helped with a special needs guest who was with us. Excellent place, don't miss it.
reviewTitle: Visited 3 times in one week. Reliably excellent every time.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Not only was the atmosphere and food incredible, but our server was phenomenal !  I highly recommend this establishment and hope you ask for Anjail to be your server .  She’s so passionate about food and sharing the experience with you, that she will go an
reviewTitle: AMAZING.  Anjail was the BEST Server I’ve had in all of NYC the past week. She was so  knowledgeable about  entire menu

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Great food and Shawn is a great server... so much fun.  The menu is diverse and well presented.  The food is aesthetic and very well executed, from starters through dessert. Fun crowd but not overly noisy.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We went to Cafeteria a bit by chance. It does have a look of a nice cafeteria but it is a real restaurant. The menu is very classical. We enjoyed particularly the artichokes and one of us had the pork chop which is amazing. We paid 70$ pp incl tax (but not tip) with half bottle of wine each. We felt that it was very reasonable by NYC standards.
reviewTitle: Excellent food - the best pork chop  ever - reasonable prices

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Arrived to be “greeted” by a guy in a black jumper with a beard who clearly didn’t want to be there , threw menus at us , when I ordered a coffee it arrived without a spoon  or sugar , you would think I asked for his first born he screamed at me and threw a sugar dish and spoon on the table . Food arrived no cutlery and no napkin when I asked for them he went to get them then chatted to the barman instead of delivering them, we gave up and asked for the check ,it was thrown on the table without a word , I paid cash and asked for my change (I won’t tip bad service) he went in my face and said “you want change ?” I told him I did . He brought the change and scurried away before I had a go at him , been here every time we visit New York , this was the last time
reviewTitle: Give it a miss , it’s dreadful

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We visited Cafeteria several years ago while on a business trip to New York.  We enjoyed it so much that when we planned on staying in New York again before sailing on a cruise up the east coast, we booked a hotel within walking distance of Cafeteria.  It was also centrally located for the cruise port…..  We went for an early dinner -reservations are a good idea if not mandatory.  We ordered their famous chicken and waffles.  They are also famous for their macaroni and cheese.  Both are great.  But I would say that this time the chicken was a bit over cooked.   The chicken was beautifully seasoned and crunchy but a bit dry.  The savory waffle was out of this world   We also found out that they only serve the Chicken and waffle until 6:00 PM.  Glad we made our reservation for 5:30.  They have an extensive breakfast menu which they serve until 4:00 PM.  Maybe next time we’ll try truffled eggs.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: After being let down by other places, I had researched online where to get great Mac & Cheese in New York. Cafeteria was one of the recommendations and rightfully so! My husband and I both ordered the cheddar & fontina version - it tasted lovely, as did the garlic whipped potato side dish! The ice cream was also very good. Service was friendly and efficient from all staff we encountered and the restaurant had a positive vibe which made us feel relaxed. This was one of our best meal-out memories from our honeymoon.

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText: Haven't visited this place, so can't comment on other foods or service, but just wanted to give them a positive review as a group of volunteers was fed their pizza, and although sometimes I find it difficult to get a decent regular slice (non specialty), I found their pizza to be quite good and would recommend.

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText: The place is decent for any occasion and the food is good it just became my choice for a quick bite.  I prefer the Grandma pie but all there food is good.

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText:
The food is excellent. The specialty slices remain huge, and are really a meal. The slices with chicken or calimari have an amazing amount of chicken/calimari. And the specials that I previously wrote about remain very special. My only added suggestion is to add $2.50 to the $6 special and add pasta and an amazing marinara sauce to your order. Still a great value.
We;re always happy to stop here for lunch or dinner.
reviewTitle: Yet another year gone by, and La Piazza is still outstanding!

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText:
Hard to believe that 2015 is pretty much over. During the year, we visited La Piazza on about a dozen occasions. In every case we were pleased. At lunchtime, we either have a slice (and all their slices are huge, particularly the specialty pies) or one of the roughly 20 $6 lunch specials. All that we've tried have been really good. One of the things I look for in recommending a restaurant to you is consistency. This place is consistently good for both kitchen-prepared food and pizza. I highly recommend La Piazza.
Don't let the fact that it looks like an average pizza joint in a strip mall just off the Staten Island Expressway. It's really good, and worth the trip.
Hope this review is helpful, and that you try this place and enjoy it as much as we do.
reviewTitle: Another year gone... And La Piazza is just as good as ever.

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText: A day out with friends and their children usually ends with a trip to their favorite Pizzaria / restaurant. Our children love the food so we come back often. Staff is helpful and curious.. Food is delicious !

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText: This restaurant makes the best calamari over pasta of any place I have ever been to. The pizza is also delicious. It is clean and friendly, the perfect local neighborhood pizzeria and restaurant.

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText:
My wife and I went there today, and really enjoyed it. I had a slice (whiich was HUGE -- It required 2 paper plates to hold one slice) whiich was called "spicy chicken" and was one of the best I've ever had. A huge amount of bite-size pieces of chicken in a spicy marinara sauce made with lots of red pepper. Kind of like the hot sauce that you would expect with calimari (which was another topping on-offer.) My wife had a fresh margarita slice and also enjoyed it greatly. This is not a fancy spot, it's a pizzaria in a strip mall. Also check out the daily lunch specials. And they have as wide a variety of rolls as they do pies!

Hope this was helpful.  Stop by and try them. But remember how big the slices are when you order.
reviewTitle: A large choice of both traditional and not-traditional pizza toppinigs.

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText: Big selection of slices rolls etc. I don't know where Bridgette G. Who wrote the terrible review went, but its not this place. The staff are super helpful and friendly, and have been for the almost 5 years I've been coming here, and the large pies are bigger than deninos and other places around. Love their crust!

placeAddress: 1445 Richmond Ave Ste H, Staten Island, NY 10314-1563
reviewText: They are all very nice, always! They have a pizza that is out of this world, and calzones too. The best are the lunch specials: more than 30 dishes, all prepared with very fresh ingredients and at $6 each it can't be beat! And for $2 more they ad pasta with marinara sauce! Incredible prices for this kind of quality delicious food! All served with fresh made bread and for $1 you should order the plate of  5 garlic knots, the best I ever had!
reviewTitle: Excellent prepared dishes and the best attention to customers

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Einfach unglaublich unverschämt. Vom Hotel erhält man Voucher für das Frühstück der angeschlossenen Bäckerei die 10$ wert sind. (Haben wir ja bezahlt!!!!) Man wird hier als Tourist dermassen unverschämt abgezockt und verarscht. Mir fehlen die Worte. Man erhält für den Voucher ein Getränk und ein Teilchen. Holt man nur einen Kaffee, bekommt man mal Geld zurück und mal nicht. Möchte man dann Cash bezahlen oder noch ein Teilchen, dann geht es auf einmal nicht mehr. Ich sollte mit meinem Voucher einen Cappucino für 10$ bezahlen. Da ist uns der Faden gerissen. Dermassen unverschämt!!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Just south of Washington Square this is a perfect stop for a  real croissant or other deliciously authentic French pastry.  There is very nice seating outside, but limited and  stools inside

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Um pedacinho da França ao lado da Washington Square. Café expresso de excelente qualidade e o atendimento eficiente e amoroso da sempre sorridente e prestativa Mounia.
Macarons deliciosos para fechar nossa experiência. Nota 10. Mais do que cinco estrelas.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Just this morning was passing by. Was looking for great croissant and good coffee.
I just entered and automatically i felt so happy. Delicious smell and Monia the lady at the shop was so fantastic. I ordered a machiatto  and it was delicious and a pastry. I enjoyed very much. And also i look and i noticed those beautiful bagettes  and  i purchased one  . And it was delicious.
Thanks so much to make my day. For sure i will return.
reviewTitle: What lovely to start my morning.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: When you want a quick bite, delicious dessert or fine bread, this is ideal. I ordered a slice a quiché lorraine today with a bottle of Perrier and a brioche bread. Just perfect.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
The macaroons were excellent. I don’t recommend the eclairs, they are good but not the best and for the price I don’t think it is worth it. The coffee was really good. 
It’s a small place and you have to find a way to sit if you want to stay there. Otherwise it is a grab and go. I  liked the food enough to recommend it to friends.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Someone has mentioned this place to me. It was definitely worth the 45 minute walk from our hotel. Excellent coffee,  amazing pastries, a super friendly lady at the counter - a great way to start our short trip to New York.
Cherry danish is as delicious as it is beautiful 😊

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
This is related to the upper west side location. Management here must be a disaster...if there is any management, that is.  
I recently called 2 days in advance to place an order for an important business luncheon. I was told not to place the order over the phone but to hang up and do it online 'so it doesn't get messed up'. I obliged and did it all online, including paying by credit card- well over $100, so not an insignificant order for a bakery. I arrived 2 hours after the order was supposed to be ready for pick-up. The girl at the counter was helpful, caring, and definitely trying her best, but she couldn't seem to find the order. So we needed to wait for someone else to arrive who supposedly had it. All the while the meter maid is outside trying to give tickets, so I have my son inside while I drive around the block a hundred times. In a nutshell, after waiting for a half hour, some men show up and when asked about our quiche, they respond 'we're going to Brooklyn now to make it'. Huh?? They are then surprised and appear annoyed that we didn't want to drive around the block for the next four hours while they travel to a different borough to make a quiche and then bring it back, and that instead we wanted our money back. 
Why did they not just say 'I'm so sorry, we completely forgot your order'??
Weirdest management experience ever. Fortunately I had 24 hours to the luncheon instead of 2 hours, but I had hoped to not spend my entire weekend cooking, which is of course what then happened. If the luncheon had been in 2 hours, my goose would have been truly cooked. Don't be caught up by the professional allure of the website..they don't know what they're doing over there. Stick to a cup of coffee and a croissant.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
A quaint French bakery nested in New York's Greenwich Village that provided my party of two a cool down and dryness from the upcoming rain storm as we neither of us had umbrellas.  Very limited and extremely narrow tight seating.  Two employees serving customers and hustling non-stop to operate a bakery.

Jasmine Green Tea by Kusmi $2.76
Cappuccino (misspelt on their sales receipt as "Cappucino") $3.49
Macaron cookies (one raspberry, one chocolate, one vanilla) at $2.50 each

Their business card also serves as a frequent drink card with the tenth drink free.  Their business card is a very simple black sketch drawing of a New York City skyline with iconic buildings and landmarks and contains Paris's iconic Moulin Rouge's windmill discreetly embedded in the background colored in purple to distinctly stand out.  It symbolizes a French bakery in New York City.  Very bright and simple atmosphere.  There are French baguettes available.  No restroom facility on site due to the very limited seating per 1977 law NY any food establishment with 20 or more seats must have toilets.  New York University students can attain their food grub between classes or hanging out in Washington Square Park.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My almond-chocolate croissant was the real thing -- I miss the French patisseries so much, but here it is in Greenwich Village. Bonus: There was a pastry-making class going on at the same time we came in. Envy!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: This wonderful place opened right down the block from where I lived. Initally all the cooking and backin was done on the premises. Now since they have expanded to supply other shops and restaurants it serves as a stopping off place to get wonderful pastry and coissants.
reviewTitle: I know this place from the day it opened and it is a gem

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Après une petite balade à Washington square, nous y avons dégusté un excellent brownie accompagné d’une très bonne tasse de café sur une petite terrasse.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: This is my third time going to Mille Feuille for a class. After the first macaron baking class, I knew I’d be back. I attended the croissant baking class as well and it was even better. The chefs are so kind and patient. The place is small but it’s nice. The perfect place size for a laid back baking class. It’s perfect for everyone in the family.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: A great class - fun but also informative.  Vincent was an excellent teacher, and we walked away not just with lots of delicious macarons, but also the confidence to try them again at home

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: If you want authentic pastries, this is the place! You will not be disappointed. I truly thought they flew in the pastries from Paris, which is a great complement!!
reviewTitle: EXCELLENT!!! The best I have been to in NYC

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: What a fun experience to learn to bake French macaroons in a sweet little bakery in the village. The cookies came out perfect with a bit of help from the teacher. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My sister and I brought my mother for Mother's day and we had such a wonderful experience! Vincent was great and very helpful! This is wonderful activity for a small group and even individually. Can't wait to go back for croissants!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My mom and I took the croissant making class on Sunday. The instructor (a young French guy, can’t remember his name) was sweet and took his time showing us all the steps. Such fun, and we took home nearly 50 croissants plus dough to make more. It’s not a cheap class, but we’ll worth it. Highly recommend!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: It was a wonderful experience. The baking class was a great learning experience and helped me polish some of my previous skills/knowledge. The Chef was amazing and would love to take another class with him

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My son and I thoroughly enjoyed learning how to make macarons at this cute French bakery! Highly recommend the class to learn proper technique for making delicious macarons.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I don't know what there was about it but I had the most perfect English muffin ever at Cafeteria.  I also loved my omelet with Gruyere and avocado along with my English breakfast tea.  I know this is a very popular place for lunch and dinner and it was nice to be able to enjoy it at a slower time, for a weekday breakfast.  It was nice to be able to sit "inside" in the air conditioning on a hot morning and still experience the open exposure to the street, which was also good from a covid perspective.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Entrés par hasard, poussés par une averse, nous avons trouvé un restaurant plutôt branché tout en restant cool. Les serveurs, avec de jolies bretelles, sont charmants. Le "bruit" ne nous a pas dérangé, ça fait partie de New York ! La carte n'est pas très longue (plutôt positif) et les plats choisis étaient très bons. Seul bémol sur le prix : 4 cocktails dont 2 sans alcool, 2 burgers et un steak : 180$ ...

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Big thanks to Joel who greeted us warmly at the door of this hip, very busy restaurant on a rainy Friday night on Mother's Day weekend. Not being hip and worse yet having no reservation we would have understood had he said no dice. Instead, he asked if we wanted to wait at the bar for a bit. Less than ten minutes and we were seated at a great table. We had calamari and salmon, and both were excellent. The artichokes were the star. Service was efficient, friendly, and quick. Would return.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We stopped for breakfast.  the menu had lots of interesting options.  Food was great and we had wonderful service.  They have outdoor seating but the entire restaurant was open to the outdoors.  I would recommend this place.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Had lunch here the other day: Salmon tartare and the meatloaf. Both excellent and in sufficiency to go home with a doggy bag. My only complaint is finding a recipe for the meatloaf that is terribly written! And from the NYTimes cooking app of all places. The topping is what makes this meatloaf special (and I don't think you're supposed to add it to the meats!). I'd go again after saving up some bucks first ....

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Saw the recommendations online and after seeing the menu we knew we had to visit. Made booking for last night and it didn’t disappoint. Amazing service and the food was spectacular. Definitely recommend the Mac and cheese spring rolls.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Enjoyed a delicious dinner with friends celebrating a birthday.   The menu is full of comfort food "done right" - had the meatloaf and mac and cheese and I expected my grandmother to come strolling out of the kitchen after we were finished.  Liked it so much that we went back for breakfast.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Be prepared, this restaurant requires you to provide proof of your Covid-19 vaccine for both indoor and outdoor dining. 

Food was just okay, nothing special.  
Service was mediocre but gave us time to enjoy the outdoor patio which was comfortable and well maintained.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Fantastic food and service! I  was treated here for my birthday dinner. It was a great gift.
We were quickly greeted and seated after getting our temperature checked. It was early so not busy at all. The ambiance is modern, but cozy at same time. 

We started with the  cornmeal calamari appetizer. The calamari was nearly perfectly fried with only minor toughness. The flavor accompaniments of hot peppers,fried capers and horseradish sauce made up for it. The flavor combinations were spot on and I quickly forgot about any minor toughness of the calamari.

The shaved prime rib with herbed fries which was another winner. The beef was tender and juicy with a delicious au jus sauce on a wonderful sourdough baguette. The fries were excellent.

The ginger salmon with charred broccoli was a showstopper entree. Perfectly cooked and seasoned salmon was sauced with a bright and zesty ginger sauce.  The side of brocolini was fresh and crisp with excellent balanced garlic flavor.

To finish off meal we had an scrumptious pumpkin praline pie with bourbon whipped cream. This is the best pumpkin pie I've had in ages and among best I have had in entire life. You must have it if you're a pumpkin pie fan. The pie texture,sweetness and crust were flawless. The bourbon whipped cream sent it to an even higher level. 

Our server Eva was efficient,friendly and charming. A server who is there whenever you need them, but yet not constantly hovering. A class act. 

Highly recommended for great food and service and not overly expensive for this area as well.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Obligatorio!! Brutal el espectáculo después de tomar unas copas por chelsea o por hells. Todo un circo que hay que disfrutar!! Un regalo para la vista!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Found this lovely always open place totally by accident. Great interior, very good music selection and big portions of delicious food not too mention excellent front of the house customer service. Highly recommended for both meeting with friends as well as having an excellent meal or drinks.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Went with my one year old granddaughter and three other adults for a Sunday breakfast.  Seating was fast and comfortable, all food came promptly and as ordered.  I shared the silver dollar pancakes with the one year old and she gave me a thumbs up. Food was good, service was great.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Swanky-ish spot meant to resemble an upscale diner and diner fare. 
I got the blue cheese, iceberg wedge salad - little over dressed but good. A cheeseburger on a brioche bun and over seasoned fries. My seat mate got the branzino and we split an order of Shiseido peppers (which were the biggest peppers I'd ever seen).,
Staff was very nice. Got us a table with no reservation.  Then worked with us to get a larger, quieter table - so that was very nice.
All the food was good, none great.
Wine - by the glass - was overpriced but good. 
Not sure I'd go out of my way to eat there again but it was solid.
No complaints. 
Well one complaint.. Bathroom is down a flight of very steep stairs (my god how old do I sound). Unisex stalls that were a little messy.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I’ve tried this place for a second chance and again they surprised because of food quality, regularity, despite a little bit noise place. Mac and cheese options are a must.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Eeks. 

We were excited to start our trip to New York by eating at this restaurant because it had been on sex and the city and the food looked amazing. We arrived at 7:30am on a friday and there was only one other table sat. 

The service started out great. The coffee was amazing and the avocado toast was really tasty. We were very impressed with everything and were having a great time. 

Cut to the check coming. We were a party of 5. Two of us had cash so we asked to have a certain amount put on three cards and the rest in cash. I get that is kind of a pain and understood why our server seemed agitated. I already knew I was going to leave more with my cash tip to make up for us being annoying. But then she comes back to our table and SLAMS down the check and says rather loudly and rudely "You guys didnt give me enough! You are $3 short on the check!" She then shows us a calculator with the math on it. We're all jetlagged from our redeye so we're not on our A game but give her another $3 in cash for the remainder of the bill. She then takes the money and says " That's also no including a tip by the way! I usually put it on the card for people so they don't forget but you didnt give me that option." Ok girl calm down. I'm a server so I get it. I also get that cash tips are better than cards and we had cash on the table for her 30% tip to make up for the split checks. But after being YELLED at by a server, I am not going to reward that behavior. There are better ways to handle this situation and I would never take the route she did. We promptly took back half of what we were going to leave as her tip and left disgusted by her behavior. 

If I ever did that at my bar,I wouldn't have a job anymore. I understand if you're having an off day but to raise your voice to customers and speak to them so rudely is not acceptable. What a way to start our trip...

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Waited in the line for 45 minutes and they didn't even let us in because we are not somebody! That's the most unprofessional manner I have ever experienced!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We had the mac and cheese, burrata, and mussels, all very reasonable. For mains the crabcakes where good and the tuna was ok.
The pricing is fairly high, over $70 per person.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We took a family vacation to NYC and this restaurant did not disappoint! A friend from Jersey recommended it. The atmosphere is clean, white and modern. Our waiter was very helpful in recommending something my daughter may like as she had trouble deciding. My husband said it’s the best shrimp and grits he’s ever had!! Two thumbs up from us.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
This old familiar spot is still reliable.  And,  the food is good as ever.  The al fresco seating is best in the warmer New York weather, and yesterday was an especially kind day.  

Service was good, and our food came quickly.  The drinks were goid,,too, though my table mates' Inferno Bloody Mary was just that,  nearly too hot to enjoy.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: It’s a cute trendy place.  Food is pretty good. Service is always horrible.  They are friendly but inefficient.  Been this way as long as I have been coming which is 5 years.  Never improves.  Too bad.

placeAddress: 1883 Victory Blvd., Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We stopped here on the way home from Brooklyn and it was the perfect place to stop. It was poppin! There were a decent amount of people. Great vibes, staff & music. The food was very delicious and at a great fair price. And it is Halal! I came in craving a bacon egg & cheese but my mind immediately changed when I saw& tried the “Worlds Best Pastrami Sandwich”. Delicious. Definitely worth trying out!
reviewTitle: Great Food, Great Vibes, Great Prices!

placeAddress: 1883 Victory Blvd., Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Clean, modern, simple cafe atmosphere. Good food and it's always served with a side of greens which is refreshing for this area. I'm looking forward to trying some of their smoothies and dining outside as the weather warms up. My only complaint is that it's a bit pricey.

placeAddress: 1883 Victory Blvd., Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I have been to Cafe Juliet a few times now and I’ve enjoyed it every time. I’ve tried many of their menu items and everything so far has been delicious. Their fig and apple grilled cheese is amazing! I also love their pancakes and avocado and Harris toast. So so good. Their selection of lattes are really good as well. Rose petal latte is my favorite. I highly recommend this place. Will definitely keep going back.

placeAddress: 1883 Victory Blvd., Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Stopped in here for a bite with a friend. It's located in a strip mall, so it could be difficult to park on occasion. Light and airy interior. Friendly and helpful staff. You order and pick up your items from the counter. My friend and I enjoyed a Breakfast plate and an avocado and burrata toast. I really liked that the egg plate came with a side salad, along with potatoes, and sourdough toast. They had some delightful items on the menu. Would recommend stopping in here. I look forward to returning and trying their cardamon pancakes.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Atmosphere was quiet and pleasant and the food was a treat -- excellent guacamole and choice salads. Good, fresh food at very good prices. A pleasant change from the inflated prices you sometimes find in the neighborhood.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: We stopped here two days in a row. The food was very good and the staff was very friendly. They even remembered us from the day before. Very cozy atmosphere. Will be coming back.
reviewTitle: Very good food and great atmosphere

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Our meal started with chips and guacamole. The guacamole was outstanding but the chips were thin and small and couldn’t hold the guacamole. The rest of the meal was outstanding..  my turkey burger was very tasty.  My wife said it was one of the best pieces of salmon she has tasted.  The staff had no problem preparing our meals with specific request. They also have a wide variety of fruit juices.  Make sure you bring cash - they don’t take credit cards.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Pas facile à trouver, mais vaut le déplacement.  Dans un cadre agréable, un service de qualité et des plats excellents.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
Íbamos de camino para el Downtown de Brooklyn y encontramos este sitio que parecía muy agradable. Ordenamos la sopita del día, un tartare de atún, un wrap y sándwich.
Las porciones generosas y con un sabor exquisito, lo único que pudo haber sido mejor, fue el tartare, pues el atún no estaba tan fresco como esperaba y desmejoró en algo su sabor... todo lo demás estuvo genial. Si no hablas inglés y eres hispanohablante, no es problema, el personal habla español perfectamente.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Con luz tenue y un decorado simple, esto es auténtico Brooklyn: Comida excelente a precios razonables (no com Manha...) La tilapia es increíble y la hamburguesa es deliciosa. Se siente la calidad de los ingredientes y el cariño en su preparación. Este lugar tendrá siempre un lugar especial para nosotros.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Dropped in for a quick breakfast..... Food was good and gluten free options as well. Coffee was good. Service very good.
reviewTitle: Quick Breakfast.... Decent food and value

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
Let me tell you something, PURE Bistro serves PURE food. It's that simple. Everything here seems to be organic, fresh, and local. And you can taste the difference no matter how simple the dish. They can make it into perfection.

My friend and I happened to stop by on a lunch rush and this tiny bistro was packed packed packed. We figured it would be worth the wait since so many people all seemed to be migrating to this one location. We were certainly right.

The foods are definitely plentiful so you're getting what you're paying for. And the dish looks and tastes as fresh as can be. This bistro knows what's up in cooking with the best ingredients and making it into the best it can be. And the foods aren't even that complicated here. I think that's what I like so much about it. It's all simple dishes but it tastes really, really good. Simple but very flavorful, and healthy! That's an added plus!

The only downside was the wait, of course. There was a rush when we came in but we were the last to be served and to leave. I think we had to wait at least a good 30 minutes for our food but we're not complaining too much because it was all worth the wait. Not to forget but the interior art of this place is pretty cool to look at, so we were entertained. 

NOTE: Avoid lunch rushes or dinner rushes because it WILL be packed and the wait can get lengthy. I suggest coming a little later around 2 or 3 to avoid the crowds so you can eat leisurely and not so rushed.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Venus en famille pour prendre un brunch, nous avons été déçus par la qualité des plats proposés; mis à part les jus de fruits frais qui sont bons, les assiettes sont assez moyennes, selon nous.
reviewTitle: endroit plutôt sympathique mais brunch moyen

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
It was a good stop on our way to a concert at the Barclay Center for a concert.  A nice, cozy place with wraps, salads, burgers, apps, etc.  We had the buffalo chicken cubes to start, which were good.  Maybe a tiny bit overcooked, but good.  The sandwiches were good as well as the mashed and baked potatoes.

It's a healthy place so there are gluten-free and vegan options.

The service was terrific.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: We were a larger group of 18, and even though this restaurant is small, the accommodated us and took reservations.  The menu had many options, making it hard to make a tasty decision.  I settled on the Hawaiian burger, which was a 6 oz salmon fillet topped with a grilled pineapple and teriyaki sauce on a very fresh pumpkin seeded bun, which was served with a nice mixed greens salad.  The server took each of our outriders, customizing and answering questions as she went down the long table that we were seated at, and she wasn't flustered at all.   Although their beer menu was a tad short, we all enjoyed a nice meal before the Islanders-Devils game.   Everyone was say8ing how delicious their food was and how much they enjoyed it.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: down the street (5th Ave) from the Barclay Center are several blocks which contain small restaurants. Pure was the only one I saw with Breakfast all day. A very neat , modern serving area, and very good service was an added benefit. So at 6:30 pm I was able to order a very good, reasonably price omelet, and very good coffee. Toast and a few greens came with the omelet. My spouse ordered a chick wrap which was also well prepared. Free water served in a jar was also a nice touch. Would return.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
I ate here with my husband and our adult daughter for brunch.  We prefer healthful foods that are not loaded with unhealthy fats or have too much salt but that have lots of fruits and veggies as sides.  We were not disappointed.  The food was excellent and the variety was great.  The coffee could have been better and they only accept cash and American Express, hence only a four circle rating.

I had the whole wheat pancakes with fresh berry topping.  These are the best whole wheat pancakes I have eaten in a long time.  They were not dense but had a great texture - being light but not turning to mush in your mouth.  The berry topping was actually just freshly cut up strawberries and blueberries artistically arranged on the pancakes and plate.  They are served with real maple syrup.  I also order the PURE salad - a mixed green salad with roasted red peppers, thin red onion strips, avocado and blue cheese dressing (I requested the dressing served on the side.)  Some of the lettuce leaves were too wet for me but I simply picked them out.

Our daughter ordered the salmon burger on a gluten free bun that was topped with grilled pineapple and teriyaki sauce.  The salmon burger was actually just a piece of salmon, not a ground-up-filled-with-seasonings style of fish.  There was a small green salad on the side.  

My husband ordered the Mediterranean Morning Wrap substituting egg whites for the whole eggs.  It was filled with plenty of spinach, feta, and egg whites on a whole wheat pita.  It was served with sweet potato home fries which were good but not crunchy.
reviewTitle: Healthful food that actually tastes delicious!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: We just walked in and had the best burgers of our stay in NYC. Lovely staff and nice atmosphere! Straight 10/10! Big big up!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: People were nice and helpful. Food tasty, not expensive. Went back 2d time, it was that pleasant.  They feature wraps and salads. We enjoyed both dinner and lunch there

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: We waited a very very long time for our food, but we understood because there were a lot of people trying to eat. Once we got our food we were all pleasantly surprised at how delicious it was!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
Business lunch with my two associates today and one of them did a search and found this place. 

Very hip,  cool and contemporary.   It's surprisingly larger than expected.   

Menu is fresh and imaginative.   Nika, our server was friendly and professional.  Bottle of tap water with three glasses served right up.  I like that as we don't have to rely on servers to refill our glasses.  Wish more restaurants did that. 

Menu has starters like "mom's guacamole" and "pop's hummus" along with spicy sliders and quesadilla.  We split the hummus.  Delicious.   

I had the Greek salad with grilled chicken. Plenty of fresh salads on the menu.  

One associate ordered the Italiano panini, grilled chicken baby spinach, sun dried tomato, mozzarella and balsamic vinegarette.  He raved about it. 

The other ordered the viventi panini which was grilled chicken, fresh mozzarella, roasted peppers, and pesto on a multi grain panini.  Loved it!

Ambiance is laid back, beautifully decorated brick walls and wood tables with plenty of elbow room.  Low noise level Manes conversation easy. 

If you're in the Park Slope neighborhood stop by and enjoy Pure Bistro.  Tell Nika that Michael sent you!  Enjoy
reviewTitle: Excellent food! Cool ambiance, great service!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Ótima comida, atendimento simpático e ambiente agradável. Fomos ao Pure Bistrô por acaso é a satisfação nao poderia ser maior. Além de ótimos pratos, o cheese cake e dos melhores que já comi, mesmo sem cobertura.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Me and my girlfriend were on holiday in New York for over a week, struggling with the portion sizes and the amount of oil and junk in many of the restaurants we are at. We both liked travelling out to Brooklyn, so for our last night in in New York we chose to come to Pure Bistro. Finally, on our last day we found quality burgers that were juicy without being drowned in sauce. Tasty buns, and an excellent salad accompaniment (not fries for a change - yay!). The service was polite and helpful. And their blueberry and banana smoothie was a winner!! Reasonably priced too. Top marks.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Brooklyn.  The menu is great and inexpensive.  The food is relatively healthy and the staff is attentive and kind.

placeAddress: 141 Lawrence St, Brooklyn, NY 11201-5208
reviewText: We went on a Sunday night and it was pretty dead, but we still enjoyed excellent IPAs, "No Sleep Til Brooklyn" flatbread (gotta love a Beastie Boys reference), and the best meatballs I've ever had. The bar itself is a gorgeous artistic wooden masterpiece.
reviewTitle: Went for the beer, stayed for the meatballs!

placeAddress: 141 Lawrence St, Brooklyn, NY 11201-5208
reviewText: The room has a high ceiling and comfortable seating. In addition to beer they offer an interesting assortment of cocktails. The pizzas are also creative. Everything was very good and the Shishito Peppers alone are why we will return. The service is attentive. Our only complaint is that we asked for the Peppers to come out as an appetizer before the pizza but they were served at the same time.
reviewTitle: Rounded up to 5 because the Shishito Peppers were so good!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: On Dec 3 my kids and I were seated at the back by the exit someone started banging on the door but we ignored it since we don’t work there they kept banging finally one of the servers opened the door and told this man and his wife that was not the entrance but let them in anyway they had to squeeze past us since the table is so close to the door and neither these entitled people nor the staff excused themselves or anything they just squeezed by as we were eating I didn’t want to make a big deal about it since I was there with my kids but I really think the staff should have handled that better I wonder had it been me with my kids banging on that door would they had let us in and I really don’t think so
reviewTitle: Not the worst thing to happen but it still shouldn’t have happened

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Been to this diner about 100 times (lol). A delicious breakfast spot. Standard menu, plenty of parking. Lunch and or dinner can’t go wrong with a burger or wrap either.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
We had a great meal with 12 people. The service was fantastic and all 12 meals were served at the same time so we could all begin eating together. 
The food was great, very large portions and there were no errors with the order.
I wish that I could have the same dining experience when I go out to more expensive restaurants.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: I will never order from this diner again.  I order at least once a week and 80% of the time the order is wrong.  I call and the owner is never there.  I speak to the manager who tells me he will make up for it next order and it never happens.  I am really tired of paying for food and I don’t receive it.  This is the LAST time they will be receiving my money.  Good bye

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Don't let the label "diner" fool you - this is a bona fide restaurant with nice decor, comfortable seating, and good food. We have found it is easier to get accommodations for dietary limitations at non-chain restaurants, and they were great about my son's limitations. Very nice breakfast. Would go again in a heartbeat.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Had lunch here with the hubby.  Clean diner with friendly staff.  Good food large portions. You will not be disappointed.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Stay far away from this Diner  !!!!!    ..............We gave this place many chances, BUT every time the food just got worse !  We both ordered Hamburgers and went home sick to our stomach. I really think the Board of Health really needs to visit this place !! AND their prices are ridiculous ..do they really think the place is that fancy to charge those prices !!  And the price on the menu does not match the price you get on your check...like five dollars more each.  We will be contacting the Board of Health because I heard they leave the food out at room temperature and that's why we both got sick !   Don't take your loved one or family to this place to get sick ...just stay far away and maybe some day we will see it all boarded up and closed down !!!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Waitress did not come around , food was overpriced and tasted just okay,no refills , poor customer service and didn’t bring check

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
DO NOT ORDER ANY FOOD FROM THIS PLACE! 
I know someone who use to wait tables here and from what I heard the kitchen is not kept clean at all. They leave food out at room temperature, and some of the cooks don't wash thier hands. I was also told that certain workers, including a couple of the managers would even eat food, sometimes customers. Behind the back of the kitchen, or in the bathroom just so they wouldn't get caught . I cannot believe that they have not been shut down yet.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
O local fica numa região não tão conhecida em NY - Staten Island porém a comida segue o padrão de hambúrguer gigante americano. Gostoso.
Bom atendimento, um pouco cheio nos horários de pico. Recomendo e volto.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
Mike's Unicorn Diner has very good food & is clean.
Their egg omelettes are really quite good !
Staff is very polite, also.
Staff is very polite.
reviewTitle: Mike's Unicorn Diner has very good food & is clean

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: The food here is excellent and so is the service... Always love to pay a visit here when visiting Staten Island

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
Μας πήγαν φίλοι που γνώριζαν το μαγαζί! Ποσο τυχεροί είμαστε που βρεθήκαμε εκεί!!
Τέλειο πρωινό αυγά τηγανητά πατάτες τοπική σπεσιαλιτέ και επιτέλους the best nes cafe frappe!!
Φιλικό σερβις 
Πλούσιες μερίδες. 
Ωραίο American style περιβάλλον. 
Μακάρι να ξαναπηγαίναμε !!!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
My husband & I actually ate at Mikes two times during our stay. It was close to our hotel. It was affordable. Hours of operation were convenient, open 24 hours a day! 😊the service was friendly & attentive. 
Our first visit we had breakfast. It was good size servings. Lots to choose from. The bacon was fabulous! Omelet was average. Place was clean. 
Our last visit we had lunch prior to catching our flight. We had sandwiches, the philly cheese steak & chicken parmigiana. I really enjoyed the steak sandwich. Meat was juicy & very flavorful. I would stop in there again if ever in town!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
My cousin recommended this Diner for Lunch. It has a large Parking Lot. We were seated immediately,even though the Diner was crowded.
Our server gave us excellent attention. The food was Awesome, tasty and large portions.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: The menu was quite extensive in terms of food and beverages. The serving sizes were very generous. Most importantly the food was delicious. Our server was so nice and helpful. Fantastic breakfast experience and everything this country girl thought a diner in New York would be like.
reviewTitle: Typical NY Diner in a good way

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: It was breakfast. Nothing special, nothing fancy. In short, they delivered what we ordered. Service was just a little slow, but not bad. Worth it for a diner breakfast.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: When we got there we had a 30 minute wait. We were seated all the way in the back in a nice private little table. It was perfect! Our food was very good and the staff was great!  I also liked that they have a parking lot.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: We enjoyed our visit, though we needed to lower our expectations for service since it was busy and the very experienced server was overwhelmed.  I don't mind waiting for service or a refill on my drink, but I do mind getting snapped at when I finally do get her attention.  Other than that, the place has a great old school feel with a monstrous menu and everyone in my party gave a thumbs up to their selection. None of us came close to finishing our ample portions.  I'm sure it would be an even more pleasant experience if we go again at a time when they aren't insanely busy with the servers only able to give a minimum of attention.
reviewTitle: Nice environment. Good food. Service? Not for the thin skinned.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Just to cut them a break: the group of old friends from Brooklyn came back here because the last time was quite pleasant. So we must have caught them on a disastrous day. I asked for a very rare burger, my friend asked for medium rare, and another ordered roast chicken. The two burgers were overdone and the dinner was dry. One of us asked for coffee before the meal. It didn't come. So he ordered coffee to go afterward/ It came, but he was charged for two coffees. Again: we were unlucky in coming at a very busy time. But we won't be back anytime soon. (I should also mention that the prices are pretty high, even if the food had been good.)
reviewTitle: Worst dinner ever for the four of us

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Excellent service — food was prepared as ordered and the atmosphere was relaxing. Good Italian dinner two nights in a row.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: First time to Staten Island and chose to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn for convenience.  When checking in, noticed Lorenzo's and decided to have dinner her.  We started with the Maryland Crab Cakes and they were actually really good.  Did not expect this to be so good and included two great sauces.  My colleague ordered the Veal chop (which he enjoyed) and I had the Short Rib.  The Short rib was perfect along with the carrots and polenta (wish polenta was softer) and the sauce was excellent.  Was quite surprised at the entire meal!  Great place.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: A huge thank you to Selim, Briana and Ozzi, for helping us execute a wonderful rehearsal dinner in Lorenzo's wine room the night before our wedding.  Selim thoughtfully helped us design our menu, Briana helped with our table design and Ozzi was wonderful as our main waiter for the night helping us to plan the timing for our champagne toast and food.  Everyone had a great time, and the food was cooked to perfection.  Also thanks to Corinne and Murat for logistical assistance along the way - greatly appreciated! I have never worked with such a personable and considerate events team who I felt truly cared that our event went well.  We truly felt taken care of.  I highly recommend Lorenzo's for any special event and will definitely consider booking future events here.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We have been here twice for special occasions and both times enjoyed a stellar experience.  The Owners visited each table and made my mother’s birthday special with a birthday dessert and light accessory.  The Manager lowered the air vent at our table to reduce the chill when needed.  The piano player takes requests and the decor is lovely.  The only caveat - the bar is packed pre dinner so anticipate having drinks at your table… the bar empties around 8pm but then may fill up again as a lot of events (bridal parties, receptions etc) stay and celebrate here.  Highly recommended venue for a dinner out.
reviewTitle: Great Food, Piano Food & Attentive Staff

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Evening out with other adult family members - great food ( pork chop with gnocchi), talented piano player, attentive service.  The small bar would be great for a pre dinner cocktail but unfortunately for our visit a group of boisterous beer drinking guys  were a little too loud for us - the bar scene later in the evening was great.  Good people watching too - dog friendly hotel so be prepared to see the pooches!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
If this is really the #1 restaurant in Staten Island, as it claims to be, then I would really not like to visit restaurant #10 on that list.

We came by the restaurant as we were already staying in the hotel and wanted an easy option for dinner. I honestly wish I hadn’t, as I only had 2 positive experiences out of the evening. 

I will start with the positives (Unfortunately both don’t have to do with the food itself).

First, the piano music for dinner was lovely to listen to and really added to the overall ambiance of the restaurant. I’m a big fan of any venue continuing to support live arts. 

Second, the hotel owner came to every table to introduce themselves and interact with the restaurant patrons and that was a nice experience meeting with them.

I wish I could say that the evening continued on that wave of positive experiences. But alas, we ended up waiting an hour for food prepared in all sorts of disappointing ways. 

First off, my burger came out completely charred and overdone, when it was supposed to come out medium. When it was sent back, I was brought a small caprese salad, free of charge. A nice gesture, to be sure! But unfortunately, the tomatoes in the free salad were rotten! It felt like a total slap in the face at that moment. I then finally get my burger prepared properly and it is probably one of the most disappointing and bland burgers I’ve had in my life.

The rest of my party didn’t have good experiences either, two of which were waiting an hour just to get a bowl of soup? (Which is confusing to me, since it should be simple to prepare)

The other two in my party got the salmon and it was overdone, and the lemon sauce with it was NOT GOOD. The polenta with it was tasteless as well.

I ended the night disappointed and still hungry. Do yourself a favor and do not make the same mistake I did by coming here if you’re staying in this hotel (which we had other negative experiences with but I’ll save that for a review of the actual hotel).
reviewTitle: This is the #1 restaurant in Staten Island???????

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Visited Lorenzo's with my wife on 02/16/24 for a romantic dinner with live piano music. Unfortunately, the visit turned out to be a great disappointment :( It's very sad as we planned this for a while and the place indeed had all the potential to live to the expectations. But it didn't :( 
The food was decent; service was excellent and flawless; piano music was great, the guy played non-stop for 1.5h! However, there were two big tables which got occupied with large families shortly after we came. One was just next us with about 8 people and the other was one table away with about 15 people including children and even babies. Very soon it became so noisy we could hardly hear the piano. All these people didn't care about the music at all being fully occupied with their family gatherings. And then a baby started crying... We felt like sitting in a busy diner rather than an upscale romantic place :( The setting, the piano, the waiters in suits, the prices were not in line with what was going on. It was weird.

The food was pretty good but falling short of 5 stars on all dishes except soup.
Appetizers
	Bread basket with butter, olive oil, and ricotta - this one was on the house and it was excellent. Fresh, warm, perfect.
	Roasted Peppers with Fresh Mozzarella - this was a special of the day. The peppers tasted fine, but were most likely from a can, not freshly roasted. Mozzarella slices were quite tasteless with no dressing on top. We had to add salt on them the get some taste.
	Rooftop Kale Salad - this was fine, but could benefit from a bit more goat cheese and walnuts. It was mostly kale...
	Mushroom Soup - this was a special of the day. The soup was absolutely delicious! One of the best mushroom soups I ever had in a restaurant. This was the only flawless dish of the evening.

Mains
	Slow Simmered Beef Short Rib - the portion was good size, with nice presentation, sauce, and garnishes. The meat however was quite dry, certainly not melting in the mouth as the rightly cooked short ribs should be. On one side the meat was actually burned! :( I could request a replacement, but really didn't want to go into this and wait while my wife was eating. The salt level was on a higher side - ok, but on a border line.
	Basil Pesto Crusted Salmon - it was pretty good, though on dry side, not as juicy and tender as you would expect in such a place.

Desert
	Warm Apple Crumb - the tart with ice-cream was ok, nothing special. The white stuff they added around would be better off a whipped cream, but instead it tasted like a super sweet liquid marshmallow.
	
We cannot recommend this restaurant. They need to figure out their identity.
reviewTitle: Decent food, nice piano music, but the atmosphere of a diner :(

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: My wife and I came here for brunch the day after her birthday. Excellent, polite service. Beautiful serve yourself appetizer bar. Our entrees; my wife had crab eggs Benedict, I had chicken and waffles with a peach and blueberry infused maple syrup. Both were delicious. Next time we return to Staten Island, we'll visit again.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We selected Lorenzo's for a "life celebration" for my mother.  Location was ideal for out-of-towners arriving at Newark.  The brunch was excellent, the piano music was superb, the service was spot on.  The buffet food was very good and varied as to tastes (meat charcuterie, smoked salmon, stuffed pork, etc..).  Then there were the entries....mmmmmm.  Thank you to Brianna, the host, and Richard and Lois Nicotra who were so very welcoming!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Classical and modern food is served. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The owner comes to every table to welcome the guests. The food was great and a piano player played music on a stage.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: No one there and we soon figured out why. Menu card very limited. Beer from bottle tasted awful, wife's wine was undrinkable, second offer not much different. Food passable.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Absolutely a wonderful experience. $35 a person was a perfect price point. Dining area was so pleasant in a spacious room with a beautiful piano giving room extra class. Service was attentive and excellent. Calling the salad bar is an understatement, it has besides the breakfast items of fruits ,  grilled veggies, fish salads, assorted meats and cheeses, mussels in a nice red sauce and more. Complimentary Bloody Mary, Mimosa and another peach type drink. This is before 9 choices of a individual meal to choose from , such as pasta in cream sauce with bacon & peas, two chicken dishes, steak and eggs and others. Top it off with coffee and light pastries and cookies and your table. Very classy hotel and lobby it is truly a hidden gem

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Good food with a good atmosphere. Everything was prepared to order and the staff was very helpful and accommodating. Nice.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: My husband and I , as well as my best friend and her husband, have made it a tradition to go to Lorenzo’s every Valentine’s Day or weekend of Valentine’s Day. There is a prefix dinner with three courses and a piano player in the background.  The price is reasonable, about $55 not including drinks and gratuity.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Beautiful restaurant, Friendly and attentive staff. The only thing I would complain about would be that the buffet was in the bar area. It really was not a huge deal but I felt that it should have been somewhere in the same room we were seated. It was no big deal. Their was a tremendous selection of breakfast items, two carving stations, eggs,crepes and pasta made to order, A full dessert table with chocolate fountain. The two hour seating was more than enough time for our group. I would recommend Lorenzo's for brunch.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We had a couple of meals whilst we were staying at the hampton. Food was of high quality, and the staff, including the bar staff were friendly, attentive and very professional. Would certainly visit again

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The wsit staff was well versed in etiquette and quite the gentleman. He rattled off the menu as if it had been rehearsed and I must say that he wss exceptional. It's a must go to place for eating in a relaxed environment. Thank you for your service. Dr. Rivera

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We were one of two parties here mid-week so this large restaurant was basically empty. Our party of four ordered the specials and soup for dinner. Risotto (2 of us) and mushroom ravioli (1) and the other ordered “Nana’s Chicken Soup”. We waited for one hour for our food. When it finally arrived the risotto was undercooked and the ravioli fell off the fork (over cooked). The cream sauce on the ravioli was clumpy and overdone. The chicken soup was mainly broth and ridiculous. No one finished even half of their plates. It was one of the more awful dinners I’ve ever had. After waiting for an hour in an empty dining room I started to wonder why it was so empty. Apparently the place is just flat out bad!  Service was mediocre. Would not recommend.
reviewTitle: We were one of two parties

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The restaurant is located in the Hilton garden inn. I found the bar area , bathrooms and restaurant to be filthy. The food was prepared banquet food and was not good quality. At night with the lights dim it looks ok but during the day with lights on the entire place is filthy. Another thing I was appalled by was

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: First class service, very attentive and accomodating. The menu was quite diverse with something for everyone.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Legal muito legal, com ótimas cervejas. Atendimento muito bom, comida bem gostosa. Vale a pena a visita, cervejaria de ótima qualidade nas suas cervejas.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
Found this place by accident. A very short walk from the hotel where my co-workers and I were staying.
The bartenders here definitely know their beers and what snacks to pair with them.
We went to Three's just about every night were in Brooklyn.
I totally understand why the place was busy every night we went the two weeks we were in Brooklyn.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: More kids than adults, running around screaming. Absolutely never again, horrible brewery experience. We plan vacations around breweries and we’re super disappointed with this one. Wedding downstairs, daycare upstairs.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: A super neighborhood craft bar with great beer and super bar food.  Nice atmosphere, and NOT overpriced!
reviewTitle: Check it out!  Nice place for beers and bar food.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Alright bar space, they serve their local brews as well as other cocktails and they have a small food menu.  There was nothing memorable on the beer list for me.  Nice hang out spot, but average for the beer.  Staff was all very friendly.  They stay very busy on the weekends.  If you are interested in the beer only, then just make your way to the bar.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Stopped in here before the Islanders game at the Barclay Center.  It was a little busy at first and couldn't find a place to sit, but were convinced to stay by a staff member and ended up with a seat at the bar.  Very glad we stayed.  Great beers and atmosphere!  Even came back after the game for a couple more beers and phenomenal burgers!
reviewTitle: Stopped in before the game, then back again after!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Nice place to visit. A lot of good beers here and the food was excellent - I think I had a breakfast burrito or something like that and it was out of this world. The one thing with this place was the layout of the bar leads to it just lacking a small bit in atmosphere. Overall, I would highly recommend this place.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Enjoyed a few brews and food- All good nice vibe.... nice laid back friendly place and good menu.. the beer went well with the sausage/brat and also the baguette and sardibes
reviewTitle: Enjoyed a few brews and food-

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Zowel binnen als buiten heel sfeervol. Heerlijke IPA op, wat bijzonder is, omdat ik over het algemeen niet van IPA’s houd. Ook een hapje gegeten. Ik nam de hot chicken.. daar mag je wel een pitcher bij bestellen om te blussen. Wel goed op smaak!
reviewTitle: Sfeervol, lekkere IPA’s en prima eten

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Visited this place on the way back to our accommodation and just wanted to pop in for a quick drink. We were informed that strollers weren’t allowed but they could store them and when we asked whether they had high chairs they didn’t. This seems a bit crazy either not let children in at all or get high chairs. Shame the place looked ok inside.
reviewTitle: No Strollers/Prams allowed but no high chairs

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: 日本のテレビでも紹介された事がるブルワリー。食事をしながらクラフトビールを飲むことが出来ます。店内は広くゆったりとしています。ハンバーガーも美味しかったです。

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
Nice neighborhood watering hole.
Stopped in 4 of the 6 nights I was in Brooklyn for a beer after work.
Very friendly staff. Bartenders are engaging  and know the beers on tap well.
I was told that this wasn't a neighborhood bar but beg to differ.
I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Brooklyn

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: 食事も提供する醸造所。食事メニューは入ってすぐ右手にあるフードカウンターでオーダー。ビールはその奥のバーカウンターで注文します。家族連れも多く、醸造所といよりカジュアルレストランのような雰囲気でした。

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Visited here as we were staying in the area and we love craft beer. This place had a lively atmosphere but wasn’t overly crowded for a Saturday night and we could get a seat which was great. Good range of beers on tap which were super tasty. Definitely check this place out
reviewTitle: Great selection of beer on tap

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Casual atmosphere with a local neighborhood vibe.  They have a big screen for game time.  We ordered a burger and fries.  Good not great.  Go for the beer!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Had an awesome time. Burger was excellent and could not get enough of their craft beer. Recommend for anyone in the area.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: The beer was awesome! They had good cocktails and wine too. The food is delicious and at a counter so it is fast. They are attached to a coffee bar as well, so you can get breakfast and coffee and slide right into lunch and beer. Good service, but it was already super crowded early in the afternoon. Highly recommend for hanging out with friends or meeting to celebrate. Reasonable prices too!
reviewTitle: Great beer and food - full bar and even coffee! - crowded!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Si te va la cerveza craft no puedes dejar de visitar esta Brewery. Buenísimas ipas y puedes llevarte latas a buen precio. También tienen cocina.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: I am not a fancy beer type of person at all. We went here before a WWE event at the Barclays center and boy I am impressed. This place is so chill and modern yet rustic mechanical. I loved the way its laid out so much room to just hang. So many great beers on tap and the food was excellent. Love the individual bathroom stalls with the barn doors. Go visit this gem you wont be sorry.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: This is a great place to stop by to get some beer. On the second floor is a small shop where you can buy beer to take home. Definitely worth a visit!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
フランス人の友達に教えてもらった小さなカフェ。
NYで1番美味しいクロワッサンと教えてもらったお店がなくなって残念だったけど、ここの店員さんとても親切で美味しいクロワッサンでした。
コーヒーと一緒で$5.5と17：30以降はパンが半額になるのも教えてもらって感謝。
また来まーす。

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
