reviewText: I took the croissant class, so much fun! We made a lot of croissants and then rolled out the dough. They fit a lot of information into a relatively short class.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Millefeuille has the best pastries available in New York city. It's as if you are in Paris, from their flaky croissants, to their scrumptious macaroons. You will enjoy their food! Chef Clement is amazing!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Macrons are tricky to get right and this baking class gave me all the answers. The instructor, Clem, was a fun, knowledgeable guy who made the class super enjoyable!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The teacher was very knowledgable and patient. He explained everything very well. I would really like to go to another class.
reviewTitle: Great class! My skills really improved!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Enjoyed the macaron class very much. Clement was a great teacher and the results were delicious, terrific couples activity but going solo was great also.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: 牛角麵包很好吃，馬卡龍像是店裡的招牌，因此也買了一些來試試，還不錯，外殼酥酥的配上不會太甜膩的內餡，很棒。

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
So, I was hoping to really like this place.  After eating so many great pastries in Paris, seeing the menu and reviews here had me really excited.  Overall the pastries were just ok.  The chocolate croissant was good...though a little tough.  The mille-feulle was good.  The other two pastries were a little lacking.

If I was in the area, I would shop here occasionally, but I wouldn't go far out of my way.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My first time baking. Class started on time. The chef was patient and hands on with all of as. Friendly and professional. Explained the baking process to until I understood it got to see the process and do it from start to finish. Went home with delicious eats. Super Grateful

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We stopped in to warm up on a cold day recently and had coffee.  While waiting, we looked at the many fresh pastries, which appeared to be really good, and the bread, which looked good and also very reasonably priced.  The coffee was truly exceptional.  Too many places make bitter or sour tasting expresso that needs to be covered over with milk to get it down.  The basis for  the latte here is wonderfully smooth, chocolaty tasting espresso that would stand on its own, and that mades some of the best lattes ever.  Will continues to stop here whenever we are nearby.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: This was one of the most engaging and enjoyable cooking classes that my daughter has ever attended despite the chef’s trouble with English

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My fiance and I went to the Macaroon Baking Classes here and it was a great experience. Vincent was a great teacher! Not only is the class fun and informative, you also get to bring home a few dozen macaroons that you made.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I took the macaron class I had a lot of fun and the macarons turned out delicious. I will maybe come back and bring a friend for the croissant class:)

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Croissant making class was a joy! Really good value for the knowledge and food you get to take home!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Very poor experience with baking classes. 1. Kitchen was very small, without sufficient equipment for the participants - tucked away into the corner of the cafe2. The chef in-training had a strong accent and was unclear in directions3. All ingredients were pre-measured4. The experience was cut short for some, as the chef would demonstrate the technique on a participants macarons, rather than have his own demo station5. Grossly overpriced6. The complimentary tea / coffee with macarons were never honored.Based off this experience, I would not recommend any class.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I went with my daughter and we had so much fun.  Our instructor was charming and engaging.  Will definitely do it again.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: 미국 그것도 뉴욕같은 디저트의 천국에서 크로와상 베이킹 수업을 들을 수 있다니.. 정말 꿈만 같은 일이었습니다! 감사합니다.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Fantastic class! The teacher is a pastry chef who works at a Michelin starred restaurant in Paris. It's a small group, and after taking this class you will be able to make croissants on your own. Every step is taught thoroughly. And it's also fun. Would highly recommend taking this class

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The class was excellent! The instructor Vincent was great and patient with all of us as we went through the step by step process of baking macarons. Had a great time with a yummy parting gift. Would definitely recommend!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I was grateful for Mille Feuille's flexibility in scheduling a class for two of my children, and both enjoyed the experience. Olivier was excellent and gracious, and both my son (13) and daughter (15) gained valuable knowledge & skill that they've already applied to their at-home baking interests and projects.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
Comida muy buena
Servicio bueno
Ubicacion buena
Precio/calidad muy bueno
Los huevos estaban muy bien preparados y la onda del local era buena a pesar de ser algo incómodo (sobre todo para el coche).
Es muy razonable de precios para el sector

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Nous arrivons tout juste de Montréal par le bus. Et notre arrêt est au Pure Bistro pour un super brunch. Après ce long trajet en bus nous avions faim et nous n'avons pas été déçues. Un accueil très courtois et chaleureux. Le jus d'orange est divin ainsi que les smoothies. J'ai choisi une omelette au fromage elle était excellente. Laissez vous tenter, ça vaut vraiment le coup. !

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
A colleague and I decided to lunch here. The restaurant was completely empty and, from what I could see, their focus was lunch deliveries. It took some time for someone to notice and seat us. We each ordered their skirt steak that was served with garlic spinach and mashed potatoes. The food was good but not spectacular. The server got us steak knives but no forks - like I said earlier, their focus was else where.

I also liked the fact that just outside the restaurant they had a water dish and snack dish for dogs. Overall, not bad.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Happened upon this place for breakfast this past weekend.  Great menu for brunch/breakfast with really good eggs (local).  Turkey bacon only, but still good.  Coffee was really good. Loved the loft like interior and decor.
reviewTitle: Excellent food & Atmosphere in great part of Brooklyn

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Let me be brief. Glad to have found this place. Went there for a Sunday lunch and had marvelous fresh, tasty, and healthy food. Casual, with a nice coffee bar, which also serves wine and beer (only bottled beer), low music, and brick walls. Menu is vast (veggies, burgers, sandwiches) and prices are great. We had delicious sweet potato fries ($3.5 - only available for limited day time I think), grilled chicken caesar salad (salad $8 + chicken $5) and a CBLT (chicken BLT - $8!) - you can share everything as portions are generous. Coffee was delicious as well. I do not live in the area but will definitely make a trip to Pure Bistro.
reviewTitle: Excellent for Lunch. Bottled Beer Only. Amex or Cash Only.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: On a quiet Tuesday mid morning stroll on Brooklyn, Pure was quiet and peaceful. Staff was very friendly, polite and attentive. I had the Avocado morning wrap and my husband had the County omelette. Both were beautifully presented, tasty and both accompanied with sweet potato home fries. I had a wonderful time here and all the ingredients are healthy and organic. Definitely recommend!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: A very friendly neighborhood restaurant with fresh foods that are well prepared. I love the Greek wrap with grilled chicken! Comes with a side salad. They deliver and are always nice!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: This is a great place for lunch!  I had the hawaiian salmon burger and it was sooooo good. They deliver, too!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Very fresh ingredients; cooked well to bring out the flavour of the fish; salad is very tasty and certainly big enough! Love their emphasis on healthy foods! A thoroughly enjoyable lunch! Attentive service!

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText: Pure Bistro is a nice little neighbourhood restaurant. The burgers are terrific. Friendly service. Family oriented. A little noisy.

placeAddress: 88 5th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11217-4644
reviewText:
I was a bit shocked that a place with so many different types of burgers on the menu doesn't offer french fries.  Instead they sell sides of mashed potatoes for $4, and that is what I ordered, along with a $9 Portobello Burger.  I also had a Paradise Smoothie (pineapple, strawberry and banana) for $4.50.

The burger was good.  Not among the best burgers I've had, but good. One problem with it, though, was that the bun was so thick that I could hardly fit it in my mouth.  It came with a small amount of salad that was fit for animal grazing. 

I can say that the smoothie was outstanding.  I give the smoothie five stars.

The mashed potatoes were mashed potatoes.  I made a mistake ordering them - I was in shock after being told that they did not have french fries. 

The interior has two rooms.  The side I lunched on had one brick wall and another with black designs on a white background.  The table tops were laminated thick wood.  There was a long copper-coloured air shaft running along the ceiling.

I suspect that they don't have fries due to health concerns as this seems to be one of those places that sells organic stuff and all that allegedly healthy crap.  But if that's what you're looking for (I'm not), this is a good place to get it.
reviewTitle: Good Food and Great Smoothies for the Health Conscious

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Really my rating is 4 1/2 stars. This café is cute, charming, cheery, and relaxed. The food is very good and a great value. 

I’m only deducting a half star because I got there right after they opened (11:00 AM), ordered the fried chicken sandwich (which is really more of a giant chicken schnitzel) and it was out in less than five minutes. So kudos for the quick service –  because I had a matinee show – but the french fries were clearly preheated from earlier that day or even the day before. They were greasy and unappetizing. This is a travesty at a Belgian cafe! 

Otherwise I have absolutely no complaints. My server was wonderful, the waffle ice cream dessert was fantastic, they did not rush me , and everything was an amazingly good value for the theater district. I will definitely be back!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Nous  avons trouver ce bar totalement par hasard et nous avons été très bien reçu en français .

A la carte , il y a les principales bières belges.

Je vous le conseille .
reviewTitle: Bar belge top à 5 minutes e Time Square

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Friendly and welcoming place. Excellent service and food to match. We ordered fresh fruit with our omelets and got a generous, and beautifully plated serving of ripe blueberries, raspberries and strawberries in December! Close to Bryant Park and in the theater district. Reasonably priced too.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Here for a pre theatre lunch, we needed to eat quickly to make our show. The food was served promptly after we ordered and it was delicious. We enjoyed croque tomato  (a croque monsieur with tomatoe), French fries, salad and Belgian waffle with cream and berries. Cozy spot with a bar, a few TVs for sports watching , a nice menu and good service.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: The gluten free menu is almost 100% served with fries from a non-dedicated fryer. Therefore, this really isn’t a GF menu that anyone can count on. Bummer because the fries smelled delicious. I highly suggest that BXL just make their fryer dedicated to fries (since they come with absolutely everything!) and skip the one or two other menu items that ruin it all with cross-contamination.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: BXL is local Belgian bar restaurant with old world charm. The beer selection is impressive and the mussels and fries are the best I have had in NYC.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Friendly staff and great environment!  It’s a quiet spot if you want a quick bite and beer.  In the theater district but not close to the craziness of Times Square.
reviewTitle: Belgian beer and bites in the theater district.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Typisch Belgisches Flair.
Die Bedienung war sympatisch und einfach. trotz grossem Andrang wegen Pausenbesuch vom Theater ging es zügig.
Wir werden wiederkommen.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Op aanraden van de bartender K gaan eten savonds. We hadden niet gereserveerd, maar er is niet al te veel plaats dus best online reserveren.

Voldoende keuze waarbij we de steak-friet en balletjes in tomatensaus hadden genomen. De gerechten waren lekker. Enkele biertjes genomen zoals de Delirium Red, Tremens, Gulden Draak en de lokale biertjes geproefd die best oké waren.

Prijs/kwaliteit oké. De bieren uiteraard wat duurder maar het is import ;) en de gerechten zelf zijn de prijs.

Aan de toog is er wat meer lawaai dan in de eetruimte.

Met dank aan Kenneth en de leuke service ;)
reviewTitle: Lekker eten en uiteraard de beste biertjes van de wereld

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
I had been to BXL for a business lunch, and we had good food and service at the time. Hence decided to suggest it for dinner with my boyfriend. The food was still good, but the service was awful.

We had a waiter that didn’t write anything down when we ordered, came back a while later to ask what beer had been ordered as well as what entree one of had ordered. Finally got the beer, then my boyfriend entree came out but not mine.

Waited and waited and then asked where it was. Another person working there said they had forgotten to put the dressing in the side so that was what took so long ( presumably because the waiter hadn’t remembered it). 

We had asked for bread since we saw it another table and it looked really good (it was, when we finally got it). Another waiter checked on it for us and said it had 1.5 minute to go, as it was freshly baked. It was about 10. Minutes late when we asked a busboy if he knew where our bread was, and he brought it out.

Also had to ask someone else for water. The waiter had come to fill our glasses when we asked for it, but noticed something else must have been in his pitcher when he poured it, so he took the pitcher and the glass away with him,  but never came back. Again, had to ask someone else to bring a glass and water.

Maybe they are better staffed during lunch on weekdays, as that was a much better experience than this one, though the food is good.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Great burgers, pate, mussels, beer, ambiance! Reasonable prices for NYC! Perfect location for theatre goers and Times Square visitors

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Authentic Belgian food in NYC - we had croquettes, moules frites, meatballs and lots of chips and mayonnaise!  Big generous servings so no room for dessert.  Will have to go back!  Super friendly service too.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Nice little Belgian restaurant, highly recommended. Especially the onion soup. A very good beer menu and typical Belgian flair

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Pre theatre dinner always pleases. Staff is friendly and efficient. Mussels are yummy and burgers juicy and cooked as ordered. The pâté is to dye for. Since it’s a Belgian cafe, only Belgian beer is served but all cocktails are available. 
We’ve been here many times and it never disappoints.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: BXL Zoute is a Belgian neighborhood spot good for a beer or wine. Early this week, I ate mussels and fries and found the mussels to be ample but the fries were dismal. I prefer shoe string fries. Dessert of the Gauffre de Liège was plated with berries. Service is good but I doubt if I will return as I far prefer it to Boucherie where the moules frites are superb.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
A cool Belgian bar and restaurant with great draft Belgian beer

Food: Tried both the Carbonade Flamande (beef stew) and the Stoemp & Chipolata (sausage plate). Both were very good. Would have been nice to have some greens on the plates.  

Beer: Fantastic draft Belgian beer! The Cuvée BXL is a nice amber ale. The Chimay Cinq Cents is excellent. And The St. Bernadus Abt 12 on draft is liquid perfection. Too bad no Chimay blue label on draft…

Service: Decent service, nice folks 

Ambiance: small European pub

Overall cleanliness:  average 

Bathroom cleanliness: below average
reviewTitle: A cool Belgian bar and restaurant with great draft Belgian beer

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Great selection of beers. However, I thought the food (even the carbonade and the mussels) was a weak imitation of real Belgian cuisine. Very noisy in the bar area toward the front, but it's somewhat quieter toward the rear.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Super bar belge authentique à deux pas de Times Square. De vrais belges sont à l'œuvre, et on y trouve naturellement un grand choix de bières belges. La carte propose des plats belges, dont bien sûr les moules frites (excellentes les frites). Les Frites viennent avec de la mayonnaise maison.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: While it's branding itself as a Belgian meal and pub experience, we were just here for a beer later on in the evening.  The bar itself is more or less typical Manhattan;  long and narrow, and relatively small.  Even late in the evening there were people ordering food, but we stuck to the beer, and had a fine experience.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Zuerst einmal stimmen die Preise auf der TripAdvisor Seite überhaupt nicht mehr;(leider)
Ein Chimay vom Fass kostet nun 13$, und zwar ein kleines Gläschen(0,3l Schlückchen, würde ich schätzen)
Ich habe den Burger bestellt: trockenes, durchgebratenes Fleisch ohne jeglichen Geschmack! Fade und nur lauwarme Pommes.
Mein Kollege hatte das typisch Belgische Meatballs Gericht. Nach der ersten Kostprobe verzog er das Gesicht! Mein Kollege sollte das beurteilen können, da er Belgier ist…
Der eine kleine Punkt geht an das nette Interieur, das diese Kneipe eigentlich ganz gemütlich macht. Würde aber trotzdem nicht mehr dort verweilen wollen!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
This is a popular, trendy restaurant. It’s not your typical American diner. The portion sizes are just right and the quality of food excellent. Staff are attentive, smartly dressed and friendly.
Nice place to chill & eat!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I love this place 
VERY cool spot with cool looking staff
I had 3 different versions of mac and cheese!!
Super duper Pancakes and great eggs 
Lovely service very attentive 
YOU must go to the toilet it's just wonderful
It's a black tiled disco palace!!
Great great great 
Go Go Go

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: As tourists to the area, a local had recommended this place, and we were glad she did.  Great service and food was delicious.  I had a burger and it was perfectly cooked and the fries were lovely.  Great children's menu too.  And very reasonably priced for the location.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Wonderful location in the heart of Chelsea. Had an incredible Chicken Paillard dish and fantastic mashed potatoes. Sat across from Keith Urban and his kids. Family friendly and terrific food & service!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: My wife and I met our niece for lunch. Every one liked their food. My burger was juicy and cooked medium. They did garble one order but quickly made it right. We sat partially inside at the edge of the patio. All in all a pleasent lunch not to expensive recommended

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I have eaten here 4 times in the past 4 weeks,  I have returned so many times as the food is excellent, the service is professional and the servers are extremely friendly. The most important thing for us is that Cafeteria has a terrace, they are extremely dog friendly and they bring out water and treats for our dog before anything else.

The food is fresh and flavor some and the price is reasonable. In all the meals I have eaten everything has been perfect, no errors in the order and food is always well presented.

We are happy to have found Cafeteria at 119 7th Avenue and will return frequently.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Terrible terrible service . Discrimination on a whole other level as my gay , female black friend was refused entry in sweatpants while  a white man was seated in shorts and a sports jersey. There was no signage only managers word he couldn’t accommodate us.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We order delivery from here more than eat-in; the food menu is like a high end diner and quality is impressively good; and delivery is fast.  Love their calamari salad and chicken and waffles💓. When eat-in, service is good.  Late night gets super loud and too-partying for me 😜

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Ci siamo fermati per fare colazione con la mia famiglia e devo dire che ci siamo trovati benissimo.personale ultra gentile,piatti ottimi, forse un po’ lento il servizio ma va bene così ! Rapporto qualità prezzo ottimo

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We had 40 minute wait despite being told it would be 20 minutes.  Had Cobb portabello - same Cobb ingredients minus the meat and with a grilled portobello mushroom ($15).  First salad arrived with chicken that the waiter at first insisted was not chicken.  He took it back to the kitchen and then arrived with a salad with the mushroom.  Loaded with blue cheese - way too much.   Not a great salad.  Veggie burger ($15) was okay - upcharge of $1 for sweet potato fries.  Malbec by the glass - $11.  Too long a wait, too crowded, too loud and so-so food.
reviewTitle: Long weekday wait, not worth it

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Late breakfast with family during the week.  Very unique as far as breakfast options go.  Staff was very attentive and very friendly.  The macaroni and cheese spring rolls are a must have.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We decided to try out Cafeteria for brunch.  Orange Blood Spritzer, Avocado Toast, eggs over easy. The avocado toast was simply amazing!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Enjoyed a great brunch: good food and friendly service.  And the atmosphere is fun, with a mixed crowd.
reviewTitle: Great diner with good food and cool vibe

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Visited this eatery with my nephew first & and really enjoyed a late breakfast. Returned for another visit with my nephew, niece & two small children . Loved the edgy atmosphere, quick & friendly service. We also indulged in a few Morning Glory cocktails .well we were on holiday . I would definitely recommend a visit .

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Very enjoyable spot. Upscale, genuine food and service. We had two orders of Avocado Benedict with lemon hollandaise on great rustic bread. Coffee is excellent.  Mood is just right for a meeting or friendly visit

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: It has been a while since my last visit to this institution - all is how I remember. Amazing food, great service, but it is loud. Definitely not ideal to have a conversation.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We had a nice late afternoon lunch here after my niece tried on wedding gowns at nearby Kleinfled. We were tired and hungry and this restaurant fit the bill. It was crowded at 3:30 PM but we had the quieter back room to ourselves.  
We ordered the quiona bowl with grilled portebello mushroom, veggie burger, and hamburger.  All portions were ample and the food was very good.  We all enjoyed the modern comfort food and contemporary decor. The service was good.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Service was good. Our waiter was really lovely and was just enough attentive without hovering. Meatloaf was really tasty and I was happy with my meal. My friend’s calamari salad looked great and she was happy with it.  They bring biscuits as a starter. The noise level is a bit loud but this is typical these days. If in the neighborhood, I would eat here again.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: è il posto dove Carrie Bradshaw protagonista di sex and the city con le sue amiche storiche andava a mangiare per colazione cena e pranzo spesso !! posto molto carino ! personale giovane e friendly !

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I've been there several times and thoroughly enjoyed it each time. The menu is a cross between a diner and a fine restaurant. The cool factor is that the diner items are raised to a fine dining level.  The decor is impressive (don't miss the downstairs rest room), and the staff is friendly and helpful.  I asked our server for a wine suggestion to pair with my main dish and it was spot on.

The only drawback, and why I gave it a '4' rating and not a '5' is that the restaurant is very noisy.

By the way, Cafeteria is open 24/7. I advise reservations for dinner.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
First night on Staten Island we were looking for something besides pizza to eat because we wanted to save that for the city. I found this place on my GPS, and we decided to give it a try. I am so glad did because everyone loved their food. I got a chicken sandwich without the bun; my husband got the Monte Cristo. The kids got tenders, sandwiches, and ice cream and everything was delicious. I know because I tested everyone's food! 

The restaurant was clean, bathrooms were clean, and the service was good.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
YUUUGE Menu! We ate here for breakfast but the other meals coming out looked great,too-generous quantities piled on large plates-
Breakfast was fine and reasonably priced.  One of our party didn't care for the homefries, thought they weren't crisp enough, but I thought they were good...
Good for large groups and families.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Good size portions - would highly recommend the Eggs Benedikt as it was delicious.  They have a huge menu which is very reasonably priced.  As a Londoner I found the food portions very generous indeed !

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: The menu is "a small novel" with so many selections and variety from sandwiches to surf and turf. Every table gets a slaw and chickpea starter complimentary. Service is exceptional. Food was okay. I can see how breakfast would be stellar but dinner was okay. Filets mignon was ok. The portions are mammoth but as mentioned, taste is ok.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
We have been here before and are completely satisfied with the food. Sometimes, the service is lacking but today it was spot on. 
I had the Reuben. Very lean corned beef. My mother-in-law ordered the fried fish. This is not the first time she's had it. She is always happy with this sandwich. My husband had the Italian chicken panini. He enjoyed it. Good food, good portions fair prices.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: We has lunch, the food and service was very good. the hamburger was very big along with a lot of French fries. My wife enjoyed the eggplant wrap also with a large amount of French fries.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Very nice and quaint place to eat.  I love the older style dinner layout.  Can't say enough about how delicious breakfast was.  Eggs over easy with corn beef hash, artichoke omelette, and egg bagel sandwich were delicious!   Will was great!  Very helpful and not pushy.  Thanks Will!   A place that we will visit again.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Typical Greek diner with a huge extensive menu. Evreything here is always good. We always get served very large portions. It always seems crowded no matter when we come, but never seem to wait for a table. This place is very family friendly, with a stack of coloring books and crayons for kids to pick from. Only down side is Mikes Unicorn seems to keep getting more expensive every time we go. The servers are always busy, but pleasant. I would absoulutly recommend this diner to freinds and family.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: 6 of us had breakfast there yesterday. Waitress was very friendly and service was very quick. Coffee and iced water just kept coming! Food was plentiful and delicious, pancakes, waffles, eggs over easy, bacon etc. Normal and sugar free syrup, strawberries and cream. We loved it!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Well I have to admit I've been here quite a few times for breakfast, and the service never changed. They are always so welcoming and attending.  The atmosphere is great and so is the food.  They have a grand menu so its a bit complex to just pin-point exactly what to eat when you have nothing specific in mind.  Again great service great food and very lax atmosphere. Can't ask for anything in the morning.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Reception/seating friendly & efficient, waitress got the job done to a mediocre level, food was very good and also a very good value. Unicorn is still a good bet.
reviewTitle: Unicorn Diner still a good, solid diner experience

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: I have eaten at this diner with myself and a friend or as a meeting place for ten of us.  Either way the service and food are on target.  My favorite is the beef stew.  The portion is so large I take the extra home for another meal.  The wait staff is very accommodating with requests and corrects any errors immediately.  When you have a large group order mix-up are bound to happen.  A friend of mine eats here twice a week with her husband.  Good prices-especially with specials.  Lots of dessert choices too.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: I have been here couple of times. People working there weren't very nice,dishes and especially portions were pretty big,and also tasted good. I was there for breakfasts,they were pretty pact. The fact that they are working -open for 24 hours doing it's job) and also the location not bad too busy area.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
Our family of 4 ate here for breakfast. Service was prompt and efficient. 

I enjoyed Corned Beef Hash and Eggs, which came potatoes and toast. My husband enjoyed the Lox and Bagels ( lettuce , onion, tomato) . The food was flavorful and the portions were large - I ended up taking half of mine home . A diner atmosphere with plenty on the menu for variety - a nice change from the usual chain restaurants.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: I ordered a large order for my family who had been traveling all day and was exhausted... I was told it would be an hour and a half and that was ok because it was rainy and cold and my grand babies were asleep already. The food got to my hotel after an hour but they wouldn't bring it up to my room so I went down...she said " I am just doing a favor and I don't have a card machine either " I told her I was told they would bring it up and would take cards. She was quite rude like I would know from Texas that she was not prepared for me to spend over 90.00 for food!!  The food was cold and although I was excited about New York food I was let down about everything being being bland and cold!! So..thanks to you guys for letting me know where I will not eat again while visiting New York!!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Hadn't been here in a while and used to love it.  The service was terrible, the waitress was impatient and disinterested.  I ordered grilled cheese, which was supposed to come with Cole slaw and a pickle.  I got neither.  My friend ordered pancakes, which got cold  before we could get the waitress's attention to bring syrup.  Coffee and water refills were non-existentent.  Probably will never go back.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
With a location on Victory Blvd just a minute from the Staten Island Expressway, this province of the Mike's Diner empire did a good job. Incredibly large menu, and this time, excellent service. Everyone enjoyed their food. The place was fairly full on a Friday evening, but unlike some other Staten Island diners, this one has a large parking lot. It, too, was pretty full, but we found a space without having to wait. 

So if you're crossing Staten Island, just take the Victory Blvd. exit, go toward the College of Staten Island (CSI) and you will see the Unicorn on your left. Turn just before the diner, and you can enter the parking lot, which will be on your left. It is very easy to get back on the expressway in either direction as well.
reviewTitle: A food diner, and very convenient for those crossing between NJ and Brooklyn

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: We have our union retiree's meeting here every 2 weeks.Never had a bad breakfast here.The waitresses are always on the ball.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Went too Christmas Eve dinner with my lady and my dad!!! Food and service was good!!! It is always good to come to this Diner when on Staten Island!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
Our church service starts at 8 pm and don't let out until 10 pm, so one of our biggest problems was where do we eat at this time of the night? especially with a large church group! We thank God for Mikes Unicorn Dinner because it feels like home, the host prepares tables for our congregation kids  and all every Sunday night around 11 pm. 

The place is bright, clean and has a flat screen TV for all to see. The waitress knows us by name so the service is always good! The food is excellent and very fresh, anything I ever tried I really enjoyed and as you will see in the pictures I post I have tried many different dishes and never had a complaint.

But there is one thing I never change and that 's the soup I order, chicken rice with a motzo ball in a it! I like my food very hot and the soup always is, my usual order is a large salad with roman lettuce grilled chicken, portabellas mushrooms, carrots and grilled pita bread and I'm happy with it! 

I once tried a Ham & Swiss club sandwich with fries instead of the traditional turkey club sandwich and it was a pleasant surprise! one afternoon I stopped in for a light lunch and decided to go with the grilled chicken with cottage cheeses and mixed fruit, it was very good and satisfying!

one night I went for dinner and had the 14 oz NY strip cooked medium well it taste like I was in a expensive steakhouse in NYC! I'm also a big fan of french fries and I love to order them pizza style with tomato sauce and mozzarelle cheese which is a meal in it's self! 

And If you want to talk about desserts this is the place for you! NY is famous for their pies cakes & pastries and the unicorn has a great variety to chose from, my two favorites are the fresh banana cream pie and their NY cheese cake topped with real strawberries and coconut trimmings OMG! what a way to end such a great dinner. So I definitely recommend Mike's Unicorn Diner and if you need prayer my church is there on Sunday nights!
reviewTitle: Late Night at Mikes Unicorn Diner

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: reminds me of the old time cabaret settings excellent venue for music and good food.  Wife and I attend often seen many great acts.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
After several stays at the Hilton Garden Inn on Staten Island, I've never been really impressed with the lodgings. After a recent meal in their fancy-schmantzy restaurant, I haven't changed my opinion.
My dish, Chicken Martini, was slightly dried-out, while my partner's short ribs were completely over-cooked. The prices here do not include any sides other than a garnish of carrots and string beans, so I ordered a side of sauteed spinach... for $7 This was a large serving of awful tasting greens.
The staff is strictly high-caliber, wish the food was.
reviewTitle: The Staff---Great, The Meal---Fair to Middling

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Went for a dinner show service was good venue is nice .The food could be better.Very nice place and atmosphere

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We went here to listen to a cabaret music style venue..
The food was really good and it was extremely crowded night that we were there..
Wait staff is extremely friendly.
I felt like I was at some kind of a wedding or something that's the vibe I get it reminds me of a catering hall which is essentially probably is.

I enjoy the music and the vibe and I would recommend this place
reviewTitle: Great place to hang out and have fun

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I walked in and was greeted by the Maitre'd. They had a breakfast buffet going, but I  asked if I  could order a steak instead or was buffet my only option. He said ordering a steak was no problem and turned to the chef on the buffet line and said can you make a turf no surf. Meaning, instead of making the steak and shrimp combo they serve, just make the steak. The chef said okay and I  went to find a seat. 20 minutes later the Maitre'd asked if I  wanted the fruit I was eating while I waited, billed to my room? I was staying in a suite at the Hilton. I said, I'm waiting for my steak. He tells me, they never made my steak, he thought I  was joking, because who has steak for breakfast.  There were some other comments made that I  don't care to include, but long story short, even though the manager called me and apologized, in all honesty I wouldn't feel okay having anyone dine here without letting them know what they could be walking in to. I waited 20 minutes for a steak I never received. Paid $14.95 for fruit. Paid $40.00 for Door Dash to deliver steak and eggs from IHOP. Skip the restaurant and Door Dash it instead.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The chef at this place is amazing.  We ate there twice during our stay at the Hilton.  However, the reason that it did not get a higher star rating was that our service lacked the basics that lead to that higher rating.  Rather than assigning two wait staff to each table, every one was trying to do everything and none of it was done well.  We barely saw our waiter at our table because he was flitting from table to table across the entire room.  The people clearing the table cleared the entire table at the end of our appetizers.  Therefore, they had to replace everything on the table before our entrees came.  We overlooked most of that because of the food.  We had a variety of dished to sample the various dished offered.  Every dish was very good.  Sauces were incredible.  It really took a surreal experience and made it better.  I would definitely come here for the food, just expect chaotic service that overshadows the entire experience.
reviewTitle: Food is excellent. The front of the house needs work.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Located within the Hilton Garden Inn, this restaurant is definitely a nice surprise - a glamorous setting and fine Italian cuisine.  Menu had a lot of variety and some interesting 'twists' on traditional favorites; wine list was good, too.   This hotel is located in a wooded area, so unless you knew about this place, you would not see it from the highway, and so it's a 'hidden gem' of a place, that is worth seeking out.
reviewTitle: A hidden gem on Staten Island

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I was here for a private party this past weekend. The room, food and decor were lovely. Service was efficient and helpful and the food was of fine quality. From my experience this appears to be a great place to host a party or special event. Lorenzo's is conveniently located at the Hilton Hotel and not far from the Staten Island Expressway exit. Parking is plentiful.
reviewTitle: Really good restaurant for a hotel

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: A restaurant that's inside Hilton Garden Inn Hotel. Variety of breakfast and taste good. Friendly waiters.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: After  a long day of driving it was nice to have the option of a nice restaurant in the hotel.  Food service were all very good at dinner.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Went in to get a quick bite. The chicken noodle soup was so good! Ate breakfast there two mornings. They have a buffet. I ordered a special non-fat omelette each morning and they accommodated me with no problem. Staff was very nice and remembered me from one morning to the next.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Hubby and I stayed at the Hilton before our cruise so we went into Lorenzo's for dinner. I had the Linguine Bologanise and hubby had Nonna's Chicken Soup. I want that recipe!! At first I wasn't sure about our server Alex but he ended up being very attentive. I highly recommend eating there.
reviewTitle: Nonna's Chicken Soup was the best.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I was not expecting the hotel restaurant to be so good and found that it is actually a destination restaurant for some of the Islanders.  The ambience is terrific and the food was very good.  Service was excellent as well and I was so surprised to see this level of service and food in the hotel.  Would definitely eat here again!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Food was delicious and plenty of variety.  The service was excellent and the restaurant is very cozy.  Highly recommend

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We had my moms 80th birthday here, a party for 25 people.  From the time we arrived the service was impeccable.  The staff is excellent and even the owner stopped by.  The food was delicious.  Everyone had a great time!
reviewTitle: Was Not Expecting This Level of Service Excellence

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I expected more. I have been to Brunches all over and I just expected that Lorenzo's would offer more variety, more choices, and it didn't. Just your run of the mill bunch, not that there was anything wrong with it. Food was good, Hot for the most part which is nice. The gent making the omelets seemed put out that he had to make them. Maybe a bad day- who knows?
reviewTitle: Standard Bunch was disappointing, Just lie any other

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The hotel we stayed at, contracted with Lorenzo, for a full breakfast. The break fast was just ok. When food is kept in steamers, it sort of over soften the food, especially the patoto's.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We were guest at the Hilton Garden Inn, so this was an easy choice, reviews were good.  We booked a 6:30 reservation on Open Table.  We arrived at 6:30, I told them I had a reservation, he didn't answer and took us to a table.  Waiter came by and asked what drinks we wanted.  I found it odd since we had no wine menu, which I had to ask for. Waiter was obviously distracted with another party going on, so there was a delay for everything.  We skipped wine since it took 10 minutes to get the wine menu.  Special Risotto was Chicken Picatta (chicken breast over risotto with asparagus). It was gross. The rice was just "white rice", not aborrio and not cooked well. Tasked like white rice with cream mixed into it, not well cooked risotto.  Chicken was tender but lacked taste.  Needed lemon desperately and seasoning. Overall: Horrible.  I had a sausage pasta with broccolli raabe.  It was gross.  Floading in a pool of liquid.  I don't think it was brocolli raabe, honestly it appeared to be more like collar greens, cooked to absolute death, total mush, turned brown in color.  Sausage was ok, but it was so saturated by the gallon of liquid it was almost like soup.  Good turnout for America's worst cooks, but far from what you should get at a "fine" restaurant.  This place obviously thrives off parties and events and suckers from the hotel, like us.  Not the restaurant's fault but they seated an annoying couple next to us. The lady laid down on the chairs and talked on the phone the entire time, when she did sit up to eat, she still was having a full blown, full volume conversation going on.   We waited for the check, and told the waiter the food was not good.  Another long wait and the manager brought the check and argued that it was only an hour since we arrived and that we should have said something earlier (and she was probably right, but we try not to complain and make a scene).  She offered to send cookies to our room (we declined) and that was about it.  Not good food, not good service, not good management.  We'll see how our "free" Hilton Diamond Member breakfast turns out in the morning.  I would NEVER EVER EVER EVER recommend this place for dinner.  Its just bad, overpriced, horrible food.
reviewTitle: One of the Absolute Worst Meals of All Time.  Horrible, Disgusting.  NOT GOOD.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Very nice brunch here.  Selection of foods was very large.  Something for everyone.  Lots of delicious desserts.  I am partial to tiramisu and it did not disappoint.  Very busy,but, not overly noisy.  The piano player was excellent.  Servers very attentive,taking plates and refilling glasses promptly.  Fairly expensive at $86.00 for two including tax and tip. Good for now and then. Richard and Lois Nicotra are excellent hosts.
reviewTitle: Curtis High School 50th reunion farewell brunch

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: While staying at the Hilton my husband and I thought we’d try this restaurant.   It was terrific!!  The food was delicious.  I had the Pappardelle. Ribbon pasta like egg noodles with shrimp and scallops...I can’t say enough good things about this dish. Excellent service as well... I was pleasantly surprised...we went to the Brunch on Saturday and the amount of food choices was one of the best I’ve been to.  Will definitely go back!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
My wife and I went for a late dinner (after seeing a taping of the Late Show). Full disclosure, we lived in Antwerp for 3 years, so we know our Belgian food and beer. 

Tons of great Belgian beer options; my wife had a Kriek and I had a Leffe. We both had mussels and fries; mine were Thailandese and hers were traditional Marinieres. We both got a HUGE pot and a lot of fries. The food was delicious. Server (Paul) was fast and friendly.
reviewTitle: A taste of Belgium in NYC!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Oudejaarsavond gevierd bij bxl, lekkere menu.
Goede bediening, vriendelijke mensen, eten goed, warm en lekker. Een aanrader in New York.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Les cocas étaient servis au verre et noyés de glaçons. Le tout pour 10€….La bière consommée, une Chouffe d’environ 30cl était facturée 12€…les boissons sont particulièrement chères. Les plats étaient moyens sans plus mais plutôt à prix corrects. Dommage que les frites étaient trop cuites.
Les TIPS nous ont été imposés sans que l’on ait eu à choisir.
Il y a de bien meilleures adresses à NYC pour manger en tout cas et ce moment à table a plutôt été une mauvaise expérience contrariante. On est en tout cas très loin de ce que l’on peut trouver en Belgique  malheureusement

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Les ribs étaient bonnes mais pas exceptionnel. Les sauce sont vraiment bonnes.
La Marguerita juste délicieuse.
Le lieu est typiquement New-Yorké.
A faire

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
We went for a Monday night special of bottomless mussels with complimentary beers.
There were a choice of traditional and cosmopolitan broths that the mussels were served in. 
The mussels were world class dish (having eaten this specialty seafood dish in Paris, London and Australia) 
Bottomless meant we could try out a couple of different broths for fun.
There were loads of warm bread and butter to complement the dish.
There is a timeless, Belgium Pub ambience in the decor and with Portraits of former Kings of Belgium.

It is World FA Cup Final time so Guests both young and old could watch the latest Games on TV screens that did not detract from the dining experience as though accessible to watch were unobtrusive for those wishing just to dine and chat.
Candle-lit Tables with Service by friendly, dedicated Staff made it a unique dining experience to savour.
reviewTitle: Unique New York, Belgium Pub experience!!!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
I don’t know which was worse, the service or the food. French Onion soup consisted of bland dishwater with leftover bread slice so soggy you could hardly tell it was there, and tasteless onions. This is supposed to be a Belgian place so you’d assume they could at least do mussel well, but they don’t. Broth had a weird taste and they use very cheap, rubbery mussels. The service was horrendous. Had to ask for my bread for the mussels three times. They never filled the water carafe. Had to beg for a menu to order a dessert. Really awful service. The “Belgian” meatballs were just Italian style meatballs only much, much harder and dense as a goofball. 
Seriously, find somewhere else to go before that show.
reviewTitle: A lousy experience across the board

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
This is a great traditional pub and it feels like just sitting in Belgium while you’re here! The place is much larger than it looks from outside and there lots of seating throughout. Naturally the choice of beers on the menu is extensive and it’s the perfect place for beer lovers, or those looking for something a little more unique. The range of food dishes on offer is equally varied, with portion sizes good for the price and service being fast, for both food and drinks. 

Overall it’s something different in the area and with the atmosphere and nice vibe inside somewhere I’d happily return!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Wat een geweldige zaak. Bomvol zonder reservering en toch een plekje krijgen. Zelfs een groep van 8. Moesten andere gasten even verhuizen. Super vriendelijk en gastvrij. Een soort van even thuiskomen in hectisch NY

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
We didn't eat here but we did stop off here for a nightcap on several nights on the way back to our hotel.

Good choice of beer - expensive, of course, this is Manhattan! But it's nice little bar and though we didn't try the food - it smelt amazing.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Fantastic service and delicious food and yes the french fries with mayonnaise are fantastic. I will be back to try the incredible Belgian beers on tap.
reviewTitle: Great food Great Value Great service

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Veel te veel lawaai om rustig te eten, 
Eten en drinken was veeeel te duur voor wat het was. 1x Mosselen + 1x steak + stella 0,5 l + cola = 107$
reviewTitle: Veel te duur voor wat het was

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Découvert par hasard en nous promenant. Étant belge et légèrement chauvin nous avons réservé une table après avoir constaté une très bonne note sur TripAdvisor. 
A la carte entre autre les carbonnades à la flamande. 
Nous nous laissons tenter. 
Une excellente cuisson, une viande de qualité. La sauce aurait pu être légèrement plus épaisse mais cela n’est qu’un détail. 
Pour la petite un spaghetti bolognaise avec un vrai hachis. 
Excellent repas. Je recommande cette adresse.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
2 karmeliet 1 kriek bijna 50 euro
Te gek voor woorden
Uitbater hautain.         
Bediening zelf was meer dan in orde

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
I made an OpenTable reservation for 1:00 PM after attending a rehearsal of the New York Philharmonic. If you are a patron of the orchestra you can request two rehearsal tickets a year. A great experience.

Unfortunately the dining experience was not as expected. I arrived at 12:45 and told reception that I had a reservation. She looked it up and took me to a two top in a facility that was about 50% full. The next morning I got  a dunning email from Open Table indicated I was not a responsible person for not canceling the appointment. I emailed OT the receipt number and name of the server. They replied they would let the restaurant know that their staff was incompetent.

I ordered the Moules Provençale, a dish that I have had any times in Brussels which the restaurant attests to as being their main product and ethnic origin.
 
Erin, my somewhat efficient server, brought the dish out about ten minutes later. The mussels had properly opened under the steaming process, but the cook then proceeded to douse the dish with cold garnishings and sauce. I ate about 5 and gave up. The frites that came with the dish were fine. In Belgium this product comes with half a loaf of French bread to soak up some of the sauce. No bread.

Erin asked how I liked the dish. I told her it was cold. Her reply “I will tell the chef”. I think the “chef” already knew that. No offer to adjust the bill of $43.55 which included their house brewed beer.

Don’t waste your time here.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
We ate at the BXL (read Bruxelles) with our 13yo daughter one evening, did not really know what to expect and were happily surprised.

The owner was super friendly, explained the various options on the menu (some being standard e.g. pasta carbonara, others typical dishes from Belgium e.g. Carbonate flamande = beef stew with brown beer) 

Everything we had was excellent!! 

So if you are looking for a good reasonably priced restaurant away from the Times Square tourist traps, here is a great option for you to consider.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Staying at Casablanca or any area hotels or in for a day, good option. Great pub ambiance. Bar seating and tables. Great service.  Nice selection of beers. We had hamburgers- very good. French Fries were not up to par, mushy.  Times Square pricing. Will be back on our next trip. We were too early for all you can eat mussels on Sun. Next Time.
reviewTitle: Tasty Pub Option EZ Walk  Times Square

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Before I went to New York, this is how I imagines a New York bar would be. 
It's buzzing, the atmosphere is electric. 
The owner ( I think that's who he was), was charming and engaging. The table staff were lightning quick. 
The food is delicious, we were only in NY for a few days, but if I had been there for longer I would have gone back lots. 
Well worth a visit. 
I would revisit in a heartbeat. 
I just can't get that lamb sausage baguette out of my head, it was divine.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: What a cool little place!  We went to eat and have a couple drinks before seeing our first show - what a great place!  Food was excellent and drinks were good!  Service was the best we’ve had in NYC!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Located close to time square. They did have seating outside. The bar is in the front entrance with the dining room in the back. There were about 15-20 tables. I thought he music was too loud, but  later it was turned down.
They have a good beer selection. The menu is limited (not a lot, but enough between beef, fish, sandwich options). The server was friendly and helpful. He suggested the mussels or the Belgian beef stew. That is what I was looking at. The stew seemed to be more of a gravy or sauce with the beef. Also came with prunes in the stew. Also served with frites (mayo).
This is an alternate to the usual food options.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
El lugar súper ambientado de europeos. 
Queríamos desayuno y a pesar de que no tienen en el menú nos hicieron lo que queríamos. Delicioso!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
Our second time at this diner, good service and friendly waitresses.
 We love their Greek salad, everything tastes fresh and their tzatziki sauce is the best I've ever had.
I haven't have the opportunity to have other dishes there, but if you are in the mood for a good diner salad, this is the place to go.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: I haven't been here in quite a while...and this will definitely be the last time I return. Ordered a lamb gyro sandwich.  Service was ok.....not great. In a diner there should be no reason my coffee cup is left empty and I have to wait for a refill. There was plenty of meat, but I kept on getting a sand taste in my mouth, which I could not understand why...I'm not a picky person, so didn't complain about the sandwich or the coffee....but what happened afterwards, still makes me sick to my stomach. I went to use the ladies room...If I had a choice of holding it in...I would have. I have NEVER seen a bathroom this disgusting and that is including mall and gas station bathrooms. Broken tile, baseboard heat broken. The room smelled. Toilet tissue all over the place. Cut holes left open in the ceiling, Sprinkler system has foam bulging around it. A big square piece of ceiling was cut out, repaired not painted...You know what on the toilet seat....and last but not least...you could tell that the back of the door was not cleaned in months, if ever....from hand prints, grease...etc... I had trouble keeping the food I just ate down and got out of there right away. You might be asking what I left wondering? What their kitchen looks like.....
reviewTitle: Left sick to my stomach and wondering...

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: Starting first with the waitress Sheila! Very funny, nice and she knows what is good at this diner! There were 3 of us and we each ordered different dinners. Monte Christo excellent! The best French onion soup ever! Waffles with ice cream and whipped cream and chocolate... Wow!! We took her advise and it was yum!! Will go again and again! We will request Sheila! Plus they have a bakery on site, we got Oreo cheesecake..Fantastic!!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: The oreo cheesecake is to die for.  The Turkey Club is huge and filling.  Even the chocolate strawberries are sweet and delectable.

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: The food was very good and portions were large .We were a rather large group and had 2 waitresses .One was excellent but the other was short on patience and had a bit of an attitude .

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: By far the best diner on Staten Island it is newly renovated I had the fish dinner the waitress recommended and it was better than any fancy restaurant I have been too over the years check this place out

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: If your in the area this is the place to go great food great service and all around great experience

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText:
We've come here many times. but the service this time was something of a disappointment. One of the people in our party ordered a club sandwich, which is supposed to come with french fries, cole slaw and pickles, but the last two were not provided. And it was hard to try to ask, and the waiter was one of those who suffers from that eye disease where they don't see the customers and stay away from them. Generally, the food is good, but it was clear that the club sandwich was NOT their strong point, as the meats in it were very fatty. The other meals (belgian waffles, whole wheat pancakes and an omelette were fine, although one request for well-done fries was ignored.

I'm willing to believe that the waiter, and maybe the kitchen, were having a bad day, but if it continues to happen, I'd remind Mike that there are other diners on Staten Islan that aren't part of the Mike's Diner empire, and I can go to them as easily as to the Unicorn.
reviewTitle: Maybe they were having a bad night last night...

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: WE loved our waitress! I forget her name but she was very funny and she knew what we each were going to order just by looking at us! The place was clean and everyone was friendly! The food was so good! My son order the Philly cheesesteak, it was delicious! My daughter and I shared the turkey club..very good!! We were so full we couldn't eat dessert. They had OMG the best homemade desserts. We took a piece of chocolate covered cheesecake back to the room. It was excellent! This is going to be a regular stop on our SI visits!
reviewTitle: Excellent! Generous food portions! Fun staff!

placeAddress: 2944 Victory Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10314-6606
reviewText: I always sit at the counter because my kids like to. People are friendly and professional. Food is good and steady.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Nice place! Small so wait time is long. Good food. We had the fry chicken and avocado toast. All the meals were good. A little issue in the beginning as we were waiting to take our orders but waiter apologized and was awesome for the rest of the lunch.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Fun casual environment split up into three areas- main dining, private room area for big groups and lower level secluded and small bar.
The service was really great and food had interesting twists- Mac chz spring roll, lentil tacos, chickpea fries. Make a reservation on weekends

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
First of all, Cafeteria is ALWAYS open! (Always open 24 hours, unless a very specific day for a good reason) That is very convenient! If you have come back jet lag from a trip and need somewhere open on your time schedule or it is a holiday and you want to find classic American comfort food open, this is definitely the place. 
Second, the food is classic. It is American food. Never amazing and never bad. They always have something on the menu that you would want. 
Finally, very nice staff and easy to get and commute to in NYC. Good location. 

Great restaurant! 
You should definitely go at some point in NY!
reviewTitle: Always a classic good American restaurant!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Use to be trendy many years ago, but now is a local classic.
Food is good. They have amazing mac and cheese in many styles and variations  ...I recommend that.
Is a simple menu, but full of new ideas of classics.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: great / friendly / attentive crew. - food is amazing. best mac n`cheese ever - like their wine menu. a bit pricy, but hey, that´s nyc. definitely again. special thx to michael for the nice table last night ;-)

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Restaurante 24h, ótima opção pós shows e eventos que vão até mais tarde. Local barulhento e serviço um pouco lento.

Peçam os rolls de mac and cheese e o mac attack, que é uma combinação com os três sabores do cardápio (original, trufada e com bacon). Recomendo!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
wir kommen bereits seit ca 15 Jahren regelmäßig in die Cafeteria. Das Ambiente, die Speisen und die Cocktails sind gleichbleibend perfekt. Über diesen Zeitraum kann ich das nicht von anderen Restaurant behaupten. Die Bedienungen sind sehr zuvorkommend. Auf die laute Hintergrundmusik muss man sich einlassen. 
Wir können die Cafeteria nur empfehlen 👍👍👍

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Best place to have a mac&cheese after club. Not the best service but after 4-5am and few drinks, more than happy.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: A New Yorker suggested we meet at the Cafeteria for dinner. The food, service, and incredible Chelsea atmosphere was fantastic. Wonderful evening with family and friends!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I am currently staying in Chelsea and I’ve eaten here a couple of times: a breakfast and a lunch. The servings are huge, the food delicious, and they make the best Bloody Mary’s I have had in a long time. Well worth popping in, they are always open and super friendly.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Amazing food and service. I had the Benedict eggs with avocado. They were delicious. Also, the coffee was very good. Brunch is not a brunch without mimosa so I added to the list. Bathrooms are really cool. Unisex and with lights. No reservations for brunch.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Cafeteria has a great LA vibe. Open 24/7 this restaurant serves comfort food all day in modern digs. 

Sadly the hype stops there. There was a wait when I came with a friend at 2am. Unlike many restaurants that allow you to put your name in, at Cafeteria your told to wait in line on the side of the building. After 20 minutes we were let in to see half the restaurant empty. From there it only got worse. Service was slow, portions were small, and food was ok. 

For half the price I would recommend just going to a standard diner if your out late.
reviewTitle: Poor service and just ok food

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We arrived at the end of the breakfast rush hour. We didn’t have to wait for a table at all, and were assisted in a professional and hospitable manner. The food was good, pancakes look like a very large portion. Carrot cake was delicious. The coffee wasn’t that good, just the regular American slush. 
Though the personnel is friendly, the intervals with which they inform if everything is okay, or that there may be anything else with which they may serve one, is just too frequent and makes one feel a bit awkward. Could I should state here, because our party didn’t let this habit interfere with our visit.
Hence only three dots.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
When I came to NYC, I was eager to go back to this restaurant because I remember the first time I went and the food was delicious. A group of 9 of us booked reservations and we went to the back of the restaurant’s private dining. The area was nice and it was air conditioned. It was so hot at the time I went to NYC so I appreciated the cool air.

Our waiter was super sweet and at one point the manager came over to greet us and she was really nice as well. I order the silver dollar pancakes and it was soooo good! I’m not sure what syrup they used but it was light and added a nice flavor to the pancakes and the fruits. I did order the Rude Margarita but the spicy flavor wasn’t my favorite. It’s definitely an acquired taste. 

Overall, the whole vibe of the restaurant is great and I’ll definitely will be back again.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: My wife and I visited Cafeteria to entertain friends from out of town for lunch. the restaurant offers a great atmosphere for lunch on a summer afternoon. The dining room was cool and breezy from the open windows and bright.the restaurant is simply but attractively decorated. Service was attentive and friendly without being intrusive. the quality of the food is excellent. the cost is not inexpensive but equal to the value offered

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: You may remember this restaurant from sex and the city. I used to go here years ago and it was a total scene. It’s calmed down a little but still great people watching. The food is pretty good. The service is generally good. I love the Cobb salad. The mashed potatoes are very good. I was a little disappointed with their signature meat loaf dish. It’s still a great restaurant and I highly recommend it.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Stopped in here based on remembering sex and the city had filmed some scenes here and we were very pleased with our food. The French roast and waffles both were amazing .. portion sizes are good and service was veru very well. Hats off to the water servers who kept our waters topped up!! Would come here again 💯

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
This is a nice restaurant to go to with your family! 
We arrived without reservation on a Friday 7 pm and they were able to accommodate us, although the place was busy. 
They have a kids menu with 4 items to choose from and then a choice of side order. The kids burger is made fresh and is delicious! 
The regular menu is very diverse, and food gets made with fresh ( season) vegetables . 
All dishes we took were very tasty ( tuna, salad, meatloaf).

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Being a certifiable “mac-and-cheesaholic” I decided to try their sampling of three different Mac and cheeses: Cheddar and Fontina, Smoked Gouda and Bacon, Truffle Oil. All three were amazingly delicious and worth every penny.
reviewTitle: If you like mac and cheese check this place out!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Table wasn't ready for our reservation, food took over an hour to come and waiting staff was not very friendly. Food is decent but not a great experience overall

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I recently took the Hands On Croissant making class at La Mille Feuille. Had a wonderful time and made delicious croissants. Our teacher Clement was adorable. He was so French he needed us to help with his English. Between our limited French and his phone, we managed to communicate just fine. A great group of students. Took home tons of croissants plus more laminated dough to make at home. Highly recommend!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My fiance and I are still reminiscing on our experience with Oliver and his pastry chef from Paris! We spent over two hours learning about macaron ingredients, baking techniques and some secrets of the trade! We mixed, piped, filled and of course ATE our own macarons alongside two of the best french pastry chefs outside of France! If you have an urge to get out of your comfort zone and learn something new I HIGHLY suggest going to Le Mille Feuille and bake some macarons!!! We went home the following day and applied our newly developed skill and baked a successful delicious batch of blueberry lavender macarons! Mission successful! We now can make our macarons at home <3

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Ottimo posto per prime colazioni, colazioni o brunch sia dolci che salate. Da non perdere le baguette alle olive o al bacon.
reviewTitle: Piccola chicca per momenti dolci e salati

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Whether you want to learn to make croissants for a future brunch or just want to have a fun morning and walk away with a delicious bag of warm croissants, this class is great for anyone.  Olivier was a great instructor, showing patience and clarity to the group of diverse skills.

I will savor every croissant with new appreciation, but with the confidence that I can make them at home, too.

Will be taking other classes in the future.
reviewTitle: Greater appreciation and love for croissants now

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My boyfriend bought me a spot in this class for my birthday. I had never been interested in making macarons, but you see them on all the cooking shows/competitions so I appreciated the gesture. Now after having made them, I have a greater appreciation for them. I really enjoyed the class and was amazed at how technical you need to be when making them (which is perfect for me).I must note that you are not doing everything in the class. The dry ingredient are pre-measured when you get there. But beyond that and the actual baking, you do it all. I loved the completely hands on element of the class. There is no better way for me to learn. I really look forward to taking another class from them. Not to mention that the instructor (who was French) was very good :)

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Took the macaron making class with my bf. Was surprised and thrilled to see there was only 8 of us in the class. I have taken cooking/baking classes before that were overcrowded and felt I didn’t get enough attention from the instructor, that wasn’t the case here. This class was totally hands on, the chef/instructor was patient and informative. We left with a big box of Macarons each and the recipes to make them at home. I really enjoyed the class!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My daughter and I had a wonderful time learning to make French macaroons. The chef/owner was polite and professional. The space is very small but we managed. I would recommend it to others.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Instructor Olivier was amazing and class was really fun. I would def take another class again! You get to take home a box of macaroon you made afterwards!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I hosted a client team building activity for 12 people here and it was simply fantastic! We had a private macaron making class that lasted about 2 - 2.5 hours and it was an absolute blast. We each walked away with about 16 macarons that were delicious! Our instructor (and head pastry chef at Le Mille Feuille) was super fun and took his work seriously! We ended up hanging out with him a bit at the end, which was very fun. I highly recommend this class for a group of friends, birthday present, holiday gift, and for clients! I plan on going back to try their other desserts. :)

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
