reviewText: My mom and I recently took the macaroon baking class and had an amazing time. There were 7 total bakers in the class and we made 3 different flavors. Everyone walked away with their own box of self-made macaroons. Great as a gift for a mom, in law, or girls trip!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The Opera almond based pastry was excellent but The cappuccino was all milk. If I’d wanted a latte I would have ordered one.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Very fun class! Olivier, the instructor, was helpful and knowledgable - left with 15 DELICIOUS croissants!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Loved learning to make macarons @Le Mille Feuille.  The pastry chef was wonderful, kind and patient! 8 pupils was a very nice class size, and the finished products came out looking and tasting pretty good too.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I attended the macaron class and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I learnt new tips and tricks and made 25 delicious macarons. After class I had a hot chocolate and pan au raison which was delicious. The hot chocolate was a stand out. The cafe is very small but the fare is very good.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We went in for a quick cake. I found the Mille feuille a bit dry but the chocolate mousse cake was really good.would visit again and try more things

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My husband and I had a great time taking an eclair class.  The instructor was wonderful - very knowledgeable and helpful.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: we were a group of 8. It was great fun and we all learned so much. Olivier is awesome! The bakery serves fabulous breakfast and lunch too.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Everything was perfect (especially the chef instructor) and the macarons came out fantastic.  What a lovely shop, and what a great experience.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My 13 year old daughter and I took the french macaron class this weekend and had a great time!  It was a small class and we learned a lot.  It was hands on, which was awesome, and Chef was great- really informative, patient and we were even able to go home and make our own the next afternoon!  When the class was over, we strolled around the Village, and had an awesome mother/daughter day.  I highly recommend it.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Perfectly authentic French bakery; they offer an amazing array of macaroons as well as
lovely tartes, croissants, etc.  Their flan is unexpectedly good!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Had a reservation and was seated quickly.  Ordered our coffee and drinks, and it took 20 minutes to get them.  Ordered our food and it took another 20, plus I had to go find salt on another table. Probably won’t go back.
reviewTitle: Food was good, service, not so much.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We stopped at cafeteria based on a local’s recommendation and she raves about the food - she was right! The food is delicious!!! The Mac & Cheese is a must!!!! We arrived at about 1pm and it was still really busy after 2 when we left. Great place and we highly recommend!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Stopped in for an early lunch and waited forever for our food. The wait staffing was confusing; we had 3 different servers stop by our table when we first got there, but after placing our order we saw nobody until our food arrived almost an hour later - not even a refill on our drinks. The food was fine, and the AC was nice, so we didn't mind the wait much. I'm just glad we didn't have a tight timeline. I hate to think of the wait time during the busy hours.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The food was really good. My only complaint was my fries came out cold and my friend’s pancakes and sausage did too. But they replaced them and it was delicious. Drinks were not that great but could have just been the bartender.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: On the way from midtown to the Holland Tunnel, you will pass this place on 7th ave. South.  Interesting menu. Poached eggs on french bread and salad were good.  Fresh squeezed orange juice was fantastic.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I spend nearly 4 months a year in New York and live on 24th and 7th when I’m here, so just 5 mins walk. I generally visit a lot, the food here is mostly excellent but the service can be so horrendous I’ve actually decided to stop going there. Both the woman on the front desk and the manager were so un-American in their attitude to service on my last visit I don’t see any reason to go here when there are so many great options in this city. A shame. Wouldn’t waste your time or money
reviewTitle: Horrendous waitress and manager such a shame

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Consiglio questo locale per il brunch in particolare per i pancake davvero ottimi. Se prendete un piatto però non riuscirete a mangiare altro.
Anche le insalate sono fresche e non troppo pasticciate.
Ottimo servizio.
Piccola chicca: sono state girate diverse scene di Sex and the City

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
My wife and I were in NYC for an extended weekend and met a family member here for brunch.
The service was great.
The food seems expensive, but the portions were huge.
If you're near 17th St and 7th Ave with some time on your hands, the Cafeteria is a great place to eat.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The mak attack was really great. Fun vibe and great prices. Upscale but very comfortable. We enjoyed our visit.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Ambiente agradável e moderno. O restaurante é muito movimento e geralmente tem fila de espera. Visitei na hora do almoço, a comida estava muito gostosa. Preço justo. Vale a pena conhecer.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Good food, nice music, good service. Recommend 👌🏻
Отличное место для ланча. Вкусно, хорошее обслуживание, отличная музыка. Не тихое, а скорее молодежное. Рекомендую

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I love this place and visited twice this time during a 3-days stay in NYC.
Food is so delicious and service is always very good.
Love it during spring/summer when you can sit outside.
Portions are very generous and my favourites are the sesame tuna poke (to die for!), salads, burgers and the waffle banana split
Can't wait to come back!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: U want breakfast at 4:pm any day of the week? This is your place! We came here for lunch on a Sat & brunch on Sun! Food and atmosphere is fantastic!!!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We ordered a variety of appetizers and main dishes and out of the 6 dishes not one of them I would recommend. 

The mac and cheese spring rolls were tasteless which was highly disappointing given all the Instagram attention they get. 

The drinks were good and well priced and the service was meh. 

Overall I wouldn’t return and won’t waste your time or money.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I don’t get why people rave about this place. Or have in the past anyway. We went late after seeing a play on Broadway. We were seated quickly by very friendly staff at the door. 
That’s where it all went down hill. 

Our waitress was very aloof. Taking forever to get our drinks. We were more than ready to order when she returned with them. When I said we’re ready to order, she gave me an amused half smirk and said ‘I’ll be back’. I didn’t want her to come back...I wanted her to take my order!

The cheeseburger was ok. Very bland. Needed salt or seasoning terribly. There were no salt shakers on any tables and I wasn’t about to ask Ms. I’ll be back for anything. The fries were terrible. They are super thin, which would have been great, except they looked and tasted like they had been thrown in lukewarm grease and cooked very slowly. The grease taste was overwhelming. 

She got my friend’s order wrong even after she pointed out what she wanted on the menu. 

We quickly ate what we could and then asked that the check be divided up. She then told us ‘we don’t split checks here’. Well the table next to us had 3 different checks! I could clearly see them. 

At one point I was making eye contact with her as she was laughing it up with her co-workers at the counter. She kept on talking and made her way over when she finished. 

I don’t expect friendly service in every NYC restaurant I go in. But bad service and bad food...inexcusable. 

Don’t bother! Spend your money elsewhere.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Went with my friends for dinner. After 35 minutes of waiting, we finally set and made an order. I informed the waitress about my food allergies and she confirmed that the food is gluten free. Well - I got back home really sick and vomited until 4am. Today I was half day at work and had to go back home and relax. The most surprising thing is the general manager who hang up on me after I called her and explained the situation. She refused to help, told me that it’s not the kitchen and said she’s waiting to get the check from her office (8 hours and still no check). No respect to the costumers, to food allergies or to a simple request for information. I strongly regret about last night and call you to STAY AWAY!
reviewTitle: If you have food allergies - STAY AWAY!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Came here during our stay in NYC, and have to say we were mostly underwhelmed. The food is fine, but it's really nothing worth waiting extra time for. From the moment we got here, things were off. We had a reservation, but nothing was ready, so we waited twenty minutes to be seated. Once we were, we had a server come up to us to take our order, walked off mid taking our order and never came back. The next server came over and began to take our order, and began giving us attitude and said that we couldn't order what we wanted off the menu, and was blaming us for the issue. Eventually a manager, a gentlemen named Joshua, came over to help us with it all. It turned out they'd given us the wrong menu to begin with, and no one caught the issue. Josh went a long way to fixing the situation and should be commended for turning around a bad situation.

Decent food, not great service, but Joshua did his best to right the wrongs of his servers.
reviewTitle: A disappointing trip for disappointing food

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We arrived at 11am and it was somewhat crowded but manageable- we sat at a long communal table. By the time we left, there wasn’t room to move. Food was good and service was decent. Good brunch menu.
reviewTitle: Good for brunch if you get there early

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
This once hip and cool place is going downhill fast. It has been consistently bad on my last four visits… but yet I still give it a chance – more fools me ….like a once good relationship you think you can give it another chance because maybe it was you. But NO, Cafeteria has not failed to disappoint …from cold hapless staff who just ignore your requests to cold food and really bad food which is clearly not fresh but still manages to end up on you bill after you have complained. 
There is no excuse in the competitive brunch eateries that is New York where there are a lot of options. I think the problem is Cateria is that its success has gone to its head and it just too complacent now …. …like an arrogant ex partner who thinks they are just too good for you…spare yourself the trouble….

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: A great spot after the nightlife.  Highly recommend the mac and cheese which is their specialty.  Great evening crowd, ambiance can be lively so would not necessarily recommend this as a family place after 9p or so.  If the main dining room is filled ask for spots downstairs

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Enjoyed a Sunday Brunch with a total of four couples for my wife's birthday. Vast variety of food selection. Food and service were excellent ! Mr. and Mrs. Nicotra stopped by our table inquiring about our visit and conveyed well wishes and a special birthday surprise for my wife. They are a class act and are to be commended  for their business model and commitment to the  community . Great value and experience. Highly recommend.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Pleasantly surprised at hotel the service was great and the food was absolutely delicious. The server Ozzi was fantastic the Maitre D was excellent a very warm welcome. Had the calamari off the hook delicious the veal chop was out of this world I would recommend taking extra effort to make sure you visit the restaurant if anywhere in Staten island NY thanks so much for the dining experience

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Had  a lovely lunch alone  with hubby. Ambience was lovely and perfectly  relaxed for conversation. Food was very good - fresh and tasty. I had Lorenzo's salad with grilled shrimp.  Delicious . My  husband had portobello mushroom panini.  Our server was very attentive and explained all the specials . They have a  $16.95 pre fix menu which is great value. We went a la carte and  I felt my salad was a little over priced especially since it only had 5 shrimp! Overall I am giving 4 stars.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: My boss was in from out of town and I recommended staying at the Hilton and the opportunity to dine at Lorenzo's.  He was considering the facility for a regional meeting for our group within our organization.  It was a Tuesday evening so things were quiet.  Our waitress was prompt, courteous and got our food and drinks in a timely manner.  The dining is quite sizable so I am certain that they will accommodate groups.  A large full service bar is at the entrance to the dining room so that anyone can enjoy a cocktail either before or after dinner.  Ample free parking is available thanks to the attached hotel.  An enjoyable experience and we are certain we will be back.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Had a great time..thank you.  Meal was yummy.  Device was excellent .  Always a very nice experience.  Would highly recommend

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Lorenzo's is nothing to write home about. With all the places to eat on Staten Island that are much better than this .. I am going to leave the dining here to their overnight guests.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Excellent food & service, but YOU NEED TO ASK AT THE HOTEL CHECK-IN FIRST FOR THE BREAKFAST VOUCHER !!

If you made the reservation via Hotelsone.com, and maybe some other reservations systems, YOU NEED TO PRINT OUT THE PAGE WHERE IT SAYS COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST, becasue if you don't you are going to be charged for the breakfast(s) at the downstairs restaurant !!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I couldn't make it until dinner so we stopped in on our way to our room. I had calamari and mommy had mussels bith were very good. Flank steak came out perfect with a spicy aioli gravy. Chocolate volcano for dessert made this an unbelievable lunch.
reviewTitle: Late lunch that was more like a dinner

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: our group had 2 pasta dishes a pot pie and I had the swordfish...delicious....the breakfast had made to order omelets and a buffet for $14.95

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Hotel front desk recommended us to try this place.  This place was within walking distance from our hotel.
It was Thursday evening.  The place had plenty of room.  The menu featured fine dining dishes; and the waiter provided us with a list of specials of the day.  
I ordered a scallop dish from the list of specials and enjoyed it very much.  
The service was okay and was comparable with others in that price range..

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I was impressed with the interior. Service was good, but was hard to judge considering it was midweek and only one other table was full. Ordered a pork chop ($26) which was good, just not outstanding. Also had the chicken scarpariello ($19), which I did not enjoy at all. The chicken was rubbery and I don't know what kind of sausage they used, but it was not good. If your staying at the hotel, I would say try them out, but to go out of your way with all the other outstanding restaurants we have on the island, I would advise against it.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The appetizer of polenta was disgusting.  Not any kind of polenta I've ever tasted. The sauce wasn't bad but the serving was small and tasted almost like a bland custard. The files marechiara was a dried piece of frozen, not fresh,filet with some tomato sauce. Came out ice cold. Sent it back. Some cheesy veggies and a limp salad.. I'm amazed that anyone can really eat this lowest quality of food.. it can't be that hard to get a new chef who prepares really delicious food.. try it out, let's see if I'm right...
reviewTitle: Fine dining?? That's a joke, right?

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Came to Lorenzo's with a friend to celebrate a special occasion. I love the quiet elegance of this restaurant and the servers attention to our every need. My friend was here for the first time and had the flank steak, which she stated was perfect. I had crab cakes,again, because they were so good last visit. This restaurant never disappoints with their food and the servers are a classy group of people. I especially appreciate that we never feel hurried, and are, in fact, invited to relax and enjoy our meal as well as the excellent desserts. This is the place to come to when you are looking for an excellent dining experience.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Free dinner was just ok. Salad was good, entre was soso,didnt finish it (bland, no taste chicken). Desert was cookies. Perhaps the actual restaurant menu would be better. But I wouldn't go back to try it.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We have been to Lorenzo's only for breakfast, once a year, with friends following a high school reunion. 
Consistently, the service at breakfast is just plain unacceptable. We had to beg for coffee and tea, and when we tried to serve ourselves from the side table used by staff we were scolded back to our seats, and then had to ask twice more. 
Never again.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We were at Lorenzo for Sunday brunch many times last visit 2 weeks ago party of 10 
As the increase in price is understandable as years goes by but the reduction of the items offered,the advertise of Prosciutto di Parma and served local prosciutto plus other items  isn’t fare plus the carving station with cook in charge that looks at you.... if you ask for more 
I guess was one of those days but  I will go back again !

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: This was the fourth visit to Lorenzo's, and when I get to visit Staten Island, I make it a point to dine here. A super treat is the  Sunday Brunch, yet my Wednesday night dinner was superb, due to quality, taste, presentation, and service. Daniel ensured we were well taken care of, his attentiveness and courtesy spurred us to continue ordering; appetizers, main course, and cheesecake for dessert. A nice quiet atmosphere, I always feeling comfortable here, and located at the Hilton Garden Inn, and across the parking lot of the Hampton Inn, there are plenty of options for lodging and the ability to dine at Lorenzo's.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Always love the brunch at Lorenzo's; the food is VERY good, the service is fine, the ambience is terrific. Sure it's gotten very crowded in recent months... it's that enjoyable. Mr. Nicotra, owner of the restaurant and the hotel (Hilton Garden Inn), stopped by our table to say hello as he often does for the brunch seatings. And cordial, helpful people such as Ozzi, the dining room supervisor, plus waiters Valarie and Jak, and many other good folks, make the experience friendly and homey. It's also great to celebrate loved ones' birthdays there because the staff will present a cake while the pianist plays 'Happy Birthday.' Looking forward to returning, soon!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
I was at Lorenzo's for Brunch on Sunday I was very disappointed with the food selection.  I had looked at the menu selection on line boy was I surprised when I saw the selection that was out

Menu on line -Sushi, no Sushi
Special fish, pork or veal  -  none of the above
Carving Station - I asked the man there was something of which
I didn't understand what he had said, but not what was written on the menu (Vermont turkey, glazed Virginia ham, roast pork or steak)
for 32.95 + tip and tax came to 43.00 and I invited my 2 friends and
I was sorry that I made the choice because they also were very
disappointed that's lot of money for such little food.  I could have gone
to the diner and enjoyed it more

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
I went to Lorenzo's on October 28th with a group of friends. The host was very rude and looked like he did not want to accommodate a party of our size. 
Once seated, we waited over 10 minutes for a server. The server then took drink orders. We ended up getting appetizers before drinks. 
The food ranged from being cold to tasteless. Once we finally received the check, we noticed some over charges for drinks we never had. 
I would not recommend this restaurant.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Te duur voor wat het is,eten is echt wel lekker,maar je kan goedkoper en soms beter eten voor minder geld,en in  bxl cafe veel lawaai,verstaan elkaar niet door de muziek,de zoute is rustiger,maar daar trek de manager op niet veel,veel te veel toneel,wil Amerikaans overkomen en heeft naar mijn mening,teveel streken,daarom blijven we daar weg in de zoute.
reviewTitle: Te duur voor wat het is,eten

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: One of my favorite bars in the world, let alone Manhattan. It oozes character the minute you walk in. I have been frequenting BXL for years for the Chimay Cent Cents on tap and some great Belgian  and French and American fusion fare. They have about three dozen Belgian beers on tap! And loads more bottled. I don’t know how they manage to always have my choice available. The owner, Ives, is a super friendly and interesting guy. The chef is amazing, always coming up with new specials that are always gustatory delights. Try their Omelet du jour, or their soups du jour! I am always amused at the middle American tourists that find this place by accident (like I did once) for pre/post theatre refreshments and leave amazed or bewildered by the casual sophistication of the place. Sometimes the bar tenders and servers can be rude or seem preoccupied. I simply go to BXL Zoute in Chelsea for exactly the same beer, food and ambience, but far friendlier staff!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: What a great find in the Theatre District.  Not the usual "pub food" or bad Italian.   Cuisine is Belgian, whatever that is,  and it is really good.  Breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Very attentive staff.     Really good food at a moderate price.
reviewTitle: Hidden gem in the Theatre Distric

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We came into the city early and needed to grab a quick breakfast. Someone next to use had a waffle and it smelled so good. I got it without the whipped cream which I really did not need.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Had food here a few days ago whilst on visit to NYC Fantastic service,great friendly atmosphere and the food was superb at a very reasonable price.
reviewTitle: A Really Gem Of A Place

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Our large group enjoyed the cafe - all of the meals were tasty and felt traditional European.  Our group loved the mussels and the Belgian meatballs. The service was very good and especially friendly. They were fantastic with the kids. It looked a little “divey” when we entered, but that feeling soon passed. The only complaint was the music was so very loud that is was hard to have a conversation. 
 
The location was very convenient - a block off of Times Square.  Though, it felt a world away.
reviewTitle: Great Food for a Large Group

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We have been here several times - I asked for my birthday dinner to be here since I loved it so much! The mussels are great. This last time my son (who doesn’t like seafood) ordered steak and it had to be sent back because it was so rare (ordered medium well). The server was appropriately apologetic and accommodating. The servers are always congenial and helpful. We had a great time with great people, great service and great food.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Burgers and mussels here are amazing! Also, the fries with the dipping mayo are delicious. When I came to NYC on a school trip, I made reservations here and took all my friends. They loved it.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Had an early dinner at this place with the family, including two school age kids, after seeing a Broadway show.  As a first impression, the atmosphere came across as a bit dive-y.   Duvel Belgian beer featured prominently in the outside signage, so much that it almost looked like Duvel would be the name of the restaurant.   (The font size of the restaurant name, BXL, was no larger than that of the signs for the Duvel brand, and there two Duvel signs versus one BXL sign on the awning.  I'd suggest rethinking that design choice.)  

This is effectively a sports bar.  A game was playing on several large screens throughout.  There was an extensive list of alcoholic beverages.  I get the sense that this would be a good place to go for beer aficionados, especially of the Belgian kind.

The service, quite delightful.  Better than I would expect of most pubs, at least the dives anyway.  Friendly, warm, energetic, enthusiastic.  Spot on.  We actually had more than one server for our table, which was a bit confusing at first but it worked out fine.   Both were great.  I should mention that one item that we had ordered was forgotten when the main entrees were brought over.  As soon as we realized it, I asked for it, and to their credit, they were on it right away, and soon enough it did come to our table. 

The food, I thought overall was terrific.  Well, the starting bread was just all right.  Soft but not warm, and the butter was a bit cold and not easily spreadable.  But the truffle croquette appetizer was excellent.  Highly recommend that.   As were our steaks.  I had the ribeye with the peppercorn sauce, and the kids each had hanger steak with shallot sauce.  The Mrs. had the stewed sirloin tips in beer sauce.  We all shared some of each others' dishes and I thought everything was good.  However she did mention later on that hers was a bit on the tough side.  But at least the sauce was very flavorful and probably helped compensate.  

Each of our dishes came with wonderful fries.  Perhaps that might be a reflection of the fact that French fries were invented in Belgium?  This was my first Belgian cuisine experience so it's hard for me to confirm at this point.   Either way, these fries were the tops.

And let me say, I thought the mac and cheese side dish was great. At least the Mrs. and I liked it. Surprisingly for us, though, the kids didn't care for it very much.  We had ordered it for them, as mac and cheese is by and large their favorite dish to order when we go out to eat.  I think that their palates were not used to the type of sharp cheese that was used.  This was a mac and cheese for grownups, apparently.  So, big thumbs up from me, but be careful about ordering if for the younger ones, even the ones that normally adore mac and cheese.   

My main misgiving about this choice of establishment for my family's dining is that toward the tail end of our meal, there was some rather loud and rough language being used by some of the patrons, the kind to which I try to avoid exposing my kids (though, to be fair, my oldest kid has heard it all before by now, and my younger kid probably didn't notice).  I don't consider it a fault of the establishment.  It goes with the atmosphere and the clientele to which it caters.   For next time, it will be a factor in my decisionmaking about whether to come back for another meal with the children.  

So, all in all I really like the place as a restaurant, and besides that, I expect it would make a good choice as a place to meet up for beers.  But as a place to take the whole family including children, be aware of the kind of place this is.
reviewTitle: Nice service and high quality food, in an unassuming location and a casual atmosphere.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We picked this place because of a recommendation from a friend who lunched there often and because of the reputation of its burgers  Most of the crew went for those burgers and they all enjoyed their selections, The Steak Tartare was delicious. The service was on spot. We would definitely eat here again.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: My family and I had lunch here before going to the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular show. The location was perfect.It was warm, cozy, bar style, great food too.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: First and foremost as far as I am concerned that you should know about this place is that they have Kwak on tap, in addition to numerous other Belgian beers.  Had passed thru here numerous times but had never stopped in before.  Had a show nearby so came in and sat at the bar.   Had two pints of Kwak which hit the spot and an order of Poutine which was pretty good before heading off to my show.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Een heerlijke hangout met een goede kaart met Belgische bieren en gerechten. Alsof je in Brussel een bent! De bediening is ook deels Belgisch. De prijs - kwaliteit is dik in orde, dat zie je in New York wel anders. Echt een aanrader!
reviewTitle: Brussel in the Big Apple! Een heerlijke Belgische bar - restaurant

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Got seated right away.  Servers were very attentive.  Food was average.  I had the Spaghetti Carbonara, which I would rate 4 stars.  My husband had the meatloaf (don’t remember its name on the menu), and he would rate it 2 stars.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We walked into BXL almost by accident and what a find. Amazing selection of Belgian beers, as well as a few locals, knowledgeable staff who can talk through the options, and great food served incredibly fast. We’ve tried the buffalo wings, chicken sate, and frites all were delicious. Definitely give BXL a try, you won’t be disappointed
reviewTitle: Great atmosphere, great beer, great food

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Need a good restaurant to go to before seeing Beautiful in NY. Was not disappointed in BXL cafe. Great bar and cozy and fun. Food was great. Had the Bouchée à la Reine

Puff pastry with chicken, bacon, mushrooms & frites

Spaghetti Carbonara

Spaghetti with bacon, onions & cream sauce

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Great little bar vibe with outstanding food and quite possibly the cutest, sweetest server I have ever seen. He gave me a deconstructed Irish coffee that was just perfect and we got a veggie burger and croque tomate. Unbelievably yummy.
reviewTitle: Gourmet comfort food and relaxed dining

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Nous avons très bien mangé, la carte est bien fournie et les plats sont copieux.
Le choix de bières est top et le personnel très sympathique.
Ne pas hésiter !

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Er stonden echt Belgische gerechten op de kaart zoals mossels en bouche à la reine. Wij hadden cheeseburger en steak en gebakken kip genomen.  Frietjes waren heel gezouten. Steak smaakte niet echt lekker. Cheeseburger was goed. Geen kinderporties. Kip was ook goed. Niet echt voor herhaling vatbaar.
Vriendelijke bediening.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Op advies van collega hier toch gaan eten.Gezellig café,lekker eten, vriendelijke en snelle bediening. Zeker een aanrader.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Delicious cappuccinos and pastries. The lemon cake is wonderful with tea or coffee, and their coffee eclairs are the best anywhere!  The place is small and sometimes it's hard to get a table, but you can get your coffee drink and pastry to go.
reviewTitle: Love this place! I stop by all the time.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The macaron class was amazing. Learned how to make them and took about 25 home. They were delicious 😋

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My wife and I went for a croissant class. We had a fantastic time learning from the owner Olivier.  The croissants were delicious right out of the oven and you go home with a lot of laminated dough to bake at home on top of the ~10-15 croissants you make at the bakery.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Took this class with my 13 year old daughter. Great bonding class and the instructor was awesome.  We brought the cookies home and they were gone I’m a day. Just wished we could have made more

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We attended the macaron making class with head chef Olivier and had a wonderful time. Highly recommend it!! The chef was hands on while also allowing us to do a lot of the cooking so we could learn. The macarons came out so well!! I brought some into work to share and received many compliments on them! Merci beaucoup!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We loved this macaron class! I brought my 7 year old and the class kept both of us engaged. Highly recommend.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Good quality French pastry. Modern and nice looking place. Good selection of pastries to choose from. The price is high, but it's in the heart of the Village :-)
reviewTitle: Nice place to have French pastry

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Perfect little spot for coffee croissants donuts and of course macaroon! The chocolate covered donuts are my favorite I think and my kids love the macaroons. We always get a whole bunch of them to bring to holiday celebrations.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I had the cream Mille feuille and it was really good. The pastry wasn’t that crunchy though, but even so it was really really good.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The French macaroon class was amazing! There were 8 of us in the class which created an intimate baking experience. The chef was very patient and helpful. He also had a great sense of humor. I took my mother for a mother-daughter experience. I would recommend this class to everybody.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: A must do!!! Classes on line were all booked but they arranged for a private class with less than 5 days notice. Our authentic French chef, Jon, was incredible! He took us through all the steps from making the pastry dough to baking fluffy, buttery, decadent croissants, with all kinds of professional tips throughout. We thought it would be a once in a lifetime experience but we are already planning a trip back to NYC solely to take the Macaron class! Yes, it's that amazing!!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Macarons class was so much better than expected. Sean, the pastry chef, was professional, gave detailed explanations and assisted each of us when needed. He also had a great sense of humor. OI course, I purchased additional pastries on my way out, how could I not.  The Greenwich Village location was charming. Will visit the shop whenever I am in NYC.
reviewTitle: The service and french pastries were magnificent

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Found this little bakery by chance as I waited for my wife, and it just so happened that we were craving Flan, a french pastry, and they had! It was delicious and it really hit the spot! The consistency of the custard and the freshness of the dough.....uhmmm, scrumptious! We ended getting a baguette and an almond croissant as well, so good : ) If you are in the area, stop in, you won't regret it. Nice staff, polite and courteous. We will definitely go back next time we're in the village...

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Oubliez tout de suite le mille-feuilles dont la crème trop montée est beurrée et la pâte feuilletée bien trop compacte, quant au goût de la vanille, il est carrément absent. 
Le choux a aussi un problème de crème, bien trop compacte et grasse et le couronnement qui se voudrait croustillant, est bien ramollo. 
L'Ispahan s'en sort mieux mais reste passable dans l'équilibre des saveurs. 
Une grande impression de gâteaux de la veille.
On est très très loin d'une pâtisserie française et ceux qui pensent y retrouver une pâtisserie de bon niveau en seront pour leurs frais (surtout au regard des prix pratiqués!).
En résumé : bof.
reviewTitle: tout au plus des pâtisseries de boulanger

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: It was a small class of 8. Care and attention was given to each guest. We all went home with the recipe and knowledge to make macaroons. We each left with 25 macaroon of our making. Wonderful!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Mon mari et moi somme tombe sur cette boulangerie par hasard ...
Toute petite on nous a très bien accueilli, on a gouter un choux chantilly avec un insert au fruit de la passion 10/10 excellent , ensuite on a continuer avec un donut a la française 7/10 juste un donut rien de spécial pour ma part mon mari a adore et on a pris une baguette a emporte juste tres decu .. on s'attendait a une vrai baguette française.

A refaire !

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Olive & Cheese bread sticks delicious / best croissants & macrons in NYC/ delicious tarts, great cafe filtre / Upper Westside location is small with several tables & a bench outside, Friendly staff / unhurried cafe atmosphere. Open to 8pm.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Best time ever taking Chef’s macron class with my 11 year old son. Class was fun, informative and tasty. Highly reccomend.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Would highly recommend taking a baking class at Mille Feuille! We took the macarons class and loved the small class setting with dedicated instruction from their experienced pastry chef. Everything was delicious and we’ll definitely be coming back!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The Chef is great, provides simple instructions, really personable and easy going yet professional with excellent technical knowledge of french baking.  Definitely will sign up for more classes, all worthy!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We had an early dinner after a matinee at the Sondheim Theater. We were welcomed by a friendly young woman who continued to provide us with friendly, efficient and attentive service. It’s a small, relaxed establishment with very good food.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: What a lucky find! I came here with my mum and my Nan. The breakfast was delicious and the prices were amazing. Best breakfast we’ve had in New York! This place is a must if you are looking for a well cooked breakfast.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
As a Belgian in New York, we found this Belgian pub. Typical Belgian dishes and beers on the menu for a fair price.
Cozy interior, close to Time square. Highly recommended, also for non-Belgians.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We had Croq Truffle and Gaufre Deserts with latte, and enjoyed the meal.  Prices were reasonable and service good for a busy NY cafe.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: BXL Cafe is a really good restaurant.  It is always busy.  A reservation is a must!  The food is fresh and made to order and the service is very good.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Halverwege ons verlof dit café/restaurant gevonden en er nog eens gaan eten. Wij waren met 3 en telkens 3 verschillende gerechten genomen en ze waren allemaal zeer lekker met ook grote Stella's ;-) Vriendelijk bediening in een tof kader, een aanrader. Maar ... zoals in alle Amerikaanse restaurants krijg je na je laatste hap uw rekening gepresenteerd in plaats van nog even te kunnen napraten.
reviewTitle: Een leuk café waar je lekker Belgisch kan eten

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I had an omelette that was good. It came with excellent potatoes and an excellent side salad. Service was friendly.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Na 11 dagen is dit toch al een beetje thuiskomen. Lekker eten, goed bier en gewoon toffe Resto/café. Een echte aanrader, want laat ons eerlijk zijn NYC is mega cool maar echt super goed en gezond eten? Nog 4 dagen kom ik hier dagelijks even binnen, leuke sfeer!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Tout près de Times Square, chouette restaurant à l’ambiance belge. Match de foot retransmis en direct. À la fin de notre repas à 15h, commençait la diffusion de Rennes-PSG. Maillots de foot accrochés au mur, bière Duvel, carbonade flamande, un véritable estaminet au cœur de Manhattan.
Réflexe de français parce qu’on n’y est pas habitué, je trouve tjs dommage que le tip soit presuggeré sur la facture, c’est qu’une question d’habitude je pense. 
Les portions sont très généreuses, nous n’avons pas eu le courage de goûter les waffles. La sieste dans un parc à été la bienvenue après
reviewTitle: Ambiance belge, foot et bonnes bieres

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Superbe petit resto avec l’ambiance belge comme on aime ! La déco est typiquement belge et les plats sont excellents ! 
(La serveuse parle même français)
reviewTitle: Notre petite Belgique à New York !

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We had a really early dinner at the BXL Cafe.  The waiter was fantastic, he always made sure our drinks were full.  We ordered an appetizer from the bar menu, and each had an entree.  The waiter suggested the hanger steak, and it was wonderful!  There isn’t a children’s menu, but there are burgers on the menu, so it’s ok for kids.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Great beer selection. Incredible service and very good food. A homy and welcoming bar near times square.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Loop binnen voor echte Belgische klassiekers als biefstuk met friet of stoofvlees. Of geniet van een lekker fris Belgisch biertje.
Ga zeker ook even naar het toilet ... je wordt vergast op Vlaamse muziekklassiekers.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Restaurant français bonne ambiance très bon qualité  prix  serveur parle français près de time squar quartier animé

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Excellent petit restaurant ou un serveur parle français.  Excellent rapport qualité prix a part pour le vin qui est cher. Serveur super gentil.
reviewTitle: Resto sympa pas loin de Times Square

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: The clams (one of their specialties) are excellent, prepared in several different ways each one better than the other, all are served with a side of french fries; great burgers,. steak tartare, great service and more than reasonable prices.
reviewTitle: GREAT FOOD, GOOD SERVICE, REASONABLE PRICES

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Lunch was a convenient choice, right opposite the Sondheim Theatre on W. 43rd St.  Opted for the lunch special.  Chose their version of minestrone soup, the salmon entree, & the small Stella.
Was satisfying.  Only drawback during this Wednesday lunchtime was the noise level.  Lots of customers, a TV that no one seemed to be watching, & tables a bit too tightly-spaced.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: BXL Cafe is a quaint place to go for a delicious meal.  We went with our daughter and some friends for Mother's Day lunch!  We were warmly welcomed at the door and taken to a table for 8 in a cozy part of the restaurant.  Our server was friendly and knowledgeable. I ordered the eggs Benedict with french fries. The eggs were perfectly poached and the Hollandaise sauce was to die for!  The fries were crisp and delicious!  My husband and daughter really enjoyed their bloody Marys as well!  We were never rushed and felt quite comfortable being able to sit and chat with each other.  The server was very attentive but not at all obtrusive!!  The decor is definitely that of a french cafe and I loved looking at the artwork on the walls!!  Can't wait to visit BXL again!!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Are here regularly when I worked in N Y. During a business trip back to NY, I was at BXL for dinner again and was not disappointed. The menu has something for everyone. For lunch try the Steak Frite! This is also a great restaurant if you like mussels. Also a great bar for happy hour!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We stopped for brunch and weren’t disappointed. Had an espresso bar, a must for my sister. Had a French inspired menu with sweet or savory dishes. Lunch and brunch - would come again. Her croque tomate was pretty.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
do wonders.

Food was just right for the (buffet) Sunday brunch we are invited to celebrate a birthday.  A complimentary drink (mimosa) was included in the fare. The jazz pianist kept playing during most of our stay.

The staff were on their toes surely because of the table hopping, just to greet and get the opinions, being done by the husband and wife owners.

Even with the freezing temperature the place was packed and its obvious that a lot are regular patrons.

Would be glad to be back.
reviewTitle: The hands-on approach of the owners...

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Lorenzo’s is a ice upscale setting for Staten Island. The menu is impressive and the service professional. I had a decent meal and had no complaints.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: this restaurant was very nice and quiet.  the food was very good and the staff was very professional.  i think the service was a little slow.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Upscale environment with affordable prices. Nice open dining room for guests of all ages. Variety of food.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I ordered a basic meal at dinner and it was beyond my expectations.  But Breakfast... blew my mind; the staff treated me like a queen and the food was amazing!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Absolutely fantastic! Beautiful old school Italian restaurant, superb service and the food was delicious. Recommended!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: As a traveler, I am writing as a traveler. This place has a very nice atmosphere, but that is all - that is the reason for two stars. The food is horrible. Even though wait staff is trying but it appears to be chaotic and untrained. I usually NEVER eat at the hotel restaurants, but read reviews and decided to try - big mistake! I tend not to rely on the "local" crowd reviews since some are just too lazy to drive for good food and some just don't know what s good food.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: This is an old school NY Italian restaurant. The ambiance was great and there was even a pianist. Alex, our server, was efficient and service-oriented. He did not miss a beat. The owners greet each table and seemed genuinely interested in our group. There is a private room and bar too. I would recommend this restaurant!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Bread is warm and there are a variety of types- all delicious!  You also have a tray with a choice of toppings— butter, oil, or a spread. Bread types are: Olive, Annisette/ raisin, whole wheat, Italian.
There are also a variety of salads to choose from.  My favorite is the Limoncello with sun dried cranberries, candied walnuts and
Granny Smith apples and baby greens covered in a special thyme dressing!  $9.00

I had the salmon which was served over broccoli rabe and roasted potatoes— all cooked to perfection! ($24)

I also had the sorbet- lemon and raspberry. The texture was very smoother, flavor was great. Excellent and a generous portion! But there are many desserts to choose from including peach Melba and molten chocolate lava cake. ($8.00)

Topped off with a cup of cappuccino which was a bit too bitter - and I drink Starbucks lattes!

The waiters were very friendly and attentive!!!

The total bill was about $40.00 without the tip.  But I did order one of the more expensive entrees.

Overall, nice atmosphere, lots of choices, great service, good food.
reviewTitle: Second Visit— Just as Good as the First

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
A new anniversaryTradition.  A very nice assortment of breakfast and lunch dishes to choose from.

Typical scrambled eggs , waffles, French toast and such for breakfast. There was also an omelette station and plenty of continental choices from muffins to danish to bagels. 
The lunch portion had chicken with peppers and onions that was delicious and roast beef that was ok. 

There was a pasta station and an enormous selection of antipasto. Multiple Italian meats, cheeses, olives, caponata and a seafood salad that was worth the price alone. 
Dessert choices were simple, cookies, cakes and a cobbler plus a chocolate fondue fountain with tons of stuff to dip. 

The meal came with a mimosa or Bloody Mary plus unlimited coffee and juices.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
All we wanted was some decent food, but we were pleasantly surprised by the great food and service.  They had a scallops, asparagus and risotto entrée that was to die for, and a pea soup that was equally as yummy.

They were able to seat us without a reservation.  We will definitely return if we are in the area again.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The breakfast was average, but certainly convenient to be able to eat right there. At night, we stopped to have a drink...the bar is not exceptionally stocked well, but okay for wine, beer, some mixed drinks.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: My husband had the tuna and I had the salmon...it was phenomenal!!!  The whole family had delightful dishes.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Been visiting Lorenzo's for brunch 11+ years... the price has naturally increased during that time, some foods have been reduced or completely eliminated but the dishes still offer a well-prepared, broad selection (one mimosa included per person) and the staff is friendly & accommodating. Good location inside the Hilton Garden Inn off of South Avenue and the comfortable ambience is enhanced by appropriate music alternating between a guitarist & a piano player. Recommended, so enjoy :).

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We arrived quite late after traveling all day. I raced into the restaurant at 9:45pm asked if we could order. Ozzie, superb waiter , went out of his way to accommodate us. We ordered Pasta Bolanaise , a large salad 🥗, and artichoke hearts. The artichoke hearts were presented like a lovely flower. The food was DELICIOUS 😋 and service excellent.
The next day Ozzie again went out of his way when we snacked at the bar!!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We attended a wedding while staying at the Hilton Garden Inn.  How convenient to have the hotel in the middle, the reception at Nicotra's (on the right) and breakfast(s) and rehearsal dinner at Lorenzo's.  No need to worry about drinking and traveling or traffic.  The service was A+ (thanks Ozzi!).  The dinners were great.  The only complaint (and it's a minor one) was that I felt the breakfast buffet was a little overpriced ($14.95).  It would've been nice to have an offering of a drink and a bagel/muffin/pastry rather than an entire breakfast.  Though I can't complain about the breakfast.  Omelet station and lots of offerings.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Friendly bar and restaurant in the Staten island Hilton
Food is excellent and well prepared
Staff is very friendly and attentive
Plenty of Parking

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Lorenzo's restaurant located in the Hilton Garden Inn is a diamond wrapped in silk clothing. The hotel is amazing enough and this just makes the experience that much better. An excellent wine selection and delicious food (try the calamari) Weekly live entertainment gives this high dining experience just one more thing to enhance your night. Make sure you make a Reservation.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I had the superb caesar salad and a pasta dish that was out of this world good...accompanied by a fine glass of red wine...just a lovely, lovely place and evening.
reviewTitle: Excellent food and piano accompaniment in an 'old school' setting

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
The restaurant has nice ambiance, it is well designed and appointed. The dinner was a short menu but with a good selection. It was a four course meal with a fixed price. The service was prompt and courteous. 
There was 3 of us and we all ordered something different. The food was delicious and served well. I had short ribs and they were tender and served with 2 sides. The portions were appropriate for a 4 course meal an we left full but not overstuffed. The reason they did not get excellent is the dessert was uneventful, a 7 layer cake that was dry and seemed stale. I am a sweets person and I didn't finish it.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Loved the small size of 8 students!  It was detailed and hands on which will help when I try to make some macarons on my own at home.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I booked a private macaron class for my family and it was a really fun experience. John was an excellent teacher and our macorons turned out beautiful and delicious.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Small space but intimate, teacher walks you through step by step. Lots of fun and you make a whole box to take home!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: After having sampled their offerings and taken four classes with Jean and Dimitri, I can confidently say this bakery is not to be missed!!  I’ll be sending my friends and family there too.  I recommend the macarons, Mille-feuille, eclairs and croissants.  There is also an amazing lemon loaf and classic opera cake too! Plus so much more.  The classes are well taught and you get to eat and take home plenty of delicious results! Yum!
reviewTitle: One of the best classic French bakeries in the city

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: This is a small, friendly place with great coffee, pastries, and more—for breakfast or lunch or a late-afternoon visit.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Took a class on French macaroon creation.  The instructor was wonderful.  Great sense of humor and so talented.  The area was very clean and comfortable. We ate samples during the class and took all we made home.  My family loved them.  Will be taking their other classes, great experience for the price!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Delicious French pastries.....a really good assortment.   Also great sandwiches that are pre-made but tantalizingly fresh.  I would certainly recommend this place if you are in the neighborhood and need a bite and a seat!  Though it’s small it doesn’t seem crowded.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
When next to George Square Park in NYC you need to stop by for a quick French desert. We were two families with kids and wanted something sweet.

We visited Mille Feuille store and we didn’t regret it. We had Mille Feuille, eclair and brioches.

They all tasted amazing. The coffee had a really good taste and makes you wonder what we drink from the coffee chains.

The only items that were not up to par Baguette and bread sticks. The place is a must for French sweets when in the area.
reviewTitle: Great coffee and amazing Mille Feuille

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Had an awesome time during the macaroon class. The instructor was wonderful, got to take tons of macaroons home. Overal a great experience

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
We attended the macaron baking class with Chef Jean, which was well organized and set up. Class size was small (8 people, nestled around a counter in the back of the shop, but plenty of space to observe and work). 
This was what I would call a semi-hands-on class, in that some of the ingredients had been premixed and partially prepared, but Chef Jean was clear, specific, and helpful in his instructions, and explained the progress and potential pitfalls of making "the most complicated pastry in all of French baking". 
We all got to take turns making meringue as part of the dough, ganache for the filling, and each piped and assembeld our own macarons. They turned out great, plus you get to take home what you bake, so I have a nice box of them sitting in my fridge.
reviewTitle: Macaron baking class at a little French pastry shop

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Went w my boyfriend to the macaron making class w Chef John and it was incredible! It was so much fun, informative, and Chef is a great teacher! Can’t believe I made macarons! Thank you!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Great coffee… Wonderful for a quick snack… Wonderful pastries… Everything is tasty so Eat away to your hearts content… Great neighborhood…
reviewTitle: Great coffee… Wonderful for a quick snack… Wonderful pastries… Everything is tasty so

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Though entrance (down stairs) is unassuming, pizza is very good.  Service is both helpful and friendly.  Worth a visit in world with so many good thin-crust pizza.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I love the quiet, the very French pastries, the wonderful morning coffee/croissant bargain. A genuine necessary stop.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: IMHO best croissants and related in the Village. Highly recommended. Not a great fan of other than standard Parisian pastries, so have not tried their other stuff, but the croissants and pain au chocolat are great so I assume other stuff is great too. Has a few tables but is essentially take out. Of course one can easily take to Washington Square (two blocks away).
reviewTitle: GREAT croissants and pain au chocolat

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: A friend and I took the macaron class with Ava as our instructor.  I've taken countless cooking and pastry classes and in my opinion Ava was the best instructor I've ever had.  His instruction was clear and concise.  Every step was timed perfectly and the end result far exceeded my expectations.  We can't wait to sign up for our next class!  Thank you Ava, you were wonderful!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I took my two daughters to this class and we had a wonderful time - the chef couldn't be more helpful and patient- can't wait to try making them at home since I bought the kit- definitely would recommend this class!!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Had a great time learning the tricks of the trade baking French macaroons with the pastry chef !! The chef was very insightful and the macaroons were delicious !!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Excellent macaron class!  Small group, attentive and patient instructor and the macarons we made are amazing!  Will definitely recommend to others!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: This is a little gem - totally worth a visit. Had a tasteful baguette and a brioche with Nutella. Both perfect for my taste. And their coffee is good. Enjoyed a great breakfast here. Will return next time around, no doubt. Thank you!
reviewTitle: Love this place. Go here for breakfast

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Food was absolutely delicious but I think $20 plus tax for fish and chips is a little over priced. I only came to this restaurant because I wanted to try the mac and cheese spring rolls and it exceeded my expectation. Also the steak tacos were really good. I will come back but probably only if they participate in restaurant week

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I came here on a Sunday night around 12:30am (well Monday Morning). The place closes at 4am. I found parking almost in front of the place. From the outside it gives a club vibe but in the inside is like a lounge. They have candles in each table to produce a dim light scenario across the whole place, very romantic too. The place is not that big and sometimes the tables can be too close to one another. All waiters are man, and the service was quick and amicable. Our food came in less than 20 minutes. Their menu has a lot of healthy, vegan, and organic ingredients. The music was also very nice, and in overall it was an awesome experience.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We made a reservation and had to wait long time before we got the table. The music was much to loud and once we had our table we had to wait for over one hour. So I must tell that the service is not the same anymore. Pity

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Not even kidding when I say the MAC and cheese with truffle.. it’s so good that I’m still dreaming about it 

Not sure about the rest of the food so no comments ..

This place is open 24/7 I think so good to hop over after a drink or 2 in one of the speakeasies nearby

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Cafeteria was conveniently located to our next stop-Kleinfeld's, so we stopped there for lunch.
Sunday is brunch day in NYC and we ended up with a 30-minute wait. It was packed. It is an extremely popular spot with a very modern, clean décor. Once seated, we received good service minus the one forgotten (and hence late) entrée by the waiter. 
Entrees:
Pan seared ginger Salmon over polenta
Quinoa bowl
Crunchy calamari salad
Side:
Herb French fries
Beverages:
Iced tea with fresh ginger/mint
Aloe Vera juice
We had a delicious lunch at Cafeteria and didn't feel rushed even though there were many people waiting for a table. The food is fresh and nicely presented. Definitely a nice find in the Chelsea area.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I am a frequent patron of your restaurant, often late at night when my colleagues and I are off of work. I enjoy the flexibility and relaxed atmosphere of the venue. On Monday February 19th at approximately 8pm, during my recent visit to your restaurant, my boyfriend and I, an African American couple, were greeted by host Everett Smith. Everett informed my boyfriend that there was a new policy implemented regarding hats, and he was to remove his hat in order to be seated. Prior to our arrival, I called to inquire if the location was busy and if there was a wait. I was not informed over the phone that there had been a new policy implemented regarding hats for males. 
I informed Everette that this was not our first time here and we had never encountered an issue because my boyfriend wears hats frequently. He then responded we will not be seated if he has a hat on. I then requested to speak to manager, Josh Greenapple, who again informed us there was a new policy not allowing men with hats to be seated. I brought to his attention 3 Caucasian males, seated within plain view of the host desk, who were enjoying their meals with hats on. I asked Josh how he could rationalize that we are not able to be seated when there are clearly 3 males with hats on sitting at tables. I asked Josh if he could kindly inform the males of the restaurants new policy regarding hats. Josh then became very loud, boisterous and began gesturing his hands very closely to my face. His attitude quickly became very unprofessional and he stated he didn’t have time to deal with my situation because he had other things to handle such as the death of one of his employees grandparents. Josh informed me that Everette had given them instruction to remove their hats before they were seated and it was no longer his problem to address them again being that they were seated. 
I then went to your online website to search for the newly implemented policy regarding no hats for males and found nothing related to the information given to me at the restaurant.

The discrepancy here is that there is a new policy being implemented solely at your establishments door, not online or over the phone to inform individuals prior to making their way, that hats are prohibited. Secondly your new policy is being impartially executed. We visited the establishment where we were told to take our hats off when 3 males in plain view of the door were seated and eating with their hats on. We were not spoken to respectfully or with courtesy. We took our business elsewhere. My family and friends are no longer interested in contributing to a restaurant whose staff and policies are unprofessional and premature.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
When I hear the word cafeteria it takes me back to my junior high years and I'm definitely not trying to remember those.... or the food! 

However, the Cafeteria is nothing like an actual cafeteria. This restaurant is beautiful inside and outside, especially during the holidays. When we arrived at the restaurant it was covered in snow, and in white Christmas lights. It was kind of like love at first site. Wreaths hung on the walls and lit up the windows! There were also several Christmas trees. Even though the restaurant was filled with people it was still intimate and romantic. The Cafeteria is perfect for any date, even though I saw lots of big groups. 

We ordered: 

-Mac and Cheese Spring Rolls w/ Smoked Gouda Dipping Sauce. They tasted interesting but I still liked them.  

-Deviled Eggs, pretty basic but good! 

-A side order of fried polenta (it was a special request to order separately). I love polenta! 

-Fried Oreos, always a good choice!

-Red Velvet ding dongs with a milk shake. Surprisingly just ok. I wouldn't order it again. 

-Service was excellent, from the hostess, our server, but especially the manager. They let me modify the order and took special request. Hooray for letting me be difficult and then feeding me dessert! #boyfriendgoals 

This place is open 24/7 and has a nice bar and lounge for people that like to drink. I'm personally more into the food than the drinks so that's all I can tell you about the bar. As for the food, there are 3 different menus, all day, dinner, and overnight. I have my eye on their Croissant French Toast dish! It will be my job to conquer it the next time I come in!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Friendly Staff, Very Clean Dining Room, Delicious Appetizers and Entrees. Tomato Soup, Burgers & fries, nice Chicken Paillard, Quinoa Bowl, Kale, so many desserts too.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
My son was working at an art exhibit/sale when I flew into town, but he was able to take some time for dinner.  He found this very close to where he was working
I hate to use the term 'trendy' but if it fits......  We got there just before it started getting crowded.
Filling up with conversation, you hard to work against the music.  I love loud music, but it was a bit more than I'd like at dinner.  Bartender was great and the food was terrific.  My classic burger was tasty and my son enjoyed his salad (even gave me his bacon bits!)

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Um lugar super charmoso com pessoas descoladas, atendimento muito bom e comida deliciosa!!!! O Mac & cheese é muitooooo bom!!!!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: simple restaurant without fancy decoration or expensive furniture. However the focus is on the menu and the meals. We came for a lunch and tried a burger and a salad with squid. Both were absolutely excellent: rich salad with excellent dressing, and a fine burger with excellent meet and fries. We were positively surprised by the very good quality of food, and a rather lower price range. highly recommended place !

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We came here with nine people for a birthday lunch for my daughter. Our friends, who live in the area, reserved s big table. The service was great, the food super fun and the atmosphere spot on. We came at noon and had lunch and brunch options.. acai bowls, great egg dishes, croissant French toast were some of the dishes we had. The mac and cheese three ways and the amazing desserts were a treat. My kids loved the fried Oreos!!
So fun. Would recommend for all ages.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Crowded loud and bad service.  Its a shame, this place used to be our neighborhood go to lunch spot but it has outlived its time.  I would rather go to a newer establishment where the staff is more friendly, like Hotel Morris across the street.  Today we had a table for two, and then they crammed in 7 people into a table for 5 next to us.  We were all miserable.  When we mentioned it to the manager and front hostess, they both just shrugged it off.  That mentality used to be cool last decade, not now that there are so many amazing restaurants in nyc who appreciate your business and patronage.
reviewTitle: Used to be good.  They need to be more considerate now

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Hemos realizado el Brunch, pasamos caminando y nos gusto que había gente con cafetería y comiendo, decidimos entrar, nos pareció un poco apretados - mucha gente en poco espacio (optimizan al máximo el espacio !!), pedimos una botella de vino $42.- un poco caro, luego Chicken Paillard $20.- Soup & Sammie $14, Burger con agregados $16 + 6 = $22.- un poco caro, y un Benedict $13.- trajeron toda la comida a destiempo - la cocina estaba superada - nadie se hacia cargo y se habían olvidado un plato !!, deben trabajar para mejorar, personal mas comprometido, liberar espacio para facilitar el trabajo de los empleados, y en la cocina deben mejorar los tiempo, eso se llama !! mejorar la organización. No fue mala la experiencia, una pena el servicio !!
reviewTitle: BUENA COMIDA, SERVICIO PARA MEJORAR Y MUY POCO ESPACIO

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We had a very good family dinner with 8 of us seated in the private room upstairs at the Cafeteria. The private room is well decorated and the service and ambiance were lively, friendly and fun.

Everyone seemed to enjoy what they ordered. Among the appetizers, the deviled eggs and salads stood out and for the entrees, the fried chicken and waffles, the Asian salmon and the turkey burger were excellent.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Went for breakfast and had a very good experience. Food was plentiful and delicious, reasonably priced and the service was great.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
The biscuits they bring around were warm and delicious and the chicken and waffles were superb - huge portions and delicious. The garlic mash was okay, probably not worth how much it cost, but everything else was excellent - the rest of my party ordered similar dishes or burgers, and everybody loved their mains. 

The interior was a bit crowded and probably too loud, making conversation a bit tricky, but well worth a visit.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: 내부 인테리어가 정말 인상적인 곳입니다. 정말 깔끔하고 모던하니 세련된 곳입니다. 메뉴도 다양해서 먹는 즐거움도 있는 곳입니다. 저희는 여기서 치킨 와플과 버거, 라비올리를 먹었고 디저트로 아이스크림 와플을 먹었습니다. 양도 적당하고 맛은 좋았습니다. 비쥬얼도 좋았습니다. 그리고 직원분들이 친절하셔가지고 너무 좋았습니다. 추천메뉴는 치킨와플, 아이스크림 와플! 입니다.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I was visiting NYC with my friends who both grew up in the south so we decided to order chicken and waffles at Cafeteria.  Portions were huge and food was DELISH!  We split two orders between the three of us.  A great restaurant for lunch if you are nearby.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Big City takes on comfort food.. this place is open 24/7. The atmosphere is great. We had a very good dinner. Chicken and waffles.. we started with calamari and Mac and cheese . Overall, had a good experience...
