placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
This Gem of a Belgian Restaurant is close to Times Square and has a really exciting feel to it as soon as you open the door
The Staff were excellent and the food choice very varied
The food was hot  and very well prepared and portion size was good

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Zeker een aanrader om hier als Belg te komen eten of enkel een Belgisch biertje te drinken aan de toog.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Though it's practically in Times Square, BXL is not over run with tourists; the service is incredibly warm and welcoming and professional and the food is great--if you are looking for pre- or post-theatre dining that is not fancy or mediocre this is the place. They have a great selection of terrific Belgian beers, a good basic wine list and a very tasty menu with lots of classic Belgian and French dishes including many different takes on mussels and frites. There are a few big TV screens so it has a slight sports bar feel, but the games on when we were there were the Turkish "Super Lig" (soccer championships) so even that aspect had an interesting foreign bent. All in all--BXL is definitely worth a visit.
reviewTitle: Great place just a few steps away from Times Square

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: 사람이 많이 붐비는 시간대였지만, 많이 복잡하지 않았습니다.브런치 메뉴를 제법 잘 갖추고 있는곳이구요, 맛도 나쁘지 않았습니다.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: French good gets the raves but Belgian food rivals it for subtle flavors. Besides, Belgian beers are among the most delicious in the world. This little place tucked in Times Square is a nice chance of pace. Lighting is low so take your cell phone for menu reading but don't let that keep you from the calamari, salmon, and other delights.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
This restaurant is a little gem! It’s right off Broadway but doesn’t seem to have a tourist crowd. There seemed to be a lot of regulars, and maybe it was because we first went on a Monday night, and they have an "all you can eat Mussel plus frites and a Stella Artois" special. The mussels were available in a variety of styles and it smelled wonderful in the restaurant. 

I really wanted the French Onion soup, so I skipped the all you can eat mussels but supplemented with the Mussels Farcies. The soup was SO good that we went back the next night after a show just to have it. The cheese on the soup was great. I don’t think it was the standard gruyere but whatever it was was perfectly toasty & melty. My Mussels Farcies were so good, off the bar menu. They were topped with garlicky bread crumbs and baked and there were about 2 dozen of them. My friend had the roast chicken & fries. It looked delicious, and she said it was but maybe a little dry. 

Our server was super friendly, and we met people at the next table who invited us to their restaurant later that night for drinks which we took them up on. A very nice place and will definitely be on my list for the next time I head to NY for the theatre.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Great meal of meatloaf, fries, and beer. Also, try the mussels.
Almost feels like you're in Belgium but maybe a bit friendlier than I remember. Prices are very reasonable
reviewTitle: Great place for a meal before or after the Theater

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Cozy pleasant bistro with Belgian/French food.  Reasonable prices, many varieties of  mussels which are unlimited on weekends, large portion of well prepared salmon, nice selection of hamburgers, beers and wines.  Great bread.  Service was attentive.  We needed to make a 7 o’clock curtain and they accommodated us beautifully. The bar in front is noisy, but the tables in the back are fairlly quiet.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: In the heart of the theater district and right across from our show, is the BXL.  It is a "happening" spot for breakfast (9:00AM), lunch, dinner or to have a few cold ones with friends and watch "football" (the other football- the one they play in Europe).  Excellent service, full bar, huge selection of great Belgian craft beers on tap and by the bottle.  I had the Croque Madame (fantastic Sliced Ham, Gruyere Cheese sandwich with a fried Egg on top) and a mountain of crispy French Fries served the Belgium way with spicy, Eggy, Mustard flavored Mayonnaise.  My better half had a perfectly prepared rare Sirloin Steak, and the Belgium French Fries.  Need to come back here to sample the rest of the menu.  Highly recommend this place.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
This place has the rudest little Flemish man who rolled his eyes at my client and I when we asked a simple question.   A teenager would have displayed a higher level of emotional intelligence than this tiny zack. He and two waitresses snickered when we asked what time we should come back for a table.  We walked out and never will come back again. I've been here twice before and despite a mediocre meal on both occasions, I thought we would try it again.  This place has good beer, crappy food.

The most interesting thing Is My business runs hundreds of broadway trips for organizations on the east coast.  I will make sure all my employees will tell our clients to skip BXL when in Times Square for broadway shows or Town Hall concerts. We literally brings thousands of clients to your area each year. 

Terrible customer service.  Fire your management and hire employees who respect the customers patronizing your establishment.
reviewTitle: Poor customer service, never coming back

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Nos realizaron una retención del importe en nuestra cuenta al pagar para despues cargar nuevamente el importe que ellos mismos consideraron, alegando que su terminal funciona de esta forma marcaron los datos de la targeta en su terminal manualmente. Lamentable

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Too early for drinking, but I always notice when a restaurant serves Chimay Beer, next time I'll come a bit later.  Service was hit and miss, as was the food, nothing special
reviewTitle: The food and service was both OK

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I found this restaurant by searching for a place to watch the EPL game while in NYC.  Since the game my husband wanted to watch was in the morning, we went to enjoy breakfast and the game.  This breakfast was PHENOMENAL!  We sat at the bar and the bartender was super friendly.  I had the waffles and my husband had the banana pancakes.  I highly recommend both of these dishes, simply amazing.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
The pub atmosphere was cozy and not too noisy for conversation. The waitress asked if we were on our way to a show and assured us we would have our order in plenty of time to make it to the theater.
My chicken in puff pastry was scrumptious, the salmon got a thumbs up too. I will definitely keep BMX Cafe on my list of restaurants to return to.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Not only saved us from starving on the way to the theatre, because we had planned badly, but was a great find.  Our food arrived with astonishing quickness, giving us space to breathe before moving on to the theatre.  Everything was delicious and seemed to have been prepared with care.  Lots of Belgian (and other) beers to choose from.  I hope to go back, when I have more time to relax.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I’ve been here twice in two months. The cafe’s Belgium, with comfort foods from the continent. Think mussels, pot pies, French toast with fresh fruit, burgers and fries a la Brussels. Our first visit we had the fixed price lunch. Our last visit a fixed price brunch before a play; Broadway is right around the corner. Servers are very friendly. You’ll hear French as often as English and see European soccer the minute they open.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Sympathique petit restaurant, confiné, à l'ambiance assez bruyante mais chaleureuse !
Les plats sont typiques Belges et assez réussis,  le personnel est sympa et francophone.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
BXL looks and feels like a cafe, not a restaurant. The counter is very busy with people drinking the great selection of excellent Belgian beers and the tables fill up fast. Add to the omnipresent TV screens and it makes for a loud, rowdy environment - a cafe, not a restaurant.
We went there on Monday night, when they have "all you can eat mussels" : there was confusion about the price, advertised on the bill @ $ 26, but charged @ 29 (the Belgian manager said they just went up and the cash register had not been adjusted yet, but insisted on charging the highest price - of course).
The mussels were mediocre : small (but that depends on the season, not necessarily on the restaurant) with very watery stock, very salty fries and tasteless mayo (why not follow a simple, Belgian recipe ?!). The beer is imported Belgian, so brilliant, but better take out a mortgage before ordering another round.
Being Belgian, I make it a point to try Belgian restaurants around the world - this one does not rank on top of my list.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: The Times Square area does not have many quality restaurants. The quality of BXL is excellent and unusual for the area. A good, moderately priced menu. Our waitress was friendly, cheerful, efficient. We had brunch - eggs benedict and cheese-truffle croquettes.
reviewTitle: Excellent moderately priced cafe near Times Square

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
avons mangé moules frites et boeuf frites, les frites étaient excellentes. Les moules un peu moins, manquaient de cuisson pour ma part.
Bière 10$ tarif élévés.
deux plats, 3 bières ==> 90$, vous rajouter la taxe et le tips, le tarif reste chèr pour ce que c'était ! le restau fait bar ambiance, donc bruyant pour discuter en mangeant dommage. Le concept belge à NY est tout de même sympa.

nous avons trouvé ce restau en s'éloignant de time square, où tout les restau etaient complets ! il fallait faire la queue pendant 2h dehors.
reviewTitle: service rapide, bon, mais bruyant et chèr

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Wonderful environment, easy to follow instructions, great ambiance. The owner taught the class, and he was great. Now I feel confident to make macarons at home.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Loved this class. Left with about 20 croissants and some extra pastry to make some more when I got home. Highly recommend. Chef was great.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The French macaron is the most difficult pastry to make. So many pitfalls. The class was amazing, the chef fantastic, and the macaroons were as they should be. Every step broken down and every pitfall conquered. Every pastry chef should be taking their macaron class here.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: フランス人人のパティシエが作るマカロン、ケーキ、クロワッサンなどが食べれます。アーモンドクロワッサンが美味しかったです。
reviewTitle: アーモンドクロワッサン

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I sent my husband here for his Fathers Day adventure.  They offer one day classes on how to make certain french Pastries.  My husbands favorite is the Mille Feuille, so I was excited to see they offered a class for that.  He got there at 12:30 and they were setting up.  I came and went as the process began. They laminated their own  puff pastry. Then they watched as the Chef showed them how to make the cream.  In real life it is a 3 day process, so they had cream and pastry already prepared for them to use for the day.  The class was fun and limited to 8 people so they all had hands on time. They left with their own Mille Feuille as well as the raw pastry dough they had made.  I think it was a fun 2 1/2 hour experience.  There were couples doing it together as well.  The only thing was the chef was very busy helping the class that the pastry they rolled out got a little over cooked and when we ate it you could taste the burn.  Still it was a fun experience.  Perhaps we'll try the Macarons next!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Wonderfully fun!  And once you make the macaroons you'll understand how much work goes into making such lovely treats!  The cooking class was so much fun, and our wonderful French Chef is a true artist!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I’m almost afraid to tell you for fear they will sell out too soon. Ask them to warm it and you will be transported to Paris!
reviewTitle: The best chocolate croissant in the city

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Bought the macaron baking class as a gift.  Our teenage son and I went in not knowing what to expect, other than knowing we loved macarons after a memorable trip to France.  The chef who leads the 2.5 hour class is patient, and provides step by step instructions, while stepping in at just the right time.  We each left with approx. 24 macarons in our own Mille feuille box.  Do not hesitate to take the class.  I am not a baker and even my macarons turned out well.  On the way out, be sure to buy some of the delicious goodies- the brioches and croissants are the best I’ve tasted in the US.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
I booked this class for my daughter who is interested in baking. Both her and my wife had a great experience and they each took home their Macaroons which were delicious!!

My daughter wants to go back for the Eclair class. Thank you

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Le Mille Feuille, a patisserie/restaurant located in lower Manhattan, serves delectable French pastries and coffee. In addition, it offers regular classes in how to prepare and bake croissants, macaroons and eclairs. The short classes (reasonably priced for the value) introduce students to the intricacies of preparing these delectable pastries. I chose the class to learn how to prepare croissants.  Aside from the treat of tasting the results of your labors you also leave with the necessaries to prepare a fresh batch at home.  Highly recommended!
reviewTitle: Lessons on how to prepare and bake Croissants

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Fantastic session. Felt a little cramped and there should have been a mixer per group, however, the results were incredible.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We stopped in this adorable bakery on a warm May afternoon, after a long morning of sightseeing.  Between the three of us, we sampled a chocolate croissant, a chocolate French doughnut, and a brownie.  All were excellent.  My iced coffee was perfect, even thought they don't offer flavors, and my father had what he proclaimed "the best lemonade" of his life, describing it as "not too sweet, not too sour, with a touch of mint".  All in all, a great place to pick up a treat to eat at their pleasant little sidewalk tables or to enjoy up the street at Washington Square Park.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We walked in by chance. It tasted so good that we went back the next day and brought more baked goods home to Norway.
reviewTitle: Delicious baked goods and pleasant operation

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Située très près de notre hôtel, cette minuscule boulangerie propose de la viennoiserie de qualité, des boissons chaudes (demandez un expresso si vous aimez le café, le regular est comment dire, infect !). L’établissement dispose de quelques places pour prendre son petit déjeuner sur place. Quelques employés parlent français. Une bonne adresse sur Broadway et 77th street west.
reviewTitle: Une bonne boulangerie à la française

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: This little French bakery is a must when you’re visiting the city. My daughter and I took a macaroon making class-phenomenal! Best macaroons I’ve ever had! And their lunch was amazing- sandwiches with the best breads! Also, the French chocolate donut was THE BEST DONUT I’ve ever eaten!!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We took the macaron class early morning and had the most amazing time. The chef was great and knowledgable. He answered all questions and was very patient with the class. We were able to follow the steps and create our own batch of macarons which we got to eat and also take home. I'd take this class again in a heartbeat and can't wait to try another one!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Tremendous fun. Wonderful leaning experience. A delight to get into the the details of perfection from a pastry chef. Will take another course in the future for sure.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The class was amazing. Easy to follow instructions and a lot of fun. Nice mix of individual and group work. Took so many cookies home. I would definitely go again.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My daughter who lives in Brooklyn signed us up for this class.  I expected to get to make (and eat) a croissant or two, but we each left with over a dozen delicious croissants and dough to make over a dozen more!  The class is very well set up and a good time was had by all.  Just make sure that you make your reservation early as the classes sell out.  Also, make sure that you have plenty of people with whom to share the yummy croissants!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Took the Croissant class - great class great teacher AMAZING croissant - I could not have asked for a better experience

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: There's not many places on Staten Island where live piano music accompanies an exquisite meal. You owe it to yourself to come to Lorenzo's to celebrate that special occasion.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Ate here to save time.  We checked in and went to eat because we wanted to go into NYC.  The meal was good, the service was excellent and the assistant restaurant manager, Briana, was exceptional.  She took the time to help us make a plan for our excursion into the city.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: About 15 people for a birthday celebration at Sunday brunch. The buffet was attractive and varied. Most items were well made and tasty but several trays were out of sterno and food was cold. Not recommended for scrambled eggs and bacon. Desserts were best part of the meal very good assortment and delicious. A little pricey but a nice venue.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We had four adults between us so we tasted everything available.  We were consistently disappointed in everything we ate.  The scrambled eggs were hard, the waffles bland, and the potatoes had a weird taste, I could go on and on. To top it off the 80's love songs playing on a loop were way too loud for breakfast.  Would not recommend.
reviewTitle: Not a great choice for breakfast

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Loved, loved, love this restaurant. The atmosphere is great, have a piano playa during dinner, service is excellent as is the food.  I might just back to Staten Island one nite to eat here.
reviewTitle: Located in the Hhilton, step inside and its like a different world.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Thank you again TripAdvisor community.  I typically avoid hotel lobby restaurants but your reviews (and 17 degrees with gusty wind) kept me indoors at Lorenzo's.  Excellent muscles app with tomato garlic sauce.   Fun atmosphere and great service.    Locals make the drive, hotel guests... stay in at least one night.
reviewTitle: Great surprise in Hilton Garden Inn

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The three course  meal was delicious! Mr. & Mrs. Nicotra are very gracious hosts. The Christmas Italian show was very enjoyable, The band was a family affair and very talented. A wine connoisseur was there to pair up the wine for each course! I would recommend this delightful event to anyone who enjoys Italian music!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We celebrated my husband’s birthday in the Wine Room and had an excellent time.  The place is classy and beautiful.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in preparations, menu selection and service during the party.  Every bit of food was delicious – from passed around Hors D'ourve, appetizers, main dishes and of course chocolate dipped fruits for desert. We and our guests had a wonderful time and will recommend the place in a heartbeat.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: My wife, teenage son and I went here while staying at the Hilton.  We were pleasantly surprised.  Great filet mignon, my picky son loved it.  I had delicious risotto and scallops.  Prices are reasonable.  Service was excellent.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I was with a group of relatives who were in town for a funeral.  Two additional members joined the group after we had ordered, so they even had to move our group of ten to a larger table. The staff was very accommodating with only a few slight problems. I really enjoyed my pasta dish. I think most enjoyed theirs as well

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: What an overall great experience at Lorenzo's. The entire staff from beginning to the end could not be more accomodating. From initial consultation to preparation and actual event, each staff member was available and ready to assist. The atmosphere and the food was extremely good. I wish I had plans for another event!!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: What can I say the food, drinks, atmosphere are very elegant. The staff is helpful and very attentive to our families needs.  My families catering event, went beautifully and smootly.  I loved it and so did my family. I would definitely have another event at Lorenzo's and to check out one of there show on my next visit.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: This was the fourth visit to Lorenzo's, and when I get to visit Staten Island, I make it a point to dine here. A super treat is the Sunday Brunch, yet my Wednesday night dinner was superb, due to quality, taste, presentation, and service. Daniel ensured we were well taken care of, his attentiveness and courtesy spurred us to continue ordering; appetizers, main course, and cheesecake for dessert. A nice quiet atmosphere, I always feeling comfortable here, and located at the Hilton Garden Inn, and across the parking lot of the Hampton Inn, there are plenty of options for lodging and the ability to dine at Lorenzo's.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Loved the Italian Feast dinner served at the function I attended. Food was unique and delicious. Have eaten there before and always delicikus.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Lorenzo's is a great place for lunch and a wonderful spot for a romantic dinner and show. The menu is eclectic and reliable. The Chef offers daily specials from traditional dishes like chicken parm to much more interesting dishes including seafood.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Varied menu, attentive staff. Food tasty but overdone, despite uncrowded dining room. One  meal returned, replacement offered, item taken off bill. Maitre d' handled very well.
reviewTitle: Hilton Garden Inn. Wonderful service...attractive surroundings.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Even though we live on Staten island we like to stay after the Hilton Garden Inn and go to Lorenzo's for dinner and entertainment. The Nicoltra family are great people. Worth the trip.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Oh, I should've known better than to eat at a hotel restaurant. We were exhausted and thought we'd give it a go. The food was ordinary, the service was slow and it was not cheap.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: My husband and I ate dinner here and although they didn't have many options on the menu to choose from, I ordered a wheat pasta and it was great and my husband ordered a Caesar salad and that was good. They start you off with bread and three dipping choices which I filled up on it was yummy. Also I ordered a Cosmo and it was the best I'd had in a long time. The atmosphere was intimate with a piano player and dim lighting. They also have a bar separate from the dining area. I would recommend it if you don't mind spending the extra money.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The restaurant is very accommodating.  I have eaten here often for social gatherings and meetings.  I have seen birthday parties going on and the place is big enough that those groups do not interfere with couples dining.  I enjoyed the pianist when I ate there one Sunday afternoon.  He was the highlight of my meal.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Came with a big group of friends. The service was impeccable. The food was ok - very rich American fare. I had the steak. The sides were great.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Urgh grim!

The only good thing here is kind of the atmosphere and the fact you can sit outside.

I had the chicken which was dry and they forgot my side of sweet potato.

The staff are simply there to pose and look pretty (they really don't do much else except give you your food and take your money).
reviewTitle: Poor service, poor food and not cheap

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Stopped in for lunch with husband and was pleasantly surprised by the menu and the great service. Plan on returning on our next visit to NYC.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: in a wonderful sunny and warm october morning , I was attracted by the clean and sleeky style of the place and the decision was fully right . Since I got escorted to my table I thought the place was going to be good. Ambience was great so the service and the uniquely hairstyled manager. Organic breakfast , that was my choice, and could not be better, acaj , ginger shot and a great double espresso, all of top notch quality , all served in a immaculate way , leaving me with a superpositive impression  and eager to return maybe for a dinner . Great place, great ambience, great staff

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Cute place. I took few fashion students to New York for a week and this place was recommended by someone who lives there. Food was good but the service could be faster. All and all I recommend it.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: This place is one of our usual stops in NYC. This time we went after arriving from Europe and checking it at our hotel, for a late lunch/early dinner. It was not as busy as I remembered, but probably this was due to the time of day. Service was not super, but quality of the food was still good.
reviewTitle: One of usual stops in Chelsea

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Nice way to start our visit to NYC.  Had a great lunch meal with quick friendly service.  I had the Mac Attack trio of mac & cheese dishes which were quite good (VERY rich though).  Everyone enjoyed their meals and the prices generally reasonable.  Would definitely recommend.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I've been coming to Cafeteria for nearly 10 years and one thing I can say is they are consistently amazing. Definitely try the mac n cheese, and the mac n cheese spring rolls (smoked gouda dipping sauce FTW).

Also, great place to bring out of towners!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
My brother and I met here to catch up with our Aunt while we were in NYC. We had a nice time visiting with each other, but sadly the restaurant was underwhelming.

First, my drink (old fashioned) took quite a while to arrive, and was a pretty skimpy pour. Even with the small pour, it seemed watered down.. which was disappointing.

The lunch was not bad - all three of us had a salad.. my brother and Aunt went for the chicken salad special, which they said was quite good. I had a calamari salad - it was a good portion, and the taste was pretty good - but it didn't wow me at all.

Service was terrible. Our waitress barely stopped by the table, and was basically oblivious to her guests needs. Water ran low frequently and my empty drink sat on the table until the salads were gone - then I was asked if I'd like another.

Overall - food was okay but uninspired, and the poor service would prevent my return.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Ordered the Cobb salad which was quite good.  Was seated and served very promptly and the service was efficient but not quite warm but that was ok.  Was thanked by the desk staff on my way out.  The atmosphere was lively and interesting and the good was well done.
reviewTitle: Solo dinner - in a corner tucked away behind the entrance - but happy with the experience

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We liepen langs dit restaurant rond lunch tijd en zagen dat er nog plek op het terras was. Het interieur ziet er aardig uit en op het terras kun je heerlijk mensen kijken. De menukaart is gevarieerd en bevat leuke gerechten. De service was prettig en de kwaliteit van het eten goed.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: stopped by after a long college hunt for my daughter. came in for a quick lunch since we were starving and i dont know if it was because i was too hungry, but the food was delicious! the place is also very modern and staff is polite. must stop by again.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I joined my next-door neighbor for her son's Bar Mitzvah. After the religious ceremony about 30 of us went to Cafeteria for the after ceremony luncheon.  
Cafeteria was very busy, but they had a private room ready and waiting for us. As soon as we got there, we were brought into the room and seated. No waiting for anything. The waitress Alex watered our glasses, gave us some time to gather ourselves, then started to go around the table and take drink orders. She was very pleasant and extremely efficient. 
Our host at set up a menu with them with choices for appetizers, main courses, and dessert. Everything was so well thought out. I could tell that our host in the restaurant staff worked very well together. Our waitress, Alex got all our orders perfect.  Some of us had special requests including myself, nothing came out mixed up. The bus staff and the runners were excellent, food came out fast, was hot when it needed to be hot and was delicious. Somebody was always available when we needed something. Presentation was beautiful. Even management came out to help with service.
When it came time to bring out the birthday cake the waiters and management came and joined in the singing and the cake was beautiful and delicious. Again, I must say everything that I ate today was delicious! 
I had tomato soup, meatloaf with mashed potatoes and string beans, and for dessert I had a chorizo with ice cream and our cake again was delicious.
I must complement the staff, especially Alex our waitress, the bus staff and the runners. Management should be very proud of the event they ran today, on top of having a full restaurant.
Being former restaurant management I was very impressed with the operation, and the quality of the product. 
If I was still in the business today, I would look to hire the staff away from Cafeteria, they are very lucky to have them. Alex was a joy as a waitress.
I highly recommend the place.
reviewTitle: Family and friends gathering after event for birthday

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Every time I'm in NY I eat at Cafeteria, but after my burned burger (the bottom looked and tasted like coal) and missed toppings, I won't be visiting again... NY has better places to eat!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I met friends here for dinner and was pleasantly surprised! Trendy and hip atmosphere. Minimalistic design. My salad was divine! The calamari was the perfect texture and the dressing was superb. Awesome martinis! Great and friendly service. I recommend making a reservation as there were quite a number of people waiting for a table. Enjoy!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: After a long delay we touched down in the city around 1:30am.  We decided to grab a bite at Cafeteria since the last experience was delightful.  Well don't know if it was because it was early AM or just an off day BUT the food was mediocre at best.  Atmosphere was awesome though, great music and service.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We had been to Cafeteria once prior for a VERY early breakfast and were impressed by the quality of the food at this 24/7 establishment. We liked it so much we came back for a family birthday. I would suggest making a reservation as it can get quite busy. The appetizers we ordered were fantastic - mac and cheese egg rolls, calamari and pesto polenta. The polenta in particular was truly perfection. The drinks are also great and they're open to suggestions if you'd like to tailor a drink to your preferences. My mother raved about her off-menu muddled blackberry tequila drink. Nice minimalist atmosphere and friendly staff as well. I have only 2 complaints: first we ordered warm lobster rolls which is the 'Friday Blue Plate' Special and it was extremely disappointing. The lobster was barely warm, rubbery and not fresh. I even chomped down on a giant piece of shell and promptly lost my appetite. For a special they only make once a week- it should have been fresh and well made. Second, we had a trainee serving us and I ordered a ginger iced tea mocktail. Apparently this drink is made in large batches and they grind the ginger by hand which should have been mentioned when I ordered. It took the entire meal for me to get my drink and it was clear that the trainee had forgotten to check on it multiple times. It would have been best if she had offered a similar drink as a suggestion rather than allowing me to wait for 90 minutes. Despite these little issues, I would recommend this restaurant hands down. It is the best app place ever and has such a great vibe. I will definitely be back very soon!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: we had some difficulties with service.  So salad - very good, other aspects of meal not so good and hence the average rating.  We sat outside - hot day - and you are right near the subway grates.  It was tolerable but our tables were majorly wobbly even with the shims.  Keep that in mind.  I had the salmon quinoa salad ($17) with teriyaki salmon chunks, avocado, kale, quinoa, and pickled beets - this hit all the salad sweet spots for me.  I nibbled on some truffle parmesan fries ($8) that someone else had ordered - shoe string fries done to perfection with a wonderful truffle flavor.  Had a corona bottle ($7).  Also sampled the quinoa based veggie burger which was tasty but very crumbly and crumbled onto my white shirt leaving me with a big stain for the rest of the night - don't let the crumbliness steer you away from it, the taste was great.  But for the issues of service - our waiter seemed well-intentioned.  I think some of the issues may have been in the kitchen - not quite sure.  But we got the wrong entree - that went back right away.  But the correct entree took about 25 minutes to come back out.  Fortunately I eat slowly so I was still working on my salad but the other two folks had finished their meals.  And the truffle fries, while tasty, were not hot.  So some problems somewhere there.  But I like the menu and I would go back but sit inside.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I went to Cafeteria for lunch after my visit to Rubin Museum. It was very busy however the service was fast and cordial. The turkey burger was incredible. It is a very good restaurant and prices are reasonable.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We had reservation (highly recommend) and were seated quickly. Our waiter was very helpful and friendly. We began with a few cocktails. The mixed berry mojito and the cafe cosmos were so delicious. Then we moved onto the Mac attack which is 3 small ramekins on there 3 flavors of Mac and cheese.  Yum!! We shared the Mahi mahi street tacos, rock shrimp and meatballs. They all were sooo good. The salad dressing for the BLT salad is flavorful. If you like dill, it is a must. We were so full, after dinner, we were going to skip desert but it was my birthday so we got the fried Oreos. You can not imagine how good they were! It came with mint ice cream. I wished I would have requested vanilla ice cream instead of the mint. But it was well worth pushing our belts to the limits. What a great meal at a great establishment!!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Friendly and very efficient service. Authentic Belgium feel, beer and food 
We enjoyed the $29 mussels with beer (Sunday and Monday only)
Really good and would recommend

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: My family and I were looking for a bite to eat before a 5:45 pm show at Town Hall and this bistro was perfect: we could order from both the lunch and bar menu, share all of the dishes, and the theater was right next door.  Since BXL serves Belgian food, the portions were generous and delicious.  Naturally, we ordered moules (mussels) and frites (fries).  Actually, we tried both the stuffed as well as the white wine and cream version of the mussels.  I myself preferred the stuffed mussels and fried calamari over the mussels in wine and cream, but that's just me.  The ladies room has just one stall and the wait was absurd, plus the waste basket was overflowing with towels, so I decided to pass and use the one in the theater.  Fair warning -- this is NOT a place for vegetarians; and although it was quiet when we started at 3:30 pm, it became extremely noisy and crowded by 5 pm.
reviewTitle: Belgian bistro food convenient to Town Hall

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Great mussels, frites, frikandel, stoemp, with your favorite Belgian brews like Leffe Bruin and Kwak.   Stop in for some great bar food the European way, watch some PSG or Standard Liege on the tube and pretend you’re in Antwerp for a day.  I go there on my own for an afternoon stop while waiting for my daughter to get out of school or take the whole family and friends when seeing a show nearby.      
One of my favorite things is hearing marginal pop songs that would never be a hit here in America (sung in French or Dutch).   Maybe not everyone’s cup of tea but I enjoy the place.
reviewTitle: Great food, Belgian beer, soccer and maybe some obscure French pop

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We have been hoping to dine at BXL for some time, and finally made it last weekend.  It might be close to the madhouse of Times Square and its tourist restaurants, but it is  world away.  The atmosphere is lively at lunch, but not objectionable.  Service is the best, and the food and drink selections top-shelf.  Love the Belgian brews available!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I was craving some Belgian beer and frites, and found this place. The beer selection is really good, but the fries are really ordinary, but then perhaps it is too much to expect Belgian style fries outside Belgium. The steak was also rather ordinary. I would recommend going there for a drink and ambience, but not so much for the food.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: This place has very good Belgian food in a typical old school NYC restaurant ! It’s crowded, it’s loud but the food is what you are there for!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
My friends and I were going to a concert at Town Hall and had dinner at BXL Cafe. It’s right next door, so the location was supreme. And so was the food! I had the Bouchée de la Reine, chicken, bacon, and mushrooms in puff pastry swimming in a creamy sauce. With French fries. Fantastic.

Our server was David, he was a real charmer, he made our meal a lot more fun.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
I am very fond of moules  frites, and BXL has good ones with a choice of several sauces (AYCE with Stella on Sundays and Mondays). The burger, carbonnade, and meatballs are average. Lots of beer choices. The noise at lunch and dinner make it an impossible choice (once was enough). We went at 4:00 twice when it was less noisy but still impossible to converse. 
It’s a shame.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Excellent service and great staff. We both had the Croque Monsieur and it was delicious. We got there about 11:45 AM and by noon there was not a seat left with people waiting. A little pricey but its NYC. Would go back.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
While looking for an Italian restaurant, we walked past BXL and checked out the menu. As they did some pasta, we thought we'd eat there. We were very pleasantly surprised - the service was very good and the food was very tasty. Not to mention the tasty beer (La Chouffre Belgian beer - so good!). As it's quite a small bar, everyone is packed in quite tightly, while still being comfortable. This just added to the atmosphere. Plus it was decorated for Halloween when we ate there.

Highly recommend this place and would not hesitate to eat there again.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Overall, it was ok. Our expectations were a little higher based on the menu, but it was pretty much just a little step above regular bar food. It's a place I would go for a beer because they have a great selection, maybe with some fries and an app, but not really for a full dinner.
reviewTitle: Great beer selection, food is ok

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Absolute aanrader! Stukje België in NY. Belgisch eten & belgisch bier, meer moet je niet hebben! Super bediening en de muziek in de toiletten laten je echt thuis voelen :-)

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I'd been disappointed by mediocre dining nearby; the sandwich board promising mussels and pomme frites pulled us in.  What a meal!  What an experience!  The ambience was terrific; crowds at 5 proved its popularity.  We ate an authentic European meal with great tastes; excellent service; reasonable prices, and the most surprising thing was that it was not packed with tourists, but locals.  I'd eat here again in a heartbeat!  Rightly called a 'hidden gem', imho.
reviewTitle: Not all great reviewed eateries are alike.  this one is great!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Nice and great place after work and have some drinks and mussels, or burger.

Tables are clean, fast service and good food

Place is a regular bar and not quiet that might be little problem to hear and talk.

Mussels are good but not like Léon de Bruxelles in Paris.

You can ask unlimited mussels program. 
It is $27.00 and unlimited mussels and fire beer is free with French fries.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Carte typiquement Belge avec plats plutot bien confectionnés  et belle carte de bières .
UN peu bruyant mais ambiance sympathique .
reviewTitle: Un air de Belgique à New York

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Found this place by luck and came back twice. Staff is nice, feels. Feels like a small bar around the corner. It seems clear customers are regulars but anybody can fit. For those interested the manager speaks french.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: This is a great little Bar that is also a terrific restaurant.  It is located right next to Town Hall theater and just down the block from Times Square central.  They have very nice selection of beers and the staff is very friendly.  Their prices are also very good - terrific value.  We have been here numerous times and never had a bad experience.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: To be honest when I first walked into this Belgium style cafe I was really disappointed  (as I had previously been to the much nicer/newer Eastside location).  This place has seen better days. It is dark and frankly because it is so dated looking it looks dirty. Having said this I give it a solid 3. The food was not bad, far from amazing but solid, albeit over-priced. We had calamari, country paté, mussels (broth could use more flavor) and amazing fries (like real Belgium style potato fries). The wine was a decent sancerre and the waitstaff attentive and professional.  4 glasses of wine, 2 cokes and some appetizers cost about $150.00-including tip.  If I went back it would be for beer and fries pre-theater only. Not a destination eatery for me. If you are in a bond before a play it is the better of choices in a far too expensive area of NYC. Bon appetit!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Good food, good drinks for an affordable price. 
Great service ! Europeans meeting point for a proper beer and proper meal !

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Je suis tombé par hasard sur le BXL Café, après une longue journée de visite pédestre éreintante. Comme Tintin et son oasis, je n'en cru pas mes yeux mais oui, je voyais bien un petit café bruxellois à Times Square. Il y a un large choix de bières belges à la pression.
Même si le service allait commencer, le gentil barman, belge lui aussi, à laissé un compatriote prendre le temps de se réhydrater (ou plutôt se rebiériser) assis à une table.
Petite conversation sur les bières entre zythologues, sur la provenance de chacun et petits conseils échangés sur les choses à visiter, etc. Bref, c'était une étape inopinée mais très agréable.
reviewTitle: Des bières belges près de Times Square

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
zeker het cafe eens bezoeken als je in NewYORK bent.
Alle Belgische bieren en gerechten zijn verkrijgbaar.
stukje thuis in New York

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We were looking for a place to eat close to the theater that our show was at. It’s a bit out of the main theater district. I found this place and the menu looked interesting. Turned out to be terrific. Our table mates to our left had a daughter with them who was engaged to the Parisian manager! We ordered  the calamari... delish! Then we had the Belgian meatballs with frites. A wonderful beef and veal mix with a lovely red sauce. The frites could have been a bit crispier. They were served Belgian style with a side of mayo. The pour on the drinks was adequate, but not generous. We were too full for dessert, so we just had espresso. We would definitely go back if we were in the area. By the way, they also serve breakfast and lunch.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: On 43rd, opposite Stephen Sondheim theatre (where we saw fabulous “Beautiful”), this bistro was perfect for a before show dinner. Can recommend filo chicken. Belgium style, French cuisine, burgers, pasta & cocktails in bustling setting.
reviewTitle: Good value French food before show

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: You don’t go to NY to drink Belgian beer...yes I do...I love this place, now perhaps I should favour an all American. Bar and yet I always gravitate to BXL, when I’m in town...Great service, ambience and beer..
reviewTitle: You don’t go to NY to drink Belgian beer...yes I do...

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Op aanraden hier komen eten. Hartelijke verwelkoming door eigenaar & ober. Meteen werden onze glazen gevuld (& steeds bijgevuld) met water ‘from the tap’. Ik bestelde hespenrolletjes met puree & mijn vriend 1/2 kip met appelmoes en frietjes. Heel lekker & veel! Als dessert namen we de Brusselse wafel. Heel lekker vers. Werd geserveerd met verse (!) slagroom en aardbeien. Heel grote bierkaart. Zeker een aanrader!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Hier als bij toeval op gebotst en blijven plakken. Vriendelijke Belgen achter de toog en (eindelijk) echt koud, lekker bier. Lekker hangen aan de toog en genieten! Als bierliefhebber of Belg zeker to do in Mid town!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Opgezocht op TripAdvisor en onmiddellijk gaan eten. Het was er zeer lekker. Ik heb de carbonnade Flamande genomen en die was zeer lekker en heel veel. Mijn partner heeft chicken saté en die was ook zeer lekker. Een aantal tafels achter in de zaak. Als je binnenkomst weet je niet direct of je mag doorlopen maar eenmaal daar helpen ze je wel verder.  Er is wel wat rumoer, daar moet je wel tegen kunnen.  Vriendelijke bediening en behulpzaam. Je krijgt onmiddellijk water from the tap.  Er komt redelijk wat volk, het kan er dus druk zijn.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I made a reservation for 5 so we could have a good table to watch the game and enjoy some lunch.  We arrived to be seat at a table right in front of the screen and could watch every move during the game.  Unfortunately, Belgium lost but we had a fantastic time.  However, during this World Cup (July 2018) we were not allowed to make a reservation when Belgium was playing so we had to find another place.  Not sure I agree with that policy.
reviewTitle: A great place to watch Euro 2016

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: A happening cafe right off the main track in Times Square. Met for drinks and dinner for a long overdue catch up with a friend. We had a couple of drinks at the bar and then got a table. We both had Monday night special if all you can eat mussels. SO delicious! Waiter was attentive and very good. Will definitely be going back.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Restaurant francophone avec un bon acceuil. Cependant la proximité de Times square ne justifie pas les prix élevés pour des plats convenables mais sans plus.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
We went there with my mum for her first visit to NY. We are Belgians so we looked at the menu and indeed they have some good Belgian specialties (although they take some liberties and mix it with some french stuff). The mussels are really nice. The vol-au-vent is ok but the sauce is just cream which is not the real recipe. We also took some cheese croquette and truffle. Truffle is not a typical thing we would have in Belgium (mushroom or croquette yes). It was nice but you know the truffle flavor is  artificial since it costs a lot of money (not real truffle). 
The fries can certainly be better and the mayonnaise is kind of tasteless. Please go for a real Belgian mayonnaise with eggs or lemon taste. It is super damn easy to prepare yourself. 
The beer was good.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Lekkere huisgemaakte ‘bouchée a la reine’, kan echt wel begrijpen dat Amerikanen dit appreciëren. Op de kaart verder terug te vinden de typische gerechten waaronder mosselen. Over de Belgische bieren moeten we natuurlijk niets vertellen.
Leuke ontdekking na 2 weken ‘American lifestyle’.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Stopped in for a quick dinner before a show on a hot evening. Service was extremely welcoming. Great beer selection, especially if you like abbey-style ales. But what set this place apart are the mussels. I've enjoyed mussels throughout the northeast, but nowhere have I had a batch as good as these. I can't wait to get back. Sunday and Monday nights they have all you can eat. And they allow you to mix and match their various preparations. Oh, don't like Moules Frites, you say? The stewed sirloin tips was a hearty meal, even on a steamy Summer evening.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: 3 of us had lunch here before heading to a play on a Sunday afternoon.  The service was professional, friendly, and very helpful.  The beer selection was great - not a long list but a selection of beers not easily found together in the US (Duvel, Leffe...).  The prices were NYC reasonable.  The food was great - their take on a hamburger in a French style (on a baguette with a wonderful sauce) was realllly good along with the salad that came with it (the fries were very average).  The food came out pretty quickly - there was a minor issue with an undercooked burger - which they quickly resolved (undercooked can be cooked more, but overcooked can't be fixed).  There were a variety of customers - from people catching some drinks to couples with young children.  We would go here again.
reviewTitle: Greta service, great food, great beer!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Om Een vriend te begroeten die reeds 5 jaar als Newyorker door het leven gaat is er geen betere plaats te bedenken.  Echte pinten Belgisch bier worden hier geschonken.   Typische Brusselse bruine kroeg die over de middag en na 5pm stampens vol zit.  Vriendelijke bediening in het Vlaams.  Wel dure pintjes.  Verstaanbaar want de kosten om deze te importeren zullen niet mals zijn.  Een aanrader.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Everywhere you go in NY City or in the rest of the US you get greeted warmly and the staff pay attention to you. Here, for a cafe that bears the name Brussels, the guy behind the counter is French and he is surrounded by French people and they all have that superior attitude we all loathe. Food ok but nothing to write home about.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Een van de weinige plaatsen waar je een goed biertje kan drinken. Ook het eten is lekker, zeer vlotte bediening. Als je niet snel iets extra bestelt, dan krijg je onmiddellijk de rekening zodat je kan plaatsmaken voor nieuwe gasten.
Het was er super warm en enorm luidruchtig, wat wij een groot nadeel vonden. Je moet bijna roepen om elkaar te begrijpen.
reviewTitle: Eindelijk een lekker biertje, maar heel luidruchtige bruine kroeg.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Неплохое кафе типа паба в центре Нью-Йорка рядом шестой авеню. Ну что сказать, пиво хорошее, сервис неплохой, а вот еда так себе. Кухня заявлена бельгийская с соответствующими блюдами. Мидии были большие, но переваренные. Поесть можно, но скорее всего сюда на ужин больше прийдем вряд ли. А так ничего, если только по пиву - неплохо.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Inderdaad niet meer dan een veredeld café,  maar wel een heerlijke Belgische kaart! Lekkere mosselen (à volonte) gegeten, niets op aan te merken. Een zeer geschikte plek voor een deftige maaltijd, aan een eerlijke prijs!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: The one restaurant I visited in New York where the staff was engaged in having fun and totally ignoring the customers. Menu was very limited and not as advertised on their web site. Food was not bad. Service left a lot to be desired.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Place is inside the Hilton garden inn. Great food and the owners (Nicotras) very hands on and make sure everyone is happy.  It's a "top shelf" restaurant and after a late meal on Friday evenings across the hall there is a DJ playing the 70/80s dance music at no cover charge. ( more mature adults over 30 and up)

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Great bartenders, food, entertainment, and good atmosphere.Drinks are well made, and delicious, bartenders are experienced, and friendly...Can meet someone special there?????

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We went for a show . The performance was great that's why I gave 2 stars. The service was horrible! The food was just ok it was prefix menu the choices for fish beef or chicken . We had a table 7 adults 3 kids . Had to hunt down our server to place our drink order ! Half the table got there drinks and food before my husband and myself got our drinks !! I found the manager to let her know what happened! She apologized and found a server . We got our dinner when everyone else was eating dessert! I don't think the. Don't think the Manager handled it well !!! She said when there's a show everyone sits at the same time ! Definitely will not go back !!!!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I made a call from Upstate New York to ask for the attire for dining. Some inept individual answers the phone and informs me to wear what you like and HANGS-UP on me. This, I know, should have been a hint. We arrived on a Friday and my wife and I were looking forward to the Friday Special advertised on their web-site, which was "Seafood Pesactore", mussels, clams, shrimp and scallops with sauce over a linguine pasta. Upon entering the restaurant, we were escorted away from the dining area and placed in some other room. We ordered cocktails and asked for the menu with high expectations for the Friday Special. A gentleman came to our table with a menu. The menu had a miniscule five entrees; pork, chicken, etc. I asked what about the Friday Special, Seafood Pesatore?? He informed me that the menu has changed as the Casbar  was running in the main dining area. I asked for the maître d' to no avail. He asked if I wanted to see a manager as he evidently did not know what I was saying. I told him YOUR RESTAURANT: LORENZO'S advertised  this Friday Special on Lorenzo's website and it is not offered. He never informed anyone and I asked for the check for the cocktails and left. This is a total shame as the Hilton Garden Inn where this restaurant is located is fabulous. I would not have this flaw of a restaurant affiliated with my hotel if I was in charge. Totally disconcerting.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Ate dinner with a business colleague here one night and it was just okay. The service was slow especially in bringing out our dinner. I think there was a large party that backed up the kitchen. There was an uncomfortable time period between our appetizer and entree. I had turkey chili which seemed like it was out of a can. My gluten-free pasta was well-prepared and tasty but nothing to write home about. My friend had lamb chops which he said were good but he didn't finish them. Overall rather go somewhere in the neighborhoods of Staten Island.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Had two business overnights at the Hikton Garden Inn adjacent to Lorenzo's. HGI was fine but had two very poor experiences at Lorenzo's. Food was ok and bit high priced but I would have traded that off for the convenience of its location. But, and it's huge BUT, service was terrible especially as they were far from busy (should have our first tip-off). Waiter was overwhelmingly indifferent and seemed bothered to be asked for a wine list. His treatment of us was rude and condescending. We thought perhaps he was simply having a bad night - not the case as all the other wait staff and host acted in the same manner. We will not be back and will stay at the HGI in NJ next time. I'd stay away.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Restaurant choices in northeast Staten Island are pretty sparse if you're not fond of chains - which my husband and I are not. We were staying at a nearby hotel and ate at Lorenzo's three times over the course of our four day stay. Overall, a mixed review. The bean soup and a couple of the salads were quite good, and my husband thought his burger was also very good, but the house chicken soup was a disappointment. The chicken was breaded, which didn't work in a soup (I ended up pulling out the chicken and scraping off the breading). The service was very attentive and a nice atmosphere, although a bit dark for my taste.
reviewTitle: Best Choice in NE Staten Island

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We are staying he Hilton for the weekend with a group of friends.  We came to Lorenzo's for breakfast.  When we asked for searing for 12 (the place was half-full) a manager yelled "WHAT" when the hostess asked him for tables to be put together.  The manager then came to the counter and said "no reservations, 12 people?.  Did you just stop by to say hi?  We will have a table in 5 mins."  The rest of the staff was miserable as well.  I will never come back here.  I couldn't get the man of the manager because the name was so small.  If a member of the leadership team reads this we came on 5/14/16 at 9:30 am.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Located at the Hilton Garden Inn, Lorenzo's has a nice atmosphere and very good food.  Even the coffee is great.  The staff is friendly and helpful.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Food was very good. Enjoyed our lunch.  Wait staff attentive without being overbearing.  
Will go back.  Give it a try, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Nice that an HGI has an attached restaurant, but it did not work.  This review is of bar service ... they had aiming room as well.  Good discounts on appetizers and drinks from 4-7. Food was under seasoned and poorly prepared. Top that with interminable waits and it was a failure.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I've been to this restaurant many times since it has opened. And have recently realized the menu has not changed. Too much of the same does not give me a reason to come back. Even the specials are the same. I would also like the wait staff to be a little more sincere when they ask how is everything. Also nothing is free. 3 bucks for a glass of club soda is a little bit off the charts. Especially the second refill after spending $300 for a family of four.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We were warmly greeted to Sunday morning brunch, the food was good (omelet station the best) but it was a chore to get coffee refills.  Overall good, will return.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Lorenzo's is located in a cluster of a few hotels, night club, and other businesses' parking lot. Came in one night for a late dinner with my honey.  One of the best meals and dining experiences of my life.  The food was superb, the staff was exceptional, and the atmosphere was fantastic.  A man played the piano softly almost the entire time we ate... very nice!  It wasn't too crowded or too empty... it was just right, even with a private party in the other room.  There is a nice bar located outside of the dining room as well.  Lorenzo's was very enjoyable, and I look forward to coming again.
reviewTitle: One of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: This is the 2nd Party of 100 plus people we had at the Garden Inn and it was as perfect as the 1st party. We had complete sit down dinner party with a cocktail hour and open bar and it could not have been any better.  The food and service at this hotel is always tops and you can't find a better place for a party. We usually stay overnight and enjoy a great breakfast in the morning. We can't wait for a reason to olan another party at the Hilton Garden Inn in Staten Island, NY.
reviewTitle: Hilton Garden Inn, Staten Island NY

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I have been here several times for lunch and have not been disappointed yet. Last time I was there it was not crowded and our group could actually hear each other during conversation.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We are staying at the Hilton Garden Inn for a few days.  We weren't aware of Lorenzo's.  We tried it our first night and it was excellent. The food and service were the best.  We visited two more times.  Our server, Alex, is a true professional and very accommodating.  We were not rushed at all. As a matter of fact, we were encouraged to sit, relax and take our time.The Chef prepared meals for us that were beyond our expectations.Thank you all for a fantastic dining experience. Lorenzo's is a great find in Staten Island. We will definitely return.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Prompt polite and fast. Food was great staff was very nice. Small bar crowd but I did not drink. Food was so good I went back the next day. Enjoyed every bite. Happy customer. Only downside is it is a bit pricey but it is in a Hilton hotels so it is to be expected. It appears as though the have some pretty good live entertainment of their lineup. So check before you come. No shows during my stay.
reviewTitle: Great food two nights take out

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I eat here all the time and it is a professionally restaurant. The service and food are both excellent. You cannot go wrong choosing this place.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I've been to Lorenzo's a few time. There is not much else in that part of Staten Island. The food is very good, but the portions are small and overpriced. The lunch salads are half the size of what you would get anywhere else, although the Limoncello salad is to die for.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Great food, atmosphere and staff.  Cafeteria is a restaurant I visit on every trip to NYC - never disappointed. Breakfast, lunch or dinner - always satisfied with the meal.  Love their caeser salad w/grilled chicken.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Good food open 24 hours amazing dishes and lovely sweets recommend for anytime of the day ...they have healthy and non healthy options.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The food was good, especially the cobb salad and the mac&cheese with smoky bacon were both great. The atmosphere was very nice. The only problem was the service. While all the waiters were very nice and friendly, the service was very slow and there were several mix-ups with our food. Still, I would definitely recommend Cafeteria but would hope that they improve their service.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: After a morning middle school graduation (an event that never happened to me) six of us make our way to lunch at Cafeteria.  This is apparently a happening Chelsea hot spot.  It’s open 24/7 so the menu goes from breakfast to whenever.  Naturally the décor is minimalisticly stylish.  Before noon on a weekday, the place is jammed for lunch.  There are lots of very good all-day choices.  Burrata is always a good place to start…especially with olive tapenade and toasted French bread.  Unfortunately, there’s not enough bread and they bring more, but a half hour later.  Some people opt for house made potato chips with caramelized onion dip that’s reminiscent of an exotic high school treat.  Mac n’ Cheese spring rolls are killer with a funky cheese (doubling down) dip.  I have old school meatballs richly seasoned with herbs and house-made tomato sauce and ricotta …excellent.  The grilled salmon BLT was a real winner.  A couple of us had burgers which I think should be reserved for when nothing else on the menu sounds any good.  The restrooms had a problem…no toilet paper.  Service was problematic since it was so crowded.  I’d go back in a heartbeat if someone else were paying.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Left my Midtown East comfort zone and ventured to the west side.  After a yoga class on 8th and 16th. The wife and I took a walk and found this place.  Great out door seating and the place was packed!  There was a 5-8 minute wait but well worth it.  We got out side seating and started with a nice Bloody Mary and avocado appetizer... both were perfect. Main dishes cane out after a second Bloody Mary.  Eggs Benedict and scramble egged with w/ Spanish ham and cheese.  Fantastic!  The staff was very accommodating.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: This was a nice lil fancy diner my friends and I went to. They've been before but it was my first time. The Mac and cheese trip was delicious and so was the fried chicken and waffles. Not sure if it was the same, the waffles or a combination of both, but they were some of the best I ever had. The aloe vera cocktail was also very delicious. The staff was great, friendly. Was a little pricey, but not exorbitant (I guess that's NYC for you). I would recommend this place to anyone.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We waited for an hour and a half to get our food after being seated. The manager said to my husband "I'll take care of you" meaning he'd compensate our group somehow. He never did!! My burger was so dry as to be inedible. It was tasteless and way overdone.  We waited so long I didn't want to wait any longer by sending it back!! Horrible service. We asked for ketchup and never got it. This place looks good from the outside, but ISN'T!! Pass it by.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: While in NYC my wife and I had lunch at Cafeteria twice. The food and service were exceptional. Our waiter Christian provided great service to us. We really enjoyed our visit and plan on returning.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Had the green eggs and ham....those in our party had the waffles and chicken, salmonBLT, and crispy calamari salad.  All were worthwhile save that I thought the calamari was a little heavy on the breading.....staff was attentive and pleasant.....did have an overcharge on the bill which took two interactions to resolve it....would go back if in the area....

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Beautiful and cozy place to eat in NY. Good food!  Cool people and nice location. I highly recommend it!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Maybe this is trendy because it was on Sex and the City years ago.  The waiters seem not to have waiting tables as a priority.  They are rude and seemed angry that I asked for my meal to be sent back because my eggs were served cold.
reviewTitle: Terrible service, hot food served cold

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Stopped on a whim as we were across the street walking. It's was really really good. Food cooked well and nice presentation. Will for sure come back.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We used to live in the area a decade ago and went back for a visit. Still good after all these years. Service was good and attentive and a nice lively crowd. Good choice, airy with outdoor space.
reviewTitle: Still good after all these years

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: 在一個星期五深宵二時到訪這間餐廳，人頭湧湧還要等位。餐廳設計時尚十分熱鬧，侍應們都十分年輕而有能量，食物十分美味，必須要嚐嚐他們的招牌菜mac & cheese

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Rated 3.5 on the site I was not sure how this restaurant was and did not have high expectations. Maybe this is why I was really surprised :) The place is great, all in white. I was informed that it is open 24 hours 7 days a week and that is something that is not usual in the restaurant industry except for fast food! The first thing you appreciate is the warm welcome of the hostess and you realize that all the staff is awesome (we went for Halloween so I presume it was more festive!!). We took different plates: my friend the butternut squash soup and truffle fries, my other friend wanted a salad and the waiter strongly recommended the calamari salad and for myself I am a veggie burger fan so you can imagine my choice. I have to tell you this burger is to die for, I don't know the recipe but I want it!!!! So different from the one I am used. It comes with fries and salad and generous portion. My friends all enjoyed their plates. So I tell you go for it!! The ambiance is great, they have good music and you can still hear each other talking (euh don't you like that yeahhhh .... lol). They also propose a nice and friendly service and excellent food that is not too expensive.
reviewTitle: great ambiance, great service super friendly!!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I found the atmosphere too and noisy to my liking. Staff was generally ok, but not too friendly or helpful. The food was ok (not great) and average priced for NYC.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Our group had the mac n cheese sampler and the mac n cheese egg rolls and both were delicious.  The drinks were great too.  Fun atmosphere.  The bathrooms are super cool too!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Delicious food! We ordered the Mac Attack that gives sample portions of bacon, Gouda/Fontaine, and truffle oil mac 'n cheese. So good! My chimichurri steak, Parmesan/truffle oil fries, and over medium eggs were delectable! My friends loved their chicken and waffles. They said that was the best waffle they've ever had. The cocktails were very refreshing! 

We enjoyed our brunch so much that we came back again for a late dinner! The customer service was great. Jessica and Gaddy were awesome! Both were attentive! The wait time wasn't bad on a Saturday at 1pm.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: First time I walk in this restaurant I immediately noticed the nice causal decor. I got great service and the food came out in really great timing! The salmon is great here, very succulent and excellent with veggies! I love this place!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Pasta con queso excelente los blodymary ricos tambien mini burguesas, los nachos en fin lo que ordenamos estaba super rico para despues dormir ya qye veniamos de tomarnos NY.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We went here for brunch before a show, as they have a nice price fixe option that includes a mimosa or bloody mary, egg or sandwich dish, and unlimited coffee and tea for $20.  The egg dishes were delicious and the drinks were good too.  The service was excellent, from the greeting when we arrived, to our wait staff, to others busing the tables.  We were pleasantly surprised to find World Cup games televised here while there, which was a plus for us.  We even went back the next day just for drinks and to watch another World Cup soccer game.  And, they remembered us from the day before.  Friendly staff with good food and fun atmosphere.  We will go back if in the area again.
reviewTitle: Quaint Belgian pub in Times Square

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We ordered the Pate. It came with regular bread slices (not toasted) which didn’t compliment the Pate. We ordered bitterballen, they did not taste authentic and additionally they were pretty tasteless. We also ordered frikandel (maybe not always on the menu and only for he World Cup).
