It was very small, but it was more authentic than the bitterballen. The poutine wasn’t great either. The chicken sateh was pretty good. Lastly the beer and the beer choices were phenomenal. If you go for the beer:  a 5 star. The food: a 2 star. Thus, the 3 star rating.
reviewTitle: Okay but not as authentic as hoped for

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Great Belgian themed restaurant on 43rd St.
Not somewhere to go for a quiet dinner since it seems pretty popular with local after-work types dropping in to relax after a no-doubt hard day’s deal making!
That said, the food was great - absolutely authentic with an Antwerp sized pot of moules and frites on the side.
Great selection of Belgian beers too - I was momentarily right back there in Belgie-land!
reviewTitle: Great Belgian themed restaurant in Midtown Manhattan - very authentic

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Sometimes you don't want fancy, you just want good. BXL delivers with a delicious French Onion Soup with a depth of flavor in the broth. Mussels are their speciality and can be ordered a variety of ways. My dining companion said they were the best she has ever had in New York. The beer selection is very good making the bar a lively place to be. We had a table in the rather smallish dining area where it is perfectly ok to have a lively conversation. Top it off with friendly, efficient service and you have a winner.
reviewTitle: Great French Onion Soup and Mussels

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: You could walk right by this place and not notice it all. But what a great spot inside. A little funky, but it's handy to Times Square and offers a good bar scene, a lively dinner crowd, and nice food, served with a smile. The walls are decorated with portraits of all the King Leopolds of Belgium to get you in the mood for classics such as moules frites, carbonnade flammandes, and excellent Belgian beers.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Tijdens ons verblijf van 7 dagen in NYC zijn we hier toevallig op gebotst. Onze eerste indruk was redelijk negatief: klein, ongezellig en zéér lawaaierig. Toch besloten om te gaan eten en hebben ons dit niet beklaagd. Bediening is vriendelijk en je komt niets te kort. Over het eten was er niets op aan te merken, de frieten vonden we zelfs beter dan in sommige restaurants in België. De tweede keer dat we zijn geweest was het een stuk rustiger, waardoor het best wel gezellig is. Ons zien ze hier zeker terug als we in NYC komen. Ga ook zeker eens naar het toilet, enkel en alleen voor de muziek al :-)

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: This place makes you feel like you’re really in Belgium. Plenty of beer choices, most of which are imported from Belgium. Did not eat, but the food looked great.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Бар сразу зацепил с первого взгляда. Такое хорошее место, чувствуешь себя как дома.
Сладко и гладко 😉

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Great selection of beer and Moules Frites. Generous portions of mussels served in a small roaster with a delicious wine sauce. Reasonably priced. Right across from the Stephen Sondheim Theater where our show Beautiful was playing. Highly recommend.
reviewTitle: Go for the Mussels and Beer!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Met with friends on first morning back in NYC.
Beers are excellent here, and it has to be said that their Bloody Mary would do serous damage if you had more than 1.  Absolutely wonderful!!
Had eggs Benedict for brunch which was very good.  Actually returned later in the week for a beer with a client.
Great place which is close to the office, so will revisit!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Good food and service. Delicious desserts. A great selection of beers. WiFi available. Great spot overall.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: 4 of us went for brunch Sunday before a matinee. Cafe, not really a restaurant, It is hard to find a decent place in the theater district that does not cost a small fortune. This cafe is centrally located just across the street from the Sondheim Theater (Beautiful is playing there). Long bar, small wooden tables, a little noisy in the rear (we were in the front where is was not noisy at all). Their special is $20 and included eggs or other brunch food (french toast, etc) or sandwiches or salads plus a mimosa or bloody mary and unlimited coffee. All were good. Service was a little slow and they mixed up one order but replaced it promptly. I have not eaten dinner there.
reviewTitle: Good brunch place near theater district

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
BXL Cafe - Times Square is one of 2 BXL Belgians in Manhattan.
It is small, busy, and (very) loud 
The food menu is limited, but the food was good. Mussels are a specialty - they offer a variety of selections.
They have a nice beer selection- on tap & in bottles.
The service is friendly but at peak times can be a little slow. They seem to be a little disorganized when they are busy - like bringing the main course while we are still working on our appetizers.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Excellente cuisine, service au top, et les bières délicieuses. Et l'ambiance..sonore, mais elle fait partie de l'endroit. A recommander

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: De hamburger was verbrand voor de helft. De frieten waren niet te eten. Enkel de Stella was lekker. Neem oorstoppen mee want iedereen zit hier te roepen .Teleurstellend

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We had the waffles  with fresh berries , coffee, and fresh squeezed orange juice. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: On a cold night in NYC, we chose this place because it was on the same block as our hotel.  There's a small dining room past the bar--a bit loud with tables close together.  The bar has a great selection of beers.  The prices are reasonable. The service was good and the food came fairly quickly.  My partner had the Belgian Meatballs and I had the Bouchee a la Reine (a sort of chicken pot pie)--both were very good; the portions were so big we couldn't finish them.  Of course, the house specialty is the Frites served with Mayo; they're served with the entrees and are also very good.  Would stop by again.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: delicious food (loved the moules/frites!!), good service, great beers, a little loud (soccer on the TVs and after work trip to the bar for many) but a great, before-theater meal. We were 2 and ordered a salad and some mussels and a beer each. Make sure to get a table that seats 4 - no room on the table to hold all the plates!!
reviewTitle: perfect mussels and great Belgian beers

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: My bride and I visited prior to a Saturday matinee for lunch. Her Bourbon lemonade was a good choice. Eleodee, our server originally from Lyon, was very helpful to me in selecting my two beers. The clientele was speaking French and the European football on the several TVs gave the cafe an ambience of Belgium. Our sandwiches were great. They use Open Table for reservations.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Je conseille fortement pour se sentir chez vous lors de votre séjour ! 
Très bonne cuisine et bon accueil.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: A great Valentines Day Menu .I was happy that my wife booked us there for diner.If I can I will go back again when the restaurant has their special menu days.A real different experience for Valentines day.Well Done.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: went for valentine's day dinner. table was ready at my reservation time and seated right away. Food was very good. Lots of good wines to choose from. there was live piano music which was very nice.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
This restaurant serves a wonderful brunch but I would not consider returning for lunch or dinner. I have attended parties and dinner events many times and found the meals to be marginally good. However, brunch is quite a treat and requires reservations on Sunday's. It is situated in a 
Lovely Hilton Hotel. The bar is very nice and attracts an older crowd. There are many private events and weddings at the hotel and so crowds vary. In any case, it is often a festive friendly environment.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Great place to eat and enjoy, been there over a dozen times and I have never been disappointed. Food is excellent, service is excellent, the servers are polite and friendly.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I've been staying at the Hilton Garden Inn where Loenzo's resides. We typically eat breakfast every morning and dinner a couple of nights per week. The food is not too pricey and is"usually" well-prepared. For dinner I have had their Seared Tuna, Veal Scallopini and Crab Cakes. It has all been very well prepared and service is generally good.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We got to eat a delicious meal of salmon, pasta, and eggplant rollatini while watching a terrific show. Waiters were excellent and very friendly.  I loved watching the snow fall through the large picture window. Delicious dessert and specialty coffees too. I'm coming back in June for Jay & the Americans ! It was worth the hour trip there and three hours back on Sat. in the blizzard ! It wasa great cause we could stay in the hilton that night and not have to drive back home in the dark. Rev. Meryl James

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We've made Lorenzo's our Christmas Eve tradition for a number of years. While there has been the occasional glitch, it was always handled professionally and the food was always excellent.
This year started well. We were seated promptly and drink orders were taken. My husband asked for his salad without nuts- which he doesn't eat - and was told that they had 750 diners that evening so nothing was being made to order .  He tried fried  calimari instead. They seemed to have been previously frozen hard rings of bread crumbs with no fish inside.  The salad, ordered by our daughter, seemed to have been just portioned out of a large pre made salad, no presentation and she was told she couldn't have the dressing on the side. My seafood salad was very good. The pasta courses were good. For the main course I had the seafood stew, an excellent choice. The salmon stuffed with lobster seemed to be another previously frozen choice, couldn't find any lobster and not much taste. The vegetarian option eggplant parm arrived ice cold over mashed potatoes - really? In an Italian restaurant - and had a very bitter after taste. When we asked for a different hot portion, the waiter refused and brought instead a plate of grilled zucchini and asparagus -  neither of which she really eats. Dessert was supposed to be a chocolate torte but was also frozen in the center . One of the 3 meals was still excellent but overall both the quality and the service have really gone down. Hope this isn't a trend that continues.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We were six diners on a Saturday night.  Good food!. We had calamari appetizers and steak and pasta entrees.  The ambiance and service were top notch.
A lovely room with piano music set the tone for a terrific  evening.   This one is a real
winner.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Ordered mussels as an appetizer, the menu said it was in a tomato broth, but it was more of a tomato sauce, which was PHENOMENAL. Couldn't quite taste the mussels but the sauce was excellent with the provided bread. I ordered the special, braised short rib with risotto. The short rib was super tender and had a beef reduction sauce on top that was extremely flavorful. We had six in our party and we had only one complaint, and it was a dish that had broccoli rabe in it. It was bitter and spicy with an aftertaste that we didn't like. Very earthy flavor in the rabe. Prices were steep, but the service was phenomenal. Daniel was our server and he was there to make sure everything was top notch. My wife got ill towards the end of the meal and left the table. It was her birthday. We went to the bar the next night, and Daniel seen us and asked how she was feeling. Five minutes later he showed up (not even his area to serve) and brought her a birthday treat. He went above and beyond to show he cared and this was a very nice ending to our trip.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: A must go for a special occasion but expect a bigger bill here. Food and service are both excellent.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The food was served hot and the portions were good.  Price is very reasonable.  We went on a Monday night and there was no entertainment.  The staff was very friendly and service was fast.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The food was superb.  Service was excellent.  Prices surprisingkly reasonable.  Be sure to check out the specials

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Ate here after a late night wedding party. Awoke to eggs, bacon and waffles.. Oh boy.. Just what i needed .. Freshly made omlette's anyway u want.. Fresh fruit...

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We've been fortunate to attend several shows at Lorenzo's Restaurant at the Hilton Garden Inn on Staten Island.

The talent was excellent.  Couldn't find better in the city.  The meal was enjoyable and the service was excellent.
reviewTitle: A Manhattan Evening on Staten Island

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: had breakfast for two mornings that we stayed in the hotel. the food is basic and ok since no other options nearby...this will do.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Wait staff was fantastic! Very attentive.
Piano player during dinner - nice touch!
Delmonico Ribeye was one of the best steaks I have ever gotten at a restaurant. As a professional grillmaster, I was quite surprised!
reviewTitle: One of the best steaks ever!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We stayed at the HGI Staten Island for a "stay and cruise" package (hotel reviewed separately).  We found the hotel very very nice and Lorenzo's restaurant was a bonus.

By filling out a brief survey, we were treated to our choice of a free drink, app, or breakfast at Lorenzo's, and opted for the app at dinner time.

The restaurant is spacious and elegantly appointed.  We ate at about 8:00 and there was live piano music in the dining room, which was very nice in the background.  There was a mix of large and small parties (as the hotel had a number of events happening simultaneously).

Our free app was the antipasto plate which came with prosciutto, salami, olives, red pepper, figs, dried apricots, and a variety of hard and soft cheeses.  Very tasty and comped for our having filled out the short survey on our room.

My wife had gnocchi with roasted brussel sprouts and bacon. I'm certain it was delicious as I tried my share!  I had the farro salad served in a bed of arugula with avocado and cucumber.  Also very good.  Well prepared and well seasoned.

Service was very good, attentive without hovering.

The next day we ate breakfast in the same restaurant.  It was a standard breakfast buffet, with a nice variety of hot items, breads and pastries, with fresh fruit.

Food was fine, with one small flaw- the sausage and bacon was not served to temp and a bit cool...

Our meal as described with 2 soft drinks and a beer was $40 (with the antipasto free).

Otherwise a good overall experience.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Bar area was OK - nothing special. (always had at least one little tiny flying bug annoying us-both at the bar area and at our dinner table).  Dinner was OK - the onion soup not good at all- very bland and tasteless.  Service was very good, but the food not so good - chicken was tough (tasted like it had been frozen).  We had breakfast there too - was average - scrambled eggs and bacon OK - everything a little dry.  Maybe go out to eat if you are staying at the hotel.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I was quite pleased. The cavatelli with broccoli rabe and sausage was tasty and well-prepared. Jasmine was welcoming, gracious, and knowledgeable.  The room was bright, clean, and pleasant. There's a lot to like here.  I will definitely eat here again.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I was on a business trip and had stayed at Hilton Gardens Hotel on Staten Island. Lorenzo's is attached to the hotel. I had only eaten in the bar area but the service was good and the bartenders friendly. One night I had a club sandwich. This was a big sandwich and the meat was fresh and the bacon was crisp. It came with fries and a pickle and was reasonably priced at $10. The next night I had a the signature burger and fries. Perfectly cooked and great service. I know I didn't really go for the gourmet fair but it is nice when the simple food is good and the service is as well.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
テラス席と、中に広い客席があります。
どちらも陽当たりが良く、のんびりした午後におすすめです。
スイーツやコーヒーはマンハッタンにしてはリーズナブルでした。美味しいですがボリュームが凄いのでシェアしてちょうど良い量です。
そして、店員が皆さんとても親切で気が利きます。

バーニーズや、ウィリアムズソノマ、チェルシーマーケットにも近いのもポイントです。
reviewTitle: 陽当たりの良いカフェBanana salted caramel waffles

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Don't let the headline fool you, Sex and The City putting this NYC hot spot on the map is all it has going For them at this point. Maybe it was a bad night. Food was great as usual, but service sucked. Waiter kept bypassing my friend and I, not asking if we needed anything, to his foolishness we were ready to order another round of drinks and a bottle of wine, as well as another entree dish... I'm assuming he assumed we were not ordering much because my friend started with an app while I ordered my entree... why would he pay attention to a table with a low average check? Wasn't busy, he had enough time to continue to chat up his co worker...but again, Sex and the City.
reviewTitle: Thank God For Sex and the City

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: This was my first, but certainly not my last visit to the Cafeteria!!!  I have wanted to try this place for quite a while.  I had heard good things about it, so when we happened to be in the neighborhood, after a matinee, I thought, "WHY NOT?"  And I was certainly pleased with my decision.  We did the "Mac Attack" sampler, chicken & waffles and the salmon BLT w/ avocado, along with the Cafeteria Cosmo, that I wished came in a pitcher to be served in a tall glass with ice!!!!!  MmmmMmmm!!!  We enjoyed all of it very much. Everything that I saw that were going to other tables looked tasty, too. The restaurant has a large menu. Hope to return sometime in the future to try some more stuff.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Ate here a while back. Good service. Nice french toast. Staff were more or less polite and friendly. Loved the coffee and orange juice (the latter being freshly squeezed). 
The only complaint I had was the long wait on a Sunday morning...almost had to wait an hour to get a table.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Far too loud for a diner if you want to discuss with your date, rushed service, undefinable taste, everything seems to be deep fried. The main dish is already served when we did not yet finish our starter. Signature dish is chicken on waffle which made no sense unless you want your main and dessert at the same time. A most disappointing visit especially when i read the recommendations.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: En ganska skön restaurang med goda burgare (min favorit). Trevlig stämning och bra service. Extra skönt lite senare när solen når ner till uteserveringen. :-)

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Came with a group of 5 for pre-theater dinner Saturday night. We tried a bunch of apps and had a few dinner entrees. The "Mac Attack" is a sample of 3 different macaroni & cheese dishes served in medium sized ramekins. You really can't have more than a large spoon of each as they are heavy, but decadently delicious! The Calamari was light and good to share. Steak taco app is not such a good choice for sharing (2 soft tacos, but the steak inside was really tasty). For entrees, 3 had the monkfish which was real nice. Another friend had the meatballs which were a little dense, but the red sauce was legit, and the kale & butternut salad was a winner. Brussel sprouts were very yummy! Drinks were strong and the atmosphere was high energy. BTW-They have a very cool bathroom-you walk down some steep steps into a space with a trough style sink in the middle with dark mirrors all around. and  It takes a second to figure out where the 3 unisex stalls are...My lav had a glass window and a neon sign. This wins for the coolest restaurant restroom!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: In NYC you just want to grab something to eat even late at night. This is a great spot to grab tacos, sweet potato fries and mini mac & cheese. I love the basement seating as well.
reviewTitle: Love this place for late night eats

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I haven't been here in a while since the revamp but when I returned it was lovely.  Prices increased but food was still good.  It is worth checking out if you are an out of towner or a local.
reviewTitle: Late night with friends was a really good time!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Food is very tasty. Coffee is pretty darn good. Service is also pretty good. Menu is limited but covers most of the categories.

Um, there's only one bathroom - in an open format. Stalls are private but when you're washing your hands before you leave, a female might be entering. It messes with your mind for a second - did I enter the ladies room by mistake?
reviewTitle: Very good food - let me warn you about something

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I've been dying to come here since I started following them on Instagram. I was not disappointed. The food was as good - if not better - than it looked in the photos. 

Started with the Mac and cheese sampler. My fave is definitely the bacon and Gouda. Also shared the meatball app. It was better than some strictly Italian restaurants I have dined at. I had the nightly special of shrimp and grits, while my friends had salads and a burger. 

The shrimp were delicious but there was too much grits and they were a little dry. Have a runny poached egg on top helped a bit though. 

Dessert was fried Oreos served with mint chip ice cream. Do I really need to say more?! Heaven on earth.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Turning a ho-hum cafeteria in A PLACE TO GO!, has been achieved with CAFETERIA. though with the transformation comes an increase in price, it's worth it. THE MAC AND CHEESE IS FABULOUS. The PULLED PORK TERRIFIC. Fries, nothing special, but quite tasty. Everything fresh.Given the neighborhood, the clientele, changing demographics, and just general prices needed to keep up with this area's decades long refacing, prices are fair, at best.
Ask for JACOB, he's the best and will treat you well to your heart's content.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The drinks are delicious and so is the food! I went for breakfast and had a buttermilk biscuit breakfast sandwich and it was wonderful. The food is pretty pricey but I will say I really enjoy the food. I will be coming back here :)

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: A unique concept in a city that never sleeps.  all day breakfast, great menu throughout the day, great ambience and atmosphere.  another great experience of New York which is not at the heart of manhattan but a gem in the city.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Wonderful brunch! We had to send back the french toast because it was cold but they remade it and brought it right back out! Everything was outstanding! We had the Cuban sandwich, the turkey burger, truffle fries, and french toast. Can't wait to come back in the summer. A must hit for food in Chelsea.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I really wanted to like this place. Very chic but tidy, and very loud this particular night. Of course since the music was so loud, it left everyone trying to over talk each other. Outside of that, the food was just...blah. We found the "Mack Attack", which offers all three Mac and Cheese offerings (cheddar/fontina, smoked gouda/bacon, and truffle oil) to be forgettable. I went with the Fried Chicken and Waffles since the waffles were infused with cheddar cheese and tabasco with a chili butter. Unfortunately my expectations were set to high and my meal was just ok. The Ginger Salmon however was delicious, but doesn't exceed the terrible service that night. After stopping two servers, and waiting an additional 10 minutes once everyone else had completed their meal, my friends salmon arrives. Would it hurt to have a manager at least stop by for an apology for the inconvenience?

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
On the plus side, the food and service are excellent. Not an extensive menu but a nice varied selection. We had the Grilled Branzino and Ginger Salmon. Would highly recommend both. Servers and support staff are very attentive and pleasant.
On the negative side. The noise level is quite high. Very difficult to have a decent conversation with the person seated across the table from you. Next, the establishment introduced me to the practice of rounding the bill, up in my case, to the nearest nickel. Restaurant policy I was told upon inquiring. After which my itemized bill disappeared. I'll be following up with DCA. Pretty sure it is a violation of NYC code. It's not the pennies, it's the principal of the thing. I did not see a notice of this policy listed anywhere either. Searching the web, I see this practice has been going on throughout the country for some time. Surprised we have not stumbled across it sooner as we do eat out regularly. I'm not sure patrons even realize this is happening. My query to the server drew a perplexed stare and he had to go find out the answer. Lastly, do your own math when calculating the tip. This establishment has joined an ever growing legion trending toward offering you a 'suggested tip' at the bottom of the bill that is based on the total bill including any taxes. 
There are those that may say I'm being petty, but I say, give em an inch........ I have seen posts where the rounding is to the nearest dollar.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Been going to Cafeteria for a while now. The food is always good. Just be prepared for the wait! It's such a popular restaurant and they're always packed. Well worth the wait though. The crispy fish tacos appetizer is delish. The smoked Gouda and bacon Mac and cheese is always a must!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Have to say that it was a disappointing experience, mostly because I checked the online menu prior making a reservation; and was looking forward to the Blue Plate Special. I remember this establishment from ten years ago, and it was a very gay friendly and served outstanding food, at reasonable prices. Service was prompt, but when we went to order the Blue Plate Special (Honey turkey), we were informed that it was not available -- and it was only 6:30 pm. The chef's substitute was a steak. The price was not spoken, and after inquiring, it turns out the "daily special" which was supposed to be $20, was now $32! This bait and switch is annoying. We settled for meatloaf - which was okay. This evening didn't live up to my fond memories.
reviewTitle: Just Average (Means Could Be A Lot Better)

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I am a frequent diner at this restaurant and have reviewed it in the past as 5star. Since summer I have started noticing changes. There are no gluten free menu's anymore available and it depends of how complacent the waiter is to help substitute ingredients in dishes to make them gluten free. It used to be that a lot where gluten free but now with the menu changes it is very limited. I have had a waiter that was super helpfull and one a time that was not. They also have no bread alternative. Everyone gets bread to start, there is no option they want to accomodate you with. no cucumber slices instead.
The new chef is clearly not aware of dinner trends 2017. 
Also you can now make reservations they said. so instead of walk in you can now set have your table waiting for you. will try it out next time.
Change is good but they are still not fully there, therfore a 4 star now

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: BXL was a great choice for us.  We'd had an upscale dinner and wanted a lower-key one now.  BXL is a comfortable bar/restaurant with good moule frites in large servings.  We got the white wine/shallot version, they have 5-6 different broths to choose from. Good bread is very important for the best part of moules frites - sopping up the broth in the bottom - and the brown bread was ideal. I think we could have split one order if we also got a salad - next time.  We shared 6 oysters for a starter, and got a glass of pretty good white wine for $3.00 more.  I wish we had some of those moules frites right now!!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Very good energy
Good and relaxing service the place is a bit noisy .
There menu offer a very diverse choice at a very reasonable price. 
The food is good I just wish they would use less ' mesclun " 
There mussels selections is great so is there beer Will definitely go back

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Second time here and did not disappoint. Great staff - food excellent and nice beer selection. Family especially enjoyed the fries ...
reviewTitle: Excellent croque Madame, fries and beer selection

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Un très chouette endroit, un peu bruyant mais on y mange vraiment super bien et pour un prix raisonnable. Seul bémol c’est assez bruyant... sinon le personnel est agréable et le gérant super super sympa. Nous y retournerons.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I went for mussels, fries and Belgium beer and that is exactly what we got. Good selection of Belgium beers including my favorite Chemay Bleu. Also really enjoyed the mussels but could have done with more fries.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
The staff is friendly and the service is quiet fast. The quality of foods was good. Large selection of Belgian beers 
Restaurant is quiet noisy

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Going to a nearby show so without any notions of what it was we opened the door to a packed place with a euro feel.
She had veggie burger I had great medium rare cheese burger with great fries. Both were excellent service was quick & professional.
Highly recommend and btw the bathroom was spotless !

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Really nice Belgian cafe with a great beer selection and classic Belgian food.  We've also eaten at their BXL Zud restaurant in Chelsea and I've had steak frites with peppercorn sauce both places - excellent both times.  Mussels are the specialty - prepared in a variety of seasonings with frites (and, of course, mayo for the fries although there is ketchup on the table).  

As other reviews mention, it is a bar and they do have multiple TVs playing sports, primarily European football, and it can get loud.  Service is excellent and (at least in my 2 visits) they don't rush you and you  can stay until you're ready to leave - you'll probably need to ask for the check just like you would in Europe.  Surprisingly un-touristy so close to the madhouse of Times Square.
reviewTitle: Really feels as though you're in Brussels

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: On a family member's suggestion, we ate dinner here while in town being tourists.  We had another family in town join us, and we all thought it was fantastic.  The service was patient, attentive and very friendly.  We all loved the food and beer choices.  We'd definitely return if we lived in the area.  Great spot!
reviewTitle: Wonderful service, fabulous food, and great beer choices

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Had lunch there with my son during a quick NYC visit. Highly recommended. Great quality food in large servings, very friendly service, fantastic location. Leopold II on the walls adds a touch to the decor that you don't see often ;)
reviewTitle: Great value, good service, fantastic location

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: What a fabulous selection of Belgium beers. We loved the Rodenbach Grand Cru on draft, a rare find and stunningly delicious. Lots of lovely ales to choose from. A friendly bar, unfortunately had no time to eat there this time. Will definitely return.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Popped in here en speck, after struggling to find somewhere for Sunday brunch. So pleased! We were tempted in by the $20, which includes a mimosa, but ended up choosing from their regular brunch menu. We’re in NYC for my birthday and last nights meal was a bit of a fiasco (joe’s shanghai...don’t ask!)
It’s one on those things, different strokes for different folks, but we were so pleased to find this place. We order the lamb sausage and harissa baguette + the steak burger baguette, 3 beers, 2 glasses of wine, 2 Cointreau + 1 margarita in a pear tree, and we shared a waffle (don’t judge us, it’s my birthday) $125.37 all in. Have paid a lot more for an awful lot less! Lamb sausage baguette was especially good, tasty sausage and nicely spiced. Steak burger was also good but comes cooked a European medium (rare). Waffle was incredibly light (don’t know if it was homemade, but very good.
Yes, it’s busy. Yes, it’s noisy! Yes they have sports on tv.....and? A vibrant place with great staff, even better food. Wish we’d found this place a few days ago! ❤️
Question is would we return. Definitely, a yes!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: 여러종류의 맥주를 보유하고 있습니다. 음식도 맛있습니다. 저녁에 활기가 있는 분위기 괜찮은 음식점입니다.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Great choice for a pre or post theatre meal - known for a huge selection of beers and mussels. Belgian inspired so mussels & frites ( fries) are the main meals but also burgers etc. Very noisy in the early evening hours - perfectly situated in the heart of the Broadway theatre district

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Interior feels like what Belgians call a "brown café". Brasserie style typical belgian food served, like beef stew, or mussels. Large choice of Belgian beers. I always go back when I am around in NYC, which definitely means I appreciate the food and the staff.
reviewTitle: Belgians, if you feel homesick in NY, here is where you want to go!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Veel van gelezen maar toch ontgoocheld bij het binnenkomen. Geen vriendelijke ontvangst. Kaart ziet er ok uit en ook de selectie van bieren was ok.
Mijn vrouw en ik hadden een Ceasar Salad gevraagd met kip maar van die kip was er weinig te vinden. Nog maar gedaan met eten en hup de desertkaart voor je neus geduwd. Ik had de indruk dat alles gehaast moest gaan. De tip hebben we zeker NIET gegeven want we hebben zelfs geen woord gehoord van deze persoon.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
as the title this is a good bar for Belgium Beers.
We drank in here on a few occasions, we also ate here and were served by a pretty girl with attitude, not a good one may i say.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Après avoir bu un bon verre en balade, nous sommes revenus pour le déjeuner et nous avons mangé léger pour éviter la fatigue d'après-midi. Repas sympa, restaurant plein, il vaut mieux venir tôt pour avoir une place. Bière belge au choix.
reviewTitle: café comme on l'aime chez nous

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
We zijn hier voor een verjaardag komen eten en onze verwachtingen lagen heel hoog. 
Aangezien wij zelf uit België komen wisten we wel dat in New York iets typisch Belgisch eten waarschijnlijk niet hetzelfde zou zijn als thuis. Maar het was gewoon echt niét lekker. Over de bediening kunnen we niets slecht zeggen, alhoewel er op voorhand gevraagd werd aan de uitbaters om kaarsjes te voorzien voor de jarige was hier helemaal niets mee gedaan. Ze wisten zelf niet dat iemand jarig was. Het eten dan, was écht ondermaats voor de prijs ! Mosselen waren niet te eten, half rauw en de groentjes ook. Daarnaast nog 14$ betaald voor een kriek en we kwamen op onze duurste rekening uit in NYC. Wij komen alleszins niet terug.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We met friends here for an early Friday night dinner as they had theater tickets in the immediate neighborhood. This place was my recommendation as it sounded like a good choice and was convenient. We wanted a place to eat good food and to visit and figured that 6pm would allow us to do that. We were wrong ! As we entered we saw that this was a sports bar with blaring TVs all over the place and guys 4 deep at the bar. The noise level was HIGH as were many of the men at the bar. We walked to the back where there are tables and chose one at the very back of the place but it made no difference. We strained to hear one another nor were we impressed by the bowls of mussels which were quite ordinary. What a disappointment.
reviewTitle: The Enthusiastic Reviews of this Place are a Mystery to me

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Upscale diner feel to it.  Lots of choices on the menu.  Chicken pot pie was great and for January non drinkers there are good mocktails.  Pleasant atmosphere before they turn up the music later at night. Good service.  Would also recommend the ginger tuna or Cobb salad.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Here for round two of my daughters birthday. The staff was amazing, attentive, and spot on.  We asked for recommendations, and we loved our meal.  Chicken and Waffles are perfect, and the Meatloaf could have served four people....but the Mac and Cheese....killer!  Loved the atmosphere and the waitstaff, Michael and Jacob went out of their way to make sure all of our needs were met, they are the best!   Truly the only thing I would suggest is adding Kettle Orange to your bar.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Again, New Yorkers are so helpful and willing to share special spots so here another one.  This place is hip, trendy, and so lively.  Drinks are the best in town and the food is also delightful.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The menu isnt extensive, but it does have enough great things to order. Like HELLO.. give me those mac and cheese spring rolls!  The burger is fantastic and the parmesan truffle fries are banging!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I went to the outsider art show which I always enjoy. Right around the corner was cafeteria having not been there before and I thought I would give it a try. I had a very enjoyable late breakfast of their special French toast and a delicious coffee. Very pleasant and attentive service. Not inexpensive but very fairly priced.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Had pancakes and fruit bowl, both of which were excellent. Outdoor seating is quiet noisy but sitting inside is fine

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
5 of us had brunch. Food was very good, Good menu, reasonably priced for NYC.

The room was small but well-appointed. Tables were somewhat crowded.Good menu. The bathroom was remarkable. Service was average.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I've been hearing about Cafeteria for years and looked at their awesome menu and couldn't wait to go for brunch. After waiting 20 min at a crowded bar we got seated. We waited another 10 min to place an order or even receive a glass of water. Our first course came without any utensils on the table and one of the plates of food was still raw on the inside.  We complained and sent it back only to receive a second order of the same food that now was frozen solid in it's center. Confusing. Disappointing. Terrible service. Walked out and will never go back.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: This place is chic and trendy, open 24 hours so great if you're jet lagged. The food is delicious and so are the drinks. Fabulous service.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Ate here in a blizzard one Saturday morning. Was well worth the 20 minute wait; delicious salmon Benedict served up in a trendy, buzzing atmosphere. Charming staff and quickly served. Would go back anytime!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Went for brunch with friends and absolutely loved the food and coffee! Our server was excellent and accommodating. Food was so fresh and tasty! Definitely worth a visit. Smile hostess!
reviewTitle: Excellent food and service, hostess could crack a smile 😀

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We loved this place, the ambiance was really cool and hip, the food was wonderful and the server that we had was so much fun and upbeat! I had the Mac n' Cheese trio and it was phenomenal. The only weird thing that happened was when my Mom was eating her steamed mussels. She bit down and felt something weird and it was a little crab!! It had hidden in the mussel and she was freaked out. We had a good laugh about it with the waiter and he offered to get her a different meal, but she was done. All in all... a great place to go.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Perfeito e completamente fora da rota turística. Ambiente amplo e sem fila de espera. Preço justo, comida deliciosa e atendimento impecável!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Home style food! Very warm and nice! Good price and good food. Perfect after looking around the neighborhood.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We called into the Cafeteria as it's pretty reliable. I suppose I just wanted a practical meal, which I got. A tasty salad, but the chicken didn't add much to it. My partners Mac and cheese was nice, but just that. The tastiest thing was the warm biscuits. 

I don't think there is anything wrong, just nothing wow! The service is friendly. It's OK...I just seem to find it fine.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Très bien, les mets proposés à la carte sont originaux et une fois l'assiette en face de vous, la saveur est là. Seulement, comme il a été souligné dans de nombreux commentaires, le lieu est vraiment très bruyant. Malgré l'affluence, le personnel reste dévoué.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I got an omelette and he got the chicken and waffles. Both were average. Nothing crazy special. The waffle was described as cheddar and Tabasco but we couldn't really taste any of that. I wouldn't seek this place out on a special trip to NYC for for a meal. I think you could do better. But, in a pinch, it was a decent meal. If you like horseradishy bloody Mary's, then try theirs. I couldn't finish it. I guess I don't!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The food was fresh and delicious - the ambiance was really nice and chic.  The waiters were extremely friendly and attentive (in their cute tight jeans).  We all enjoyed our food.  The only con was watching one of the waiters walk around and scrape the food out of the grooves in the tables :-\ I would have preferred not to have to watch that, maybe do that after hours. We were the first ones in the restaurant that day so obviously it was old and should have been cleaned before opening. BUT overall, highly recommend and would return.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: My family visited this chic restaurant this week. We tried a lil of everything the Mac Attack was very flavorful and it came out hot & fast. The fish & chips were tasty yet not greasy. The fries were cooked to much though; a little hard. We also tried the  Ginger Salmon and my mom finished her entire plate. My daughter also had the Branzino fish and the presentation was nice. I also had the Salted Carmel milkshake. It was great... A must do in New York.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Three friends went for brunch.  First the positive: my omelette with avocado and goat cheese plus roast potatoes was excellent, as was the toast and coffee. BUT! 1.  The tables, very attractive, have grooves in them.  The grooves are caked with ancient food which is unsanitary and unappetizing.  2.  The fellow who came around with the coffee was totally aloof.  3.  It took 40 minutes for our food to come.  When my friend complained, it turned out that there had been a mix up in the order.  It was NOT a relaxing brunch despite the lovely food.
reviewTitle: Fabulous omelette BUT I'll never go back!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We had fried calamari that is blanch (no taste/not seasoned) for apetizer, Delmonico Ribeye that is good but too much onions and the steak fries do not taste good with Parmigiano cheese on them.  We also ordered the Pappardelle wide pasta with shrimp and it was okay.  I had a white wine that tasted old.  The piano player that Saturday night was awesome though.  Overall, Lorenzo's is a 3 star out of 5 star.
reviewTitle: Service is excellent but the food is 3 out of 5 star rating

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We bought tickets to see Joe Piscopo. You needed to buy dinner to see the show. We were pleasantly surprised that the food was very tasty. A little disappointed that it was a limited menu but good none the less. Drinks were good and not watered down. Pleasant atmosphere, good service.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We met a group of friends for breakfast on a Sunday (their brunch begins at 11:30, breakfast before that.)
The food was fairly good.  The omelet station was the most efficient I've ever seen, several cooks, many pans, quick order taking and turn around with a nice, custom omelette.
It's all buffet, so the wait staff doesn't need to do much.  But we had to struggle to get coffee refilled.  If they just brought a carafe for the table I would have rated them very good.  We repeatedly had to just about beg to get refills.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Very nice atmosphere.... Great for Sunday brunch and for a night out with that significant other... Very nice menu located in the Hilton garden... The bar right outside of the restaurant very nice for cocktails

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Food familiar and prepared perfect
Breakfast buffet has more than adequate choices and the omelette chef is great
reviewTitle: Awesome food and wait staff...Jimmy is great! Great sense of humor.  They all are very friendly.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Drinks were a little over priced but that's what you get at a hotel. The space was pretty tight. The ambiance was pretty cool, slightly trendy.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We stayed at the Hilton Garden and felt very lucky to have such a good restaurant right on the premises!  We enjoyed lunch and the breakfast buffet.  Food was tasty and the service was excellent.  Staff were very attentive and pleasant to my children, which can make a big difference for family dining.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Food not all that good and the service could be a lot better.Besides being over rated they are also over priced for food and drinks and I believe in going to a place at least three times or more before I give up on them because you can catch any restaurant on a bad night.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Delicious food. Great atmosphere. Great Service. I've never been there during a show but that is definitely on my bucket list.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Had dinner and a show at Lorenzo's in October.  Food was very good and the entertainment was excellent.  I saw the a Drifters in concert. There was an excellent view of the stage wherever you sit.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Unlike many hotel bars, Lorenzo's has a great welcoming vibe.  The place was full of road warriors and we all had a nice time exchanging stories.  Food was good and not overly priced.  The place was full and the bartender was very busy but she did not miss a beat.  Looking forward to a return visit.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Sunday dinner buffet was excellent. Great antipasto, meatballs, chicken piccata. Loved dessert bar with chocolate fountain.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
One of the best Italian restaurants in New York (and I'm a native New Yorker). Ozzie was my waiter and he was friendly and extremely knowledgable. This was my 4th visit and, as usual, it was outstanding. The piano player was extraordinary and played all my requests. I didn't want to leave, and stayed for two hours. Th calamari was the best I've ever had, and the shrimp was delicious. If you're in New York you must make a point of visiting this hotspot. Prices were reasonable, especially for the great food they served. Kudos to everyone!
Bill Bennett

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We went to Lorenzo restaurant for a holiday get together. The 
sunday dinner was wonderful. 
we also had a birthday celebration at a sunday brunch. Both were excellent. We will be going back again
pat devine

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: This is a very nice restaurant with good food from sandwiches to steaks located in the Hilton Garden Inn. We had both lunch and dinner there and were very pleased with everything we ordered!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Not only have I been to Lorenzo's for a wonderful brunch & dinner, but I also had my small & intimate wedding dinner in the beautifully decorated & private Wine Room there. The food is delicious, the staff is always so attentive & professional & The Nicotra's will do whatever it takes to make your experience unforgettable.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: My boyfriend and I didn't enjoy the food at all and everybody is so old. It's definitely not a favorite of mine. I definitely will not be returning unless I absolutely must.
reviewTitle: It's kind of an old age home.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Food was good my Pork Chop special was also well presented and my wife Veal was fork tender,
Fried Calamari super tender and tasty the server with helper were very attentive 
The only issue we made a reservation trough Open Table and when we arrived the hostess not even want to hear our name she stopped me and say OK  she walked a few feet with us than she point our table 15 feet away and left Place was empty (3 tables) i didnt see any reason for rushing 
i went back to her telling her to mark down our name again she just said OK but i was never checked out WHY?
I have been there several times and i will go back one person doesnt change a place and suggest other people to try Lorenzo

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Unfortunately, whilst i like the Hilton hotel which Lorenzo's is part of, i think the restaurant is appalling for evening meals. This is the 3rd and last time i try the restaurant. The service was poor, with arrogant and rude staff. The meals when served were cold. We have made the owner aware of our concerns, but we won't be using Lorenzo's again. There are plenty of other good eateries local to the hotel. To ensure fairness, the breakfast is superb. The breakfast is cooked fresh and the staff go out of their way to help. Complete contrast.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: For a restaurant situated in a hotel I was surprised at the quality of service, food, and atmosphere. We had excellent service, our waiter was over friendly. The food was excellent, and far greater than I expected. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the Staten Island restaurant. I would recommend a collar shirt and nice jeans at the very least.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My girlfriend and I took the macaron baking class and it was awesome!  Chef Jean made the class enjoyable and the pace was great.  The best part was being able to enjoy the macarons that you make!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Very professional, exceedingly well-prepared class for making croissants and the results were excellent. Participants left with 15 + just baked croissants and extra dough to make more at home. The class was a gift to my  12-year-old grand-daughter who loved the whole experience!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My girlfriend and I went for a baking class for French Macaroons. The staff was very polite, kind and professional. We had a wonderful time. Would highly recommend!!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: It was excellent. We enjoyed ourselves. The macaroons turned out very good. Clean place and the chef was friendly

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Great class. Learned how to make the croissant dough, how to laminate and shape the dough, how to proof and bake for a perfect result.
reviewTitle: Croissant Class was fun, informative and delicious

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I attended the croissant and the mille feuille class here. Both were very informative and the individual hands on approach ensured each student was involved. Taking home my baked goods was so satisfying!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My husband and I were given the macaron making class as a Christmas gift. It was such a unique and thoughtful gift and the whole experience was really great. The pastry chef, John, was so nice and friendly, that he made it even more enjoyable. The macarons we made were delicious, as was the almond croissant we ate before the class.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I went with my boyfriend and we had the best time! You get to learn how to make the macarons from start to finish. It was so engaging and so much fun. Plus you get to take home 24 macarons that you make yourself! Highly highly recommend!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Amazing.  We had so much fun.  The instructor was very nice, attentive, and funny.  It was worth every penny and then some.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: This is a small, well lit cafe where I always go to buy my bread and croissants when friends from France visit. They are never disappointed. It's also a great little place to have a coffee and watch the street life.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Loved the classes, looking forward to more! Food is delish too! People helpful, friendly, informative.
reviewTitle: Fabulous! I have taken the macaron as croissant class so far and am seriously looking  forward to more!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My husband and I took a croissant making class on Saturday with Chef Dimitri that we highly recommend! The class was immersive (each student had their own station so we could each work through every step) which is usually my problem with many of these cooking classes. Chef Dimitri was clear and helpful and the best part was we came home with at least 15 croissants plus the dough to make another 10-15!
reviewTitle: Great classes offered at this quaint bakery!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: It was a present for Christmas for my son. He had a wonderful experience and so did his friend. They both learned how to make croissants and brought them home to enjoy with their families.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The class was excellent and informative. The teacher was enaging and helpful. So happy I got to bring home such delicious croissants!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I have been visiting Mille-Feuille for over 2 years and it is always a pleasure! The food is excellent and the service friendly. I also took their Croissants making and Eclairs & Choux workshops and I had fun while learning about French pastry making. I am a customer for life! <3

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I just took their macaron class, and I could not have been happier with the experience (or with the yummy treats that we created)! Chef Jean was amazing–very informative, hands on and patient. I gained a terrific understanding of, and new respect for, one of my favorite desserts. I highly recommend the class!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My daughter and I took a macaron making class at this quaint little French bakery. Chef Jean was the perfect teacher, helping with every step and the final product.... delicious!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Great baking class and hand on experience! I still can't believe I made eclairs! They were delicious and I can't wait to make them again at home.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My son (10) and I attended the macaron class with a friend and his mom. (My son LOVES macarons). The instructor was thorough, friendly and he really teaches you about macarons and the process. We had a great time - and were able to take Home 2 dozen cookies each!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My best friend and I wanted to learn how to make Macarons and we found this class offering at Mille Feuille. It was FANTASTIC! The class format was very structured, yet friendly. We learned so much and left confident about our ability to make perfect macarons. We are so happy and will definitely be taking more pastry classes at Mille Feuille!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Ambiance belge bien reproduite, repas délicieux, certains serveurs parlent français.

Diffuse également le football européen.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Very good restaurant with a lot of Belgian beers and Belgian recipes with an American touch. Service was very friendly and good, as the location at a few 100 meters from Times Square.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: BXL Cafe manages to bring a bit of Belgian cafe culture to the busy heart of Manhattan. We tasted the Carbonnade Flamande with fries, which was very nice. It can get a bit load though, so not ideal if you are looking for a good conversation with your meal.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Wife and I were looking for a restaurant in mid-town East and had decided to find it using the technique least likely to succeed: Walking around.

But it WORKED. We stumbled onto BXL East. Upon entering, the general manager greeted us and seated us. Offered us several tables, none of which we wanted, but he let us choose another, more secluded table he apparently didn't want to give away. Very particular about those tables, he was.

The food (traditional Italian, it seemed) was wonderful! Reasonably to low-priced for Manhattan and the dining area was far enough away from the bar that quiet conversation could be had. Just really enjoyed the time there, and was pleasantly surprised when the bill didn't break the bank.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
La serveuse loin d'être au top ! Déçus, surtout qu'au moment de l'addition elle entoure le tips comme pour dire : "N'oubliez pas "Un peu exagéré je trouve ! sinon bon rapport qualité prix ... 
malheureusement, d'autre Resto à faire à New-York avant celui la ...

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Stumbled on this delightful little place, opposite the Stephen Sondheim theatre, whilst looking for something to eat before an afternoon matinee. Atmospheric and continental feeling. My son and husband judged the Belgium beer to be excellent.The food was really good. Had the best Chevre chaud salad ever, (and we have had a home in the south of France.) Would always go back there on future visits. We thought ourselves lucky to find somewhere of this quality so near to Times Square. Not expensive and very good value for money.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Cenamos 2 veces en él. De los mejores sitios en los que comimos en N.Y. El entrecote, de los mejores que he comido; los spaghetti carbonara, increíbles y de gran tamaño. Te ponen agua y pan con mantequilla. Muy agradables y nada caro para ser Nueva York. Lo único malo, la propina obligatoria

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Nous sommes tombés dessus par hasard. Pas très loin de notre hôtel  à times square  .et se fût  une surprise. .le personnels parle Français. Il est tenu par des Belges.
La nourriture est très bonne. Grand choix de plats, Et de bière.  Notre serveuse était au petit soin pour nous..musique un peu forte..
Très bonne adresse.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Outstanding choice of Belgian beers. Excellent food. Reasonable prices, right off time square. A real gem!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: un endroit super sympa, une belle déco très typique, un repas d'un excellent rapport qualité prix, de la bière du monde et surtout un patron très sympa !

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Exceptional food, friendly service, and trully stellar beer selection (especially the Belgian beers on tap). The steak frites was perfect. If you have ever had it in Belgium and want to relive the experience, look no further. Also, the prices were very reasonable, particularly given the excellent midtown location. Loved this place!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Great place for pre or post show meal including brunch before a matinee.  Love the authentic Belgian/French food and drink.  Omelettes, salads with tasty dressing, and burgers were all good as well as the crispy fries.  Also happy with prices because Times Square is notorious for mediocre food at chain restaurants and this is the opposite.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Lovely bristle food.  Great energy.  Very noisy and hot (it's always packed) but its worth it.  I have a feeling it is a beer-lovers heaven (I do not drink beer so that's just what my buddies I've dined with tell me.)  No pretense.  Very nice service.  And it's a super friendly environment.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Exceptional and delicious casual Belgium Pub food, great selection of wine and beer and great prices for a place one block off Times Square!  Dark and intimate with attentive and friendly bar staff!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We love this Belgian place! We always have one of the moules frites but they have many other items on the menu from which to select. The cafe on 43rd St. is convenient for before or after theatre. I can get rather noisy due to  TV screens showing sporting events. Service has always been friendly & efficient as well. If you prefer a quieter atmosphere try their other restaurant BXL Route on @ 22nd Street.
reviewTitle: Wonderful Belgian moules frites in a festive atmosphere

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Muy agradable y amables en el servicio. Nos paramos por la tarde a tomar una cerveza con unas entradas.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Great  Mussels and very good beer.  Very nice bar, and the décor is always very
Euro.  All staff was very friendly.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: This is one of our favorites in NYC and we always find time to visit at least once when we're in town. The food is delicious (try the vin blanc et creme moules frites!) and the Belgian beer selection is impressive. Such a special, relatively unknown gem. When Belgium has a televised soccer match, it's wonderful to be with Belgian expats cheering on the team!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Petit restaurant / bar bien sympathique, tenu par un Belge.
Ambiance conviviale et serveurs / serveuses à l'écoutent.
Nous avons goûté aux hamburgers 🍔 un régal !!!
À chaque fois que je vais à NYC je m'y arrête ❤️

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We have searched all over time square for good food on a budget. This place is amazing, a gem in the sea of rocks... Potato cake amazing.... Pancakes delicious.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: This is a great place to hang out.  First of all, they have a lot of beers on tap and they're very good.  There's also a full bar and a big food menu.  But best of all, in addition to their indoor seating there's a courtyard with outdoor seating as well as its own bar.  It's a great place to pass a summer evening.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Ruime keuze aan verschillende (eigen) lekkere biertjes van de tap. Kan van 1 glas tot hele pitcher. Drinken zelf halen bij de bar en eten zelf bestellen bij de keuken. Gezellige drukke tent.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Their crafted beers were very interesting.  Unique, seasonal taste that was very refreshing.  If you like well crafted beer, stop in.  We did not eat so I have no review of the food.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Ambiente super agradável, serviço simpático e eficiente, comida espetacular (wow, eles têm um prato de petiscos de couve de Bruxelas!!!) e cerveja incrível. Não tem como melhorar. Não é à toa que fica cheio. Wowww!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Some good brews here.  Lots of help from the bartender to select a good match.  Not too crowded in the daytime.  Great area to explore.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
One of Gowanus' best..
Huge selection of beers, nice space, delicious meatballs. 
Odd layout - bar is in the back... 
But food is good - bring it to own table... huge selection of beers. 
Not too expensive. 
Feels like i should be in Portland, OR. Fun spot - probably not to good for big groups.
Right off fourth ave.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Sehr legere Atmosphäre. Das Bier ist für einen Österreicher etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig aber ok. Die Burger sehr gut aber klein.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
On possibly the coldest night of this winter, we strolled ( ok, walked incredibly fast) to Threes for a pre dinner beer.  It was crowded and the mood was jovial, friendly and welcoming.  Threes stocks an incredible array of beers, wine, etc. The names on the chalkboard wall are reason enough to pop in for a little refreshment.   Wandering Bine, Vliet, so many I cannot recall.  We tasted a pilsner and a single IPA, both excellent, as was the Prosecco.      Like many local breweries, the decor is industrial but comfortable.   We did not try the food but we saw some really enticing burger combos at the table next to us..

We would go again, preferably when the wind
 chill is above 10
reviewTitle: Chilly outside, warm and welcoming inside!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: From simple to complex, IPA to stout, there will be a beer for everyone here. I had a great time reading all the flavors in all the beers. My friends and I managed to grab a table and we ordered some food. The Hot Chicken Sandwich was probably the best chicken sandwich I have ever had! The fries were great too. My friends got a burger (very good) and a yogurt bowl (looked good but I was already shoving Chicken in my face and didn’t manage to try it).

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
The beer is very good I particularly liked the Threes wandering bine.
With 19 different beer types there is something for everyone.
The best thing is that it was not packed, and you could move around.
The music was also very good.
A very nice place to sit and drink beer with friends.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: We sat at the bar (lucky to get seat) to sample some of the local beers.  They were great.  This is a very busy place, on a very unassuming location.  The bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: We stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon to check out their beers, and we were not disappointed.  The space is really inviting, and the back patio is fantastic.  It was really busy, so we waited a while for beers at the bar, but their beer selection was great.  We didn't get food, but some friends we were with did, and they raved about the hot chicken sandwich.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Nice place for a weekend beer hunt with friends. Always packed with a lovely outdoor space. Very limited beer selection.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: This is a big place with a couple of levels and an outside garden space. The beer room looked nice, but we opted for the outside. Order, pay and take your drinks from the bar space outside. Quite a few tables, you have to find your own space. A lot of people were just standing and drinking.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Limited menu choices.  Burger was fare, nothing special.  Vegie burger was awful, dry, crumbly, not at all a "burger".  buns were soggy, not even eatable, which tells me they sat for awhile.  The fries tasted great, but seemed like they were the bottom of the barrel, as these were more like "pieces of fries".  I quite hate having to pay a tip when I order, BEFORE I get the food to know it if is worth it...and there is NO service, so what does the tip go for anyway?  Beer is nice, but not worth it if you want some food.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
Very friendly staff considering the bar was jammed both times my co-workers and I walked from our hotel around the corner to unwind from marathon work days.
Overall the beer was cold and the food was typical bar food once we were able to order.
Look forward to coming back to this place the next trip to Brooklyn
reviewTitle: Nice Bar But Way under staffed during the week!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: My friend and I stopped here out of brewery tour of Brooklyn. It was pretty busy, but we managed to find a bench outside to sit on while we enjoyed our brews. The patio area was pretty nice on a summer's day.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: After having walked past this place a couple of times when in the area earlier this year I was excited to finally try it at the end of a long day of work/travel today.  I ordered my food at the food station close to the entrance and went immediately to the bar to order my beer while the food was being prepared.  The bar was busy but seemed fairly adequately staffed, yet I waited and waited for probably 15 minutes while others to the left and right of me were served over and over again.  The servers from the food stand tried to serve me my food TWICE while I was standing there and I had to ask them to take it back twice, as I had no place to put it.  I finally came to the conclusion that the woman with the short curly hair behind the bar was deliberately avoiding serving me, as there was absolutely no way she didn't see me there for so long.  I was quiet and had been patiently waiting for her to finally get to me, and she even made very brief eye contact with me one time and then quickly looked away.  I was very hungry and my food was getting cold so I had to finally give up and ask the restaurant folks (who were very helpful tonight) to pack it up to go.  I was soooo disappointed!  I had been planning to listen to the live music there.  What a terrible and frustrating experience.  The food was very good (hot chicken sandwich and green salad)...would have been much, much better with a beer.  Unfortunately this place is a brewery, not a restaurant, so I have to review it based on my brewery experience.  I could have gotten great food at so many other places in the neighborhood, with a guaranteed beer.
reviewTitle: Could not get service at the bar, but good food

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Not a typical place to have brunch at, but it was the perfect choice as it was not crowded and offered some limited but very delicious choices. The beer was very good and you can get it in a variety of sizes! The man behind the bar is very helpful and could help you if you cannot decide. On top of all of that, they have a very cute garden in the back where you can spend a lovely time in the sun!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: This place is great, the beer and hard cider are excellent the staff is top shelf very hard working and very friendly.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I have to admit the food here is pretty good the chef knows what he's doing. The staff was warm and welcoming. Also if you eat here you have a good chance of meeting the owner Nicotra

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Our club had its Christmas party there on a Saturday night. The staff was very friendly and the food very well done. Even with 30+ people in the group service never wavered!
Open bar for 4 hours and great menu choices for a great inclusive price.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
The staff was on top of it and checked back very often. had a very nice meal if anything it was to much food and I am a eater.
Quality and presentation of the food was very good. Not cheap but well within the normal for a over priced area like NY. I would eat here again.
reviewTitle: Very good food with excelent service
