placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We enjoyed a pleasant, leisurely breakfast at Lorenzo's.  The custom omelettes, with sides were very tasty.  There was a nice offering of fruits, fruit juices, pastries, bagels, cold cereal, etc.  We ordered our omelettes at the omelette bar and then they were delivered to our table by the waitstaff.  We liked the crisp white linens and the table arrangements; we had the sense of "dining" as we enjoyed our delicious breakfast.  Each staff member we encountered was extremely friendly, polite and helpful.  Our breakfast experience was very pleasant and we would return for another meal at Lorenzo's.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We eat at many restaurants on the Island and Lorezo's is, by far, one of the best on the Island! The food is worth every penny and such an incredible value. The staff is well-trained and I have never had a complaint. Keep it up.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I went here for the first time for a baby shower. The restaurant is connected to a hotel but very easy to get to, with a large parking lot. The food was excellent and the staff was very attentive to our needs. I would recommend this place for a small gathering.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The food was very good and well priced. The service was good along w/ the atmosphere. I also enjoyed the opportunity and availability to enjoy a nightcap.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Food was terrific and so was the service.  Prices were very reasonable.  Very pleasant atmosphere.  Dinner & lunch were wonderful.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I’ve had several functions at Lorenzo’s which include my husbands 50th birthday, daughters sweet sixteen, and several personal dinner as well as brunches.  My husband and I got married at the Hilton 3 years ago and fell in love with the ambiance, food and service.  We vowed to celebrate every anniversary there.  For the first time Lorenzo’s did not even come close to meeting it’s expectations.  Our three year anniversary was yesterday and the service was poor to say the least.  Alex was our waiter and Vito was there also. They appeared to be chasing their own tales last night.  We waited a very long time for each course.  Our portions were incredibly small. Even the black out cake was cold.  We paid a lot of money for less than average food. Best part of the meal was the salad and coffee, which is pretty sad considering it was a $145.00 bill.  I’m hoping this was just an off night. I must say it wasn’t worth the travel from Brooklyn.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Food was excellent! Service great. Little Pricey but well worth it.  One of  the 4 of us couldn't find anything she liked on menu, the Chef came out and made any dish she wanted! How awesome is that??

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The sandwiches and calamari are of the highest quality and outstanding taste.  Naturally, the bread and pastry are excellent
reviewTitle: A sandwich shop worth visiting Staten Island for

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: As we were staying at the Hampton inn which is in the next complex, we found this restaurant accidently. We were tired after our long drive from Toronto so we didn't want to venture out too far. Service was excellent and the food was very good. We were early so we didn't see any entertainment. It is not too expensive and the ambiance is very nice. Enjoy!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We had eaten at Lorenzo's before and it wasn't bad. This time we went on cabaret night which has a show for a charge and a limited menu (which they did not mention when I made the reservation). The appetizers were good a simple shrimp cocktail and a sausage pinwheel that my husband enjoyed. However, as an entree we both ordered short ribs. The cut was really poor quality, over cooked and chewy with very little flavor that also rang true of the dense mashed potatoes. The asparagus were the dim star of the dish. For desert my husband had lava cake with "gelato" which was cold rather than warm. I had cherries jubilee with "gelato" AKA cherry jelly with iced cream. Service was ok but the bus boy was attentive. Very disappointed on our anniversary.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Nach einer langen Fahrt hatten wir keine Lust mehr, uns nochmal ins Auto zu setzen und gingen deshalb ins Lorenzo's direkt neben dem Hampton Inn. An diesem Abend gab es Buffet für 29,95 $/ Person. Die Auswahl war gut, Salate, Antipasti und allerlei Pastavariationen ( auch vegetarisch :-)), die man sich frisch zubereiten lassen konnte. Es gab sogar Vollkornlinguini! Bei den Nachspeisen wussten wir gar nicht, wo wir anfangen sollten: frisches Obst, Kuchen, blueberry cobbler und sogar ein Schokobrunnen (ist ja mehr Show, aber mal ganz nett).  Vom Hotel hatten wir Gutscheine für einen Drink/Dessert bekommen, so dass das nicht extra berechnet wurde. Ungewöhnlich, dass das Trinkgeld automatisch vom Kellner draufgerechnet wurde,die Rechnung kam nämlich mit dem Hinweis "Service is included". Keine Ahnung, ob das bei jedem Gast so gemacht wird oder ob sie bei uns Bedenken hatten, dass wir zu wenig Trinkgeld geben. Es war aber in etwa das, was wir ohnehin gegeben hätten, von daher hat es dann schon gepasst. Trotzdem habe ich das lieber, wenn man es mir überlässt.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I had eaten here before, and was again reminded how good the food and service are.  Very well taken care of and dinner was delicious.  The atmosphere is very relaxing, the servers are attentive but not overly intrusive!  Will definitely visit again!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Lorenzo's has a terrific menu, with a wide range of interesting and tasty dishes.  Our table of six had steak, seafood, pasta, and risotto and all seemed to enjoy their choices.  Coffee and dessert (especially the cheesecake) were also very good.  I didn't pay the check, but the prices seemed very reasonable for the quality and portion sizes.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Its not the cheapest but it's a great location fr conducting an early morning usiness breakfast with a delicious assortment of your typical breast items plus made to order eggs. 

Hey.... You want to sit in a noisy diner?  Try ths option and youl'll come out a winner.
reviewTitle: A Great Little Breakfast Place - Inside the Hilton Garden Inn

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
I have been at Lorenzo's several times,  I love it because is convenient for me as I work by the Corporate Park area and since I get a one hour lunch break, I'm able to sit down in a nice atmosphere and order my lunch.  Love their olive bread and salads.  Their service is always great!  

Today I was able to enjoy my burger at half price as it's national burger day, and our server was very nice and accommodating as we didn't want fries with it so he gave us salad with our burger.

I have tried their crab cakes which I strongly recommend as they're delicious.  Their prices are reasonable.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Very good food but pricey, even for a hotel. I enjoy the free breakfast every morning but would not pay for it without my Diamond benefits.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: In the hotel lobby. The food was very average and the service was nothing special. The best person was AARON a busboy who took care of us better then the waiter.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
You wouldn't expect with the name of this restaurant that you would be walking into a chic, yet affordable (for New York).  Great comfort food - especially their selection of Macaroni Cheeses!  Friendly service and convenient location.

Very festive as well with holiday décor!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Locale sempre attuale, ogni volta che sono a New York ci passo sempre volentieri anche solo per un caffè.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Mac attack a must this place gets busy quick we eat at the bar great service easy to find wait time was like 15 min the drinks are good too in friendly area  went on a weekend

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
It's probably been ten years since I've been to Cafeteria and it's every bit as good as I remember. I recently had lunch there with a group of friends and it was a cozy place to duck into on a cold day for a festive holiday lunch. 

We did not have a reservation and we arrived before the lunch rush and were seated right away. Our waiter had a great sense of humor and was very friendly and attentive.  We started out with a couple of champagne cocktails and I highly recommend the Kir Royale which was made with there own liqueur instead of Chambord ---it was excellent! 

Absolutely everything on the menu was tempting, but I had the pear and endive salad which was very subtle and tasty. We shared a truffle mac and cheese which was absolutely the best I've ever had.  We also shared several orders of fries. The truffle fries were delicious, but the sweet potato fries were outstanding, perfectly cooked and seasoned, again probably the best I've had. 

All and all a very enjoyable lunch!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Ate brunch here with group of 5.  As they don't take reservations we got our name in and waited approximately 20 minutes.  The main floor is very sunny and pleasant with a wall of windows that open up onto the street in nice weather.  The room is very loud though.  We were seated in the lower level which was very dark, subterranean feel and not especially well-decorated.  The trade-off was that we were easily to talk with one another  2 of us had the custom omelets and enjoyed them.  1 had the poached egg/salmon dish and licked the plate clean.  1 had a hamburger and said it was "OK."  1 had the chicken/waffles and really enjoyed it.  The food was good and our server was very helpful.  If you go, ask to be seated on the main floor.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Desayunos variados en un buen ambiente y con un buen servicio. Aunque bastante lentos.
Bacon buenísimo,salchichas bastante secas lo mismo que las tortitas. Los huevos bien fritos.
En conjunto desayuno bastante mediocre y caro.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
I ask for the concierge to suggest a place that have Deep Fried Oreo, and they recommended this place. 

It's really casual and not pretentious but the food is just basic and not particularly good. 

Their Deep fried Oreo is definitely not as good as the one at CATCH, and not even their 'signature' Mac and cheese are particularly good.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The food here is really quite good.  I ordered the skirt steak and it was delicious.  We all tried it and agreed it was well marinated and quite tasty.  The salads we ordered were quite large and the mac and cheese is quite good.  Trout was even tasty.  Desserts are to die for and quite unique.  Service was excellent...not just our excellent waiter but the bus boys were on top of filling up our water and cleaning our plates.  And even the host was very friendly.  Bathroom area was quite cool.  Atmosphere is very nice and trendy.  There is a comfy lounge downstairs and typical restaurant upstairs with cool garage doors opening up onto sidewalk patio.  Overall, this is a great place to hang out, enjoy good food, and not break the bank.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: This is a great location and open 24 hours for late night clabbers in the area. The mac and cheese is supposed to be to die for but I didn't think it was as good as what I make at home.. It was honestly quite bland. However, the chicken pot pie was amazing and I would absolutely recommend it, it tastes just like homemade comfort food. The service was just ok, my server was cocky as if he didn't need my tip and didn't care but the food was good for sure!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We stumbled on this place while staying in Manhattan. Its name didn't describe the great cuisine within. It is all in black & white, with young waiters, up-scale atmosphere, but reasonable. We had the calamari which was tender and flavorful with hot peppers, the pear salad was full of fruit for a change, with all sorts of extras thrown in. The burgers were flavorful, perfectly cooked to order and we finished off with the "Mile High" carrot cake, WOW a multi level layer cake with cream cheese and butter cream frosting, stood 8" off the table, deeeeeelicious!
reviewTitle: Had Fun Hear while antiquing in Mahattan

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I always eat at least one meal at Cafeteria when I am in NYC. They do a good job with ramped up comfort food. I am not normally a big fan of meatloaf, but theirs is great. I have always had good experiences with the service there and the prices are a decent value. This may seem odd, but if you eat there, check out the funky restrooms.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Thankful for this delightful restaurant in Chelsea which is open late enough for me and my 3 daughters who are hungry travellers arriving from the west coast - it offers a diverse menu to suit our palates and appetites - we ate there twice, once for dinner and had the macaroni and cheese and once for dessert where the banana split on waffles was wowed and shared and the chocolate cake was delic - service was excellent and we did not feel rushed - prices low - altogether a great choice

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: With so many high priced, four-dollar sign meals, it's just nice to have a meal that isn't a $50 or more, but is still delicious. I had the turkey burger, and it was delicious. We loved the atmosphere, and we loved that we didn't have to be all dressed up after a day of sightseeing. I'm so glad a friend recommended this to me before our trip.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
We landed here by mistake on our way to the pub next door and decided to have a snack. 
We really liked the place, it was loud but not to much, the music was really good and the food... 
There aren't too many food items in the menu but everything we had was cooked to perfection. 
Chicken and waffles were sweet and spicy and salty and was big enough for two ladies. 
The new york steak was premium size and quality, it was juicy and tasty and perfectly seasoned and came with a blue cheese infused knob of butter 😈
Salad and desert were awesome too. 
Highly recommended and good luck finding sits without reservation, we were lucky.
reviewTitle: Great food and drinks with stuck up staff

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I am not sure I have ever experienced such bad service.  We were seated for at least 15 minutes before we asked someone,  who appeared to be a manager , if we had a server.  He assured us that he could take care of us and we gave him our order.  At some point our server did come by and introduced herself. She seemed very annoyed.  Our food came but not our appetizer.  They did offer free dessert but that was a small consolation prize.  The bright spots were the bartenders (long wait for a table) and the food was excellent.  I would never go back.
reviewTitle: Great food with the worst service

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Absolutely the best restaurant ever in the city.
Everytime I'm in Nyc I have to come here to have dinner.
Food is delicious, waiters are friendly and professional and the atmosphere is unique.
Try their mac&cheese, chicken with waffle and white grape martini, I love it!
Well done guys!
reviewTitle: The best Restaurant in the city

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I went there for brunch and was really impressed with the service and quality of the food. The dishes my friend and I took were fantastic !

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Vi kommer her igen og igen. 
Morgenmaden er udsøgt og lækker og priserne rimelige. 
Prøv deres avokadotoast med chiliflager og deres french toast som er med frugt indeni. 
Også godt til frokost og aften. Der er dog en del støj. 
I weekenden er det en ide at reservere bord.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: fui por recomendacion muy tarde en la noche, y lo pase muy bien, la comida es deliciosa, abundante, el servicio de atencion es muy bueno con esmero para los turistas ! el precio fue razonable y lo recomiendo en todo sentido !

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: The stake is very large and flavorless, was also and inconsistently cooked. Also the dish is served on a beat up wooden square tray, Im not sure why. When you try to cut the stake the plate spins around, it almost fell off the table.  The mac & cheese is good but on the whole the food here is subpar and over priced for what it is. The service also leaves much to be desired. If you want a good stake In Chelsea I would go to Cook Shop.
reviewTitle: "Its more about the experience then it is the food"

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Arrival: Walking in the door, I did not anticipate a good restaurant. It’s actually a very good pub that could be classified as a restaurant. The host/hostess for the eatery is located at the end of the bar, mid way through the establishment. I didn’t have a reservation, but the host found me a table for one (I was solo on another business trip).

Overall cleanliness: typical bar, not clean but not filthy

Bathroom cleanliness: typical bar, not clean

Service: By American standards, service is a bit slow. But BXL has a very European vibe. Hurried, frenetic service of the large chain restaurants in nearby Times Square fortunately is not present. Relax and enjoy a pace of eating and service that is much more Continental. Also, I never felt rushed. Although I parked at my little table and slowly drank beer and ate my meal, I never felt hurried or that I was impeding the flow of guests. 

Food: Very good food. I had the onion soup served with homemade sourdough, soft loaf bread. The soup and bread were wonderful. The CARBONNADE FLAMANDE (stewed sirloin tips in brown beer reduction gravy) was so tasty and the portion was huge.

Beer: Nice selection of fine Belgian ales on tab and extensive selection of bottles. Beer on tap ranges from $9 - $12 per glass, but that’s typical for Belgian ale. The house Cuvee BXL is a fine brew (low ABV, very modest hops, mellow throughout) and would be a great “gateway” Belgian for beer explorers not familiar with Belgian ales.
reviewTitle: A hidden Belgian gem so close to Times Square!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I love Belgian beer and it's my first experience to visit to this place. I was amazed with the food and service I got from them. As always Belgian food and drinks never failed to give me the best night ever to add having to this amazing place sorrounded by cheerful staff.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We never had been there before but we were going to the show across the street! So glad we went there! Had superb food, fantastic service, and great beer! It doesn't get any better than that!
reviewTitle: Great service, great food, great beer!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Having just come back from a trip to Belgium we were thirsty for a specific beverage. Found this little place in the theater district and gave it a try. We were surprised to find the bartender speaking Dutch, French and English. She had recently moved here from Brussels. The beer was authentic and so was the food, other than the patrons you could easily have been back in Belgium. A great pub with wonderful people and good prices!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
We walked into the brew place next store, looked at the beer list and left. Walked into BXL and loved it! 
Now we like Belgian beers, so that helped. But Eugene was great. Super friendly and glad to share a taste of the beer. 
Wife had a cheese burger, I had pasta carbonara, AWESOME!.
I can't wait to return!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: 가게가 작아요. 근데 편안하게 맥주 한잔 할 수 있는 공간입니다. 아주 분위기가 좋았어요. 굳굳굳. 사람이 많아요. 그리고 분위기가 은은하니 대화하기 좋았어요. 진짜 맛있는 안주거리와 맥주를 즐길수 있는공간입니다. 진짜 좋아요여기

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: A very acceptable spot for pre-dinner fare: across the street from the Sondheim Theater and the show "Beautiful." Pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. Excellent soups, great salads, interesting and tasty entrees. Vibrant bar scene. The only "knock" is on the noise level, which is VERY high.If you can get beyond that, this is a very pleasant and satisfying spot to get a good meal before the show.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: A little bit of authentic Brussels in the heart of New York.  This brown cafe style bar and restaurant serves authentic and unsophisticated but tasty traditional Belgian food, including mussels, frites and waffles but also carbonades ( beef stew) or "bitterballen" ( hard to explain, but tasty).  A wide selection of Belgian beers.  The atmosphere is like a place in Brussels: the bartender speaks French ( and English), the radio plays French songs and soccer is on the TV.   Great for a break or to hang out with Friends.
reviewTitle: A Belgian Bar that is actually Belgian!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We stopped in here prior to our Broadway show, and ordered a beer.  Imagine our surprise when an 8 oz goblet of beer turned out to be $12 (without tip!!).  Although we assumed that it was popular due to the amount of people in there, it was too rih for our blood!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We were visiting mid-town with friends and stopped by here for dinner before a play.  The food is outstanding, along with the service.  Of course, get the mussels - with any of the sauces, but the mariniere is the most classic and the best.  Combined with the fries, it's the signature Belgian meal, and the best thing on the menu.  The wine list is a bit limited but good quality.  But, it's the Belgian beers you come for.  There are no bad choices.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Stoofvlees, mosselen, entrecote, videe, ... Dit restaurant wordt uitgebaat door een Belg die de bekende gerechten van België aanbiedt. Ik adviseer een extra portie friet te nemen, aangezien die echt top zijn (alsook de mayonaise).

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Small frontage on 43rd, less than a block from Times Sq, this is a gem! 

The front is the bar - you have to pass through this (crowded the night we came) to get to the seating in the back. We had two types of mussels (both fabulous), grilled shrimp small plate, and grilled chicken with French fries and apples. Mussels, served in individual pots, came with fries (which came with mayonnaise, authentically). All were excellent. Menu has hints for travel to Belgium as well as factoids about Belgians and Belgium through history.  You feel like the owners are engaging you and that, of course, you will soon be convinced to go visit their relatives in Belgium!

Nice offering of European beers (all served in different glasses appropriate to the beer) and interesting cocktails. 

TVs showing soccer ('football') and other sports. Cheerful, mostly Belgian, pleasant staff. Very attentive though gentle and casually welcoming. 

Fairly warm and noisy - but in an enthusiastic and fun way. We brought our kids - a teen and a 9-year-old - and we all loved it. Will go back in a heartbeat!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Been to this small and kinda hard to find place a few times, but stayed last night after drinks for a really good dinner. BXL is in a tiny spot off Times Square and if you don't have the address it's really hard to locate. But once you get inside it's a very warm and welcoming place, small but really friendly. Meet an old college friend for a drink, and ended up staying for many rounds before we decided to stay for dinner. Our bartender Marjolein was very helpful and recommended the beef stew, which was excellent and very filling. Times Square is a pretty lousy neighborhood for dinner, most places are large, impersonal and cater to tourists, serving very unimpressive food. BXL is unique and you should check it out.
reviewTitle: Come for the drinks, stay for the food

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Yuck, worst meal in NYC. Food was undercooked, waitress brought the wrong order and disappeared before we could point it out. No one came to check on us. I had to spend $3.75 at another local place a few minutes after leaving so I could use their washroom in a hurry.
Hope this spares someone else the trouble, this was not the place for me.
reviewTitle: Guess I'm The Only One Who Hated It

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: As real Belgian it is a pleasure to enjoy the good Belgian beers in BXLCafe in NYC. Excellent service and Dutch songs in the restroom.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Small frontage, busy noisy people enjoying real food and drink.A great  place to hangout. Service is good even with full tables. All ages all sorts a real mix in the heart of theatre land NYC. Definitely one to put on the list. The food is great.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: I have just recently discovered this collection of establishments.  I have been to two of their locations - this one and the one down in the Flatiron. Both have a really good vibe - the staff is welcoming, the ambiance/decor is inviting and the food is pretty good.  I've had fries at both locations and mussels at the Flatiron location - so good.  Besides the atmosphere, I go for their Belgian beer selection - Chouffe and Chimay on tap is hard to beat AND they have Delirium Nocturnum - one  of my favorites.  Their Flatiron location has a cute little patio out front - perfect for hanging with friends on a Sunday afternoon.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Superbe endroit, et là au moins les serveurs/serveuses savent comment servir une bière belge. Dans le verre approprié et rincé à l'eau juste avant de servir la bière.
ORVAL de plus de six mois à NYC !!
Ongelooflijk goed !! Echt de moeite.

On y parle français et Néerlandais.
Daar is het even goed Frans of Nederlands gesproken.

Love it !!

Didier.
reviewTitle: Best in town for Belgian Beers ...

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: My wife and I made a same day reservation for this very crowded local Belgium Bistro/Bar right across the street from the Broadway show, "Beautiful." The show was at 7 pm so my wife made it for 5 pm. Since I live in Syosset, Long Island, I took the LIRR to Penn Station and walked a few blocks to the restaurant. I was 5 mins early but my wife was running late and called ahead to the restaurant and moved the reservation for 5:15 pm. Surprisingly, when I arrived the waitress, Janice, seated me right away. Janice was extremely pleasant and gave me great advise on the Belgium beer and food and kept me fairly entertained and occupied before my wife came. Also, at that time there were not too many patrons in the restaurant. Suffice to say, the beer was excellent and I had 3 servings, and the food was delicious. We were 15 mins early to the Carole King Broadway show "Beautiful," with a belly full of a great meal. The service in the restaurant was excellent!
reviewTitle: Truly very pleasant surprise Belgium Bistro

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Lekker eten en heerlijke gin tonic, veel Belgische bieren, fijne bediening, we voelen hier ons als Belg erg thuis! Topplek!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Absolutely love the Walnut raisin bun!Took me quite some time to find a non sweetened regular size breakfast roll and then there it was! Will be back for more :)
reviewTitle: A German found a healthy bun

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: What a delight this class was!  Our French pastry chef was as charming as the macarons were delicious!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I brought my 2 nieces here for their Christmas gift.  We all loved it! It was very organized, we learned a lot of great tips and the payoff was the box of delicious macarons we got to take home.  Yum!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
If you like macarons you will love this class. Highly recommend !
you get a box of 25 macarons to take home!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Very hands on, informative and fun! Great for friends/families/couples. Instructor was very knowledgeable and helpful. Only reason I did not give 5 stars was I did not receive a complementary coffee/pastry as promised

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I attended this class with my sister and aunt. We had a blast! The course ran smoothly and we never stopped learning/doing something. We had a great instructor but unfortunately he was leaving to go back home to France. All in all it was a fun experience and highly recommend it!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Pierre was a great pastry chef. He explained everything very well and thorough and was very patient with the whole class.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I purchase this class for me an my wife to do something together as a couple.  Since we both love to bake, this was a great class to attend.  The Macarons we made were delicious and just as good as the ones sold in the store.  I can't wait to try an bake these at home.
reviewTitle: Absolutely Fabulous and a Great Experience with a Nice Reward, Macarons!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We really had a great time the chef was terrific I wish the kitchen was a little bit larger so that we could spread out a little bit
reviewTitle: We really had a great time  the chef f was terrifi I wish the kitchen was a  little bigger so that  we could.   Spread o

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
This is a  good little bakery specializing in French pastries and desserts. Staff were very helpful and friendly. In the bakery is clean, the decoration with fresh flower!
I was in Macarons class. It was a birthday gift. It take one hour. I really surprise how it is do easy to bake macarons. The macarons was perfect. It like melts in your mouth. Pierre is a wonderful teacher!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The complicated steps of this cookie were made simple by our expert French pastry chef instructor. Small class size & personal attention made the class flow smoothly & us all feel successful. The bakery is quaint & in a lovely location. I highly recommend this class & bakery!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The class overall was great! The only thing that was annoying about it was that we were making 3 flavors of macaroons but there were 4 couples (8 people).  It would have been a perfect experience if they had limited the class to 6 people so that each pair could work on all the parts. We were sharing some of each of the tasks so that the Macaroons didn't feel like they were completely ours in the end.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Je suis allée deux fois chez mille feuille leur pain au chocolat était très bon! 
En revanche je ne vous conseille pas le café

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I took this class solo as I love to bake on my off time and have tried to make macarons before.  The class was small enough that everyone had a chance to jump in and the instructor made the directions super easy to follow.  After taking it I can definitely go home and remake another batch myself based on the helpful tips and tricks that were shared.  I would highly recommend this class to anyone who has wanted to learn how to make macarons on their own. You also leave with a box of them that you've made yourself which is a nice added touch :)

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Took a macaron baking class here! Wonderful experience cooking in the back of a bustling cafe with excellent, authentic baked goods. The class was great and resulted in delicious cookies.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The  Instructor Dimitri is a pro. Great demonstration, total explanation and wonderful results. Highly recommended.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Mille Feuille could not be more charming, and the class was a delight. Our teacher took us through each step of the process, inviting us to actually make and layer the dough ourselves, as well as shape our own croissants, and we happily skipped home with 12+ of our own homemade croissants each and dough to make another batch. They were delicious... and I'd like to think I could accomplish them (or some semblance) on my own in the future! Would recommend for family, friends or solo.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I took the macaron class there & had a blast. Met some really nice people & the teacher was great. Very informative. And the macarons were very delicious. It was a nice clean place & the pastries looked very tasty.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
We absolutely enjoyed the class. WE'll  try to do this at home. 
It's very useful for people who like to have a fresh warm croissant at the morning.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My daughter and two friends took this class and loved it. They came out with a bag of almost 20 freshly baked croissants and dough to make more!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: What a pleasure to stay at a hotel with a real and very good restaurant for everyone not just guests. Nice bar area, warm restaurant, and very good food at reasonable prices. I recommend the Gnocchi Buttera.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Lorenzo's is delicious-- I've been to eat several times. Went for a work event just recently, and have been several times before. The restaurant/bar is a great place to entertain clients. Bobby (one of the bartenders) might be older than many of his coworkers, but he is probably better than most all other bartenders I've ever encountered!

And hands down, that was the best chocolate martini I've ever had!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Just because it's in the Hilton doesnt mean a thing. Food was not that good. Expensive. Service was slow. Disappointing considering it is supposed to be highly rated. Would not return.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
Went to lorenzo's with a bunch of my girlfriends before heading out to above. We had martinis and appetizers at the bar. The older bartender made us great martinis, we all had alot of fun. Will def go back there again for more yummy drinks.

Chrissy

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Located at the Hilton, Wonderful staff make me feel like i was a regular there. My water was always full. I did not feel rished and the food was out of this world not your usual dry chicken breast sandwich. I ordered steak which was made to perfection. While the prices are a little high, it is New York and you get what you pay for. I highly recommend this place especially if you are staying at the Hilton.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I have to say that the staff at Lorenzo's is wonderful. I have been there on many occasions and it was good, I think who does the hiring there is  pretty good, because  the bartender at Lorenzo's  his name is Bobby is dynamite . That guy is on top of his game. I don't usually write reviews, but I have to say of what I've seen with an older man with a younger staff is that he is so on top of his game it was pure joy. He is a professional at what he does. I wish more bartenders took the same class he did.  He can run circles around most bartenders I've seen in most places. The guy is a professional in every sense of the word.  Good job Hilton! We will be back to see Bobby!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Great place with a feel of being in the city without going! Smart decor as well as a bounty of Tapas to choos from before diving into the main courses.....the fresh guacamole and baby lamb chops are excellent. Friendly wait staff good as well.....just b prepared to wait but its worth it

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We had the pleasure of seeing the Louis Prima, Jr. show at this fine Restaurant & Cabaret.  Our table was excellent, the room is lovely and the menu and food was outstanding.  The Prima, Jr. Show was fabulous and the saxophone player---beyond words.  Don't miss and evening at Lorenzo's.

We also enjoyed the overnight package as the Hotel is great and they treat you so special.  We can't wait to return.  You are missing a great weekend if you don't spend time here.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: I ate here several years ago, and thought it was one of the better places I had eaten in NYC. However they are going thru renovations, so unless you are staying at the hotel or at the Hampton and just need a place to eat and dont want to drive then go elsewhere until they get finished. I hope they return to what they were before renovations and I expect they will but for now I will stay away.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We came to Lorenzo's for two reasons - my job was having our annual staff dinner and also because the owner's the Nicotra's are such wonderful people. They give so much to the Staten Island Community. 

The decor of the room is soft and comfortable. You immediately feel at home and relaxed. The staff was pleasant, friendly and helpful in choosing from the items on the menu. 

The sausage meatballs and calamari were outstanding starters, along with the fresh olive bread on the table!

The Gnocchi Bolognese was recommended to me by others who have dined at Lorenzo's previously. I was skeptical on how good a plain old bolognese could be....boy was I surprised. Hands down the best bolognese I have ever had. The fresh ricotta topping it was so creamy and delish!

The Peach dessert was amazing as well, the creme was light and so delighful. I have already told my husband and in-laws that we need to come to this place!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: good portions , good service , wine , food , ambiance is nice , tables not on top of one another and its quiet .  Just the perfect blend after traveling on a plane with the chaos of airport activity.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We had our family reunion dinner and breakfast at Lorenzo's and were extremely satisfied.The staff were very accomodating.

Food quality and menu variety were excellent.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: This is an American/Italian cuisine.  Food and service was excellent.  This is the perfect place for a special getaway or party.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
We were at Lorenzo before but this was our first time for Sunday Italian Dinner which was very good ,great food ,and front desk was very friendly ,only server needs to find time to smile and the place was empty so wasnt busy at all he not even said bye when we left and he was right next to us !
But we will go back !!!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Don't know why this restaurant was empty.  Food and service were great.  It's walking distance from the Hampton and housed in the Hilton Gardens.  Try the specials.  They were great.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Located in the Hilton Garden inn on Lois Lane (don't blame me - I didn't name it) we were there for breakfast on Sunday. The fixed price buffet includes juice, coffee/tea, fruit, cooked to order eggs and omlettes, French toast, waffles, pancakes, breads and more. For a hotel restaurant to offer all this for $12.95 is almost unheard of, but you heard it here! Try it.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The staff was courteous, friendly and the service was wonderful.  The food was excellent and not too pricey, though on the top end.  Would definitely eat here again.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Had been here last year for a party and couldn't wait to go back to try their Sunday brunch. While there is a lot to choose from, nothing stood out as particularly noteworthy. I was joined by friends who agreed that there was a lot of variety but nothing was especially delicious and/or worth a second helping or a recommendation. The chocolate fountain is a fun idea but the "chocolate" does not taste anything like chocolate and was actually inedible. The wait staff was great, very accommodating and friendly. I do recommend requesting to be seated away from the piano player as it was difficult for us to have an audible conversation over his playing. I still like this place and would definitely go back for a party but their pricey brunch is not worth the trip.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Kudos to Vito, Murat and the entire staff at Lorenzo's that served our party!!  They were very attentive to a group of 8-year old baseball players and their families who had traveled to the area for a baseball tournament.  We put this group dinner for 40+ together in a week's time and the delicious food and great service enabled all of us to unwind after a day of baseball games.  Thanks again for a very nice evening!!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Had a wonderful experience for lunch with my gf. food was amazing and the size was astounding for a lunch menu. definitely recommended.  I have been here for sunday brunch and dinner, never any complaints

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We stopped here for brunch and were not disappointed. Staff were happy and friendly . The food we ordered we shared which was delicious. Just ask for extra plates , bowls. Sharing is ideal if you are not big eaters. Clean and tidy with outside seating to people watch.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Good breakfast menu.  Go healthy with fruit and yoghurt or go for the pancakes and waffles.  Large portions.  Nice spacious place. Open 24/7

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Came here for a business meeting. Quite noisy but def better than Pain Quotidian across the road, in every way.
Breakfast menu good and food 4 star. Coffees not so great and service frustrating.
3.5 Stars.
Would give it another shot

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We ate there at our first night in New York and it was really good. We ordered salmon and California salad and both of them were great. Also there is a lot of beers & cocktails and the atmosphere is nice

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Went for lunch and couldn't have enjoyed it more.  Had the best pancakes of my life - lemon mascarpone with blueberries - people on both sides of us kept asking what I was eating because it looked and tasted so amazing.  Thick yummy bacon and strong fresh coffee completed the experience.  The staff was super fun, quirky and attentive without being overbearing.  Was recommended by two different friends that are NYC pros and it was all they said and more.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Absolutely the best restaurant ever in the city.
Everytime I'm in Nyc I have to come here to have dinner.
Food is delicious, waiters are friendly and professional and the atmosphere is unique.
Try their mac&cheese, chicken with waffle and white grape martini, I love it!
Well done guys!
reviewTitle: The best Restaurant in the city

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: this place offers great 24 hour eats, and delicious cocktails. Ordering a salad and the trio of mac and cheeses, we were not disappointed, both were delicious. Each mac and cheese exuding a unique flavour all perfectly cooked with a crispy top. The avocado salad was gorgeous, with a perfect dressing - a nice light accompaniment to the heavy mac and cheeses. There's a wide selection of cocktails, all delicious. The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is great - definitely want to go again when I have the time!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
This is a regular stop when I go to NYC and I usually love it. It's where I learned that mascarpone tastes like heaven. But the last two visits haven't lived up to expectations established by previous trips.

This trip the chicken on my $20 chicken and waffles was too dry to eat. Service was friendly but mediocre, had to remind him to bring our beverages, we were told to wait for a table that was "about to be cleared" and stood awkwardly in the middle of the dining room for about five minutes.

My daughter said her stuffed croissant French toast was still very good.
reviewTitle: Some visits are a 5, but the last two have been a 3

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: My son and I had a delicious dinner served by a friendly and efficient waitress.  I had the delicious salad and soup and my son had a macaroni and cheese specialty dish along with divine French fries.  All food was fresh and tasty!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Food was good but service was awful. I think our server Donnovan purposely did a bad job because the tip was automatically included (on a party of 2). We had to ask the hostess for a server. It Took him over 15 minutes to greet us. I understand it was unexpectedly busy but he passed our table several times he could of at least quickly greeted us and told us he would've been with us momentarily. The doorman and hostess were great!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I've been going to this place for a few years now, have take basically everyone I know here and have gone for birthday dinners the last two years. It's easily my favorite restaurant in manhattan and the BEST Mac and cheese ever. I would definitely suggest the Mac Attack, and the fried Oreos are soooo good. Atmosphere is great, a bit loud and younger crowd and it's open 24 hours which is awesome!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Μετα από μια βόλτα στη Νέα Υόρκη ο δρόμος μας εφερε στην 7η Λεωφόρο.
Πολυ ωραίο περιβάλλον... Ωραια προσεγμένα πιάτα.
Ωραίες σαλάτες κ κυρίως.
Ωραιο το κοκτειλ της φραουλας με διόσμο κ σόδα
reviewTitle: Ωραίο περιβάλλον κ πολύ καλή εξυπηρέτηση.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: I've come here dozens of times in the past few years. You can never, ever go wrong by eating here. I usually come here after the club is over around 4-5 AM. It is usually full any day of the week. Their Mac Attack is what they're known for as well as their chicken and waffles. Everything there is good. The service is always up to par as well.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: We went for dinner last weekend.  Maybe the problem is that we went for dinner vs. it's outstanding reputation for lunch/brunch.  It was fine. The food was OK, the service pretty good.  But what is all the fuss about the Mac and Cheese at this place.  We ordered the lobster Mac & Cheese since it is one of my husbands favorites.  First off -- they just put a few chunks (a good amount for the portion size --which is tiny) on the top of the casserole versus mixing it it.  I think that because of this service style, the lobster is ice cold while the Mac&Cheese is very warm.  Not a pleasing sensation in your mouth. The Lobster Mac&Cheese at Capitol Grill can give this version soe real lessons on how that dish is supposed to be prepared..  Giving credit where it is due, the burger was great.  Cooked perfectly and juicy.  The real problem with this place was not the food but rather the crowd.  It is unclassy, trying to dress up as classy but not succeeding.  I am a heavy person and you would not catch me dead in some of the outfits I saw. I believe in embracing your inner and outer beauty.  But if you are the only one who thinks your outer beauty is so great, please don't display it in away that accentuates what others do not consider beautiful.  I can not believe I am writing this, but as a heavy person, I find ways for me and others to appreciate my beauty both inner and outer, without looking grotesque. We were at a very intimate table for two and we could not converse because the noise was so loud.  It was like a screaming convention -- who can talk the loudest.  And what the were saying was in RAP, so who the heck could understand them anyway.  Not a pleasant evening.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Great spot for late night dining, since they're open  24 hours a day. The food was pretty decent. I had the chicken and waffles, which seemed bland, initially. But then I dipped it into the sauce and wow, that made all of the difference. It was delicious!! Try them out!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: My teenage daughter recommended we do dinner there as we had family visiting. Despite it being a Sunday evening there was no wait and we were seated immediately. What an absolute treat! From Sabrina our server who gave us great suggestions on what to choose.. the entire evening was a hit! Food was so darn good we plan to go again this week end. Great food ..great ambiance..great service ..what more do you need

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText:
Went for lunch with a friend. 
The place is really nice, easy and simple. 
The terrace is very nice, inside and outside decoration in white.
Food is amazing I had a delicious salmon great portion of veggies are which I really appreciate perfectly cooked.
The sautéed spinach amazing!!!
And what can I say about deserts uffff we had the peanut butter tower and roasted banana, better impossible, perfect flavor and beautiful texture.
You really need to try it!!
Great service and good prices.
Community back soon!

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: A friend recommend the Cafeteria and she was dead on.  The food was great.  I had the grilled salmon BLT.  I shared the sampler mac & cheese with my guest.  Wow!!!   This has just become my second go to in NYC.  The service was 👍.  Be aware the the atmosphere is very active and a little loud.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Сказать что здесь шумно, это ничего не сказать, ты такое впечатление, что находишься на стадионе, чтобы услышать друг друга, приходиться кричать, срывая голос. Заказать что-то тоже не представляется возможным. поесть в такой атмосфере просто невозможно. Блюда были посредственными. Наш официант, из-за шума, не правильно понял заказ и принес одно и тоже блюдо два раза. Не советую ходить сюда, либо заранее бронировать столики на улице. Мы проверили - если открыть рот и просто начать орать во всю глотку, то никто не обращает на тебя внимания, так как ты вливаешься в общую атмосферу.

placeAddress: 119 7th Avenue New York, New York City, NY 10010
reviewText: Arrived at 5am because of being jetlagged. The place was playing house music, the crowd was young eating hamburgers and pasta. At that hour the crowd looks like they were eating after a heavy night of partying. The place is cool young and funky it's us that looked out of place!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: This is a great place!  Beer (BXL) is wonderful & so are the mussels!  The endive & ham augratin was great ... I better stop now ... desert is coming!
reviewTitle: Not Closed Today - It's All You Can Eat Mussels Day!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Missing Belgian after a visit this summer, we decided to get a fix while in NYC for the weekend. Reservations easily obtained and got a pre show reservation on a Sat at 5pm. Mussels are generous - albeit small - but tasty. Fries are not thick and hearty like in Belgium HOWEVER they are cooked the same way and just perfectly done! Son loved the shrimp croquettes and Husband (and I ) thought the ONGLET À L’ÉCHALOTTE  was outrageous. Beer selection is amazing and so loved having a De Halve Maan Straffe Hendrik fro Bruges,

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Stopped in on the way to a meeting for a quick lunch and was so happy I did. Fried calamari comes with a small salad garnish, which was perfect. Calamari is tender and lightly fried - more calamari than breading. Salad and dressing were a nice addition, would get a larger version next time. Will keep this in mind the next time I visit this client.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We were a party of 12, having split between Broadway matinees, & we had agreed on spec to meet here.  It proved an excellent choice.  On arrival it seemed all tables were booked but the staff asked us to wait at the bar & soon came back to offer a table for some.  The drinks were very good & the food was excellent.  The staff were friendly, helpful & efficient.  Prices were average.  Atmosphere was excellent.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: At 5:30-6:00 on a Wednesday the bar was a scene for which the term "Happy Hour" was invented. When we left, about 7, it had calmed down considerably. Despite the crowd at the bar in the front, we were seated immediately in the rear dining room, which was crowded but had some empty tables.  Despite the numbers, service was impeccable, as was the food and drink. For two people, we split an order of pate, and order of Moules Marocaine (Moroccan), and 4 pints of beer.plenty for all and under $100 even with a big tip. Nice stopping place.
reviewTitle: Loud, Energetic, Convenient, Great Casual Meal

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Ho avuto la fortuna di trovare per caso questo locale/pub girovagando per le vie che circondano times square. Il posto è arredato in stile belga, offre piatti molto buoni ed alla portata di tutti in un ambiente informale e confortevole. Il personale è molto educato, rapido e professionale e parla più lingue (ho sentito parlare in inglese spagnolo e francese). Al bancone, dove si viene serviti dal sosia di Ashton Kutcher :) si possono notare molti tipi di vodka e birra che ho notato andare per la maggiore. Non è facile trovare a New York un posto del genere anche per il sapore ed abbondanza delle pietanze quindi lo consiglio al 100%.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Stopped here after a Broadway show. What a delight!  Felt like being back in Flemish Belgium. Great beer, mussels, fries (frites), lots of atmosphere. Very friendly service.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
We were walking down West 43rd from one diner to another (the first was too crowded and had a long wait, so the host recommended another) when we happened upon BXL Cafe.  We almost walked right past it because it appears to be a bar or tavern.  Fortunately, the awning says waffles (among other things).  There was also a brunch menu posted outside (complete with English translation).  You do pass a bar area on the way to the dining area.

There were four of us (two picky teen girls and two mature ladies) on this Sunday morning.  While there is a good brunch selection, three of us ordered waffles; one ordered pancakes.  The pancakes are actually supposed to be banana pancakes, but we were able to request plain pancakes... a fresh, plain batch was made.  We really appreciated that.  The waffles come with fruit (kiwi, strawberry, pineapple and melon) and whipped cream.  The waffles were good, but the pancakes were really delicious.  

The cappuccino was perfect!  Everyone else ordered juice - grapefruit, orange and apple.

The service was good.  Our orders were taken quickly and our special requests (as I said... two picky teens) were granted with no problem at all.  There are two televisions airing at the time, soccer games.

We paid around $70 (including tip).

The bathrooms are way in the back, and relatively clean.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Un très bon chois de bières et de nourriture belges. Personnel très sympa. Ambiance décontractée.  autres BXL à New York et tout aussi bien.
reviewTitle: Un bon café-resto belge à NYC

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Reasonable prices. Exceptional greeting at front door. Delicious omelette and coffee. Great start to the day.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Quite by surprise we found this delightful spot, unexpectedly just a stone's throw from Times Square. Nothing touristy about it. Offers a taste of Belgium in a decidedly European flavor.

A great brunch menu, bar menu, and a tasteful range for dinner too. We arrived at brunch time and among the four of us had a little bit of breakfast and a taste of lunch. Maybe it was just our taste, but the single sheet menu was filled with a range of choices which covered all of the bases.

Ambiance was great and the service first rate. Just a few blocks from theaters and worth the trip for a casual bite before or after a matinee.
reviewTitle: Great Menu and Performance to Match!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: This Brussles style gem off of TIme Square is amazing.  On Sunday and Monday they offer all you can eat muscles.  They are small but tasty.  I was able to get 3 different kinds of muscles before I was too full.  There are at least 6 sauces to choose from.  My son got the carbonara and it was the best cacrbonara we had EVER tasted.  So creamy, just the right amount of bacon and al dente pasta - delish!  My daughter and hubby got salads which were also very good but not as amazing as the other two dishes.  Would go back in a heartbeat!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: My wife and I went for lunch midweek.  The bar area was busy even for early afternoon on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving.  We shared the Croque Monsieur without the béchamel sauce (essentially a grilled ham and cheese) with an order of frites with our Belgian beer.  We enjoyed the food, the atmosphere, and the drinks.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: Ate here last night a couldn't fault it!! Great selection of drink, the filet mignon was spot on and the muscles delicious!!

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
I almost don't want to rate this place in fear it will be 'found' and a tsunami of patrons will fill it, preventing me from another wonderful dinner.
We found this place on a whim during a trip to see the tree at Rockefeller Center after Christmas.  
When we walked in, there were hardly any patrons and my cautionary flag went up!!
However, we were greeted by a personable man who quickly prepared a place for five adults and a three-year-old. 
Our lovely waitress memorized our order and made us feel very welcomed.  When our orders arrived, we were impressed at the quality and presentation of the food. Once we began eating, conversation stopped...with the exception of the unanimous praise of the food.
When we left, he place was hustling with a crowd.
We can't wait to return and will recommend BXL East to everyone visiting NYC.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Found by accident near hotel as daughter wanted waffles for breakfast. At first was hesitant as early and no one in but gave it a try and so glad we did.
Best pancakes I ever had, light and fluffy despite having banana in them. Served with fruit and syrup and a huge portion that I struggled to finish but they were so nice I refused to leave any.
Waffles also nice served with a fruit compote and syrup.
Hubby had croque Madame which was also yum.
Service fab super friendly & helpful. Got talking to owner as from Belgium but been in NY over 10 years.
We enjoyed breakfast so much we came straight back the next day before we left, if we had more time we would definitely have come for lunch of dinner.
Can't wait to return to NY and will be making a bee line for BXL.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText:
Pub parecchio rumoroso e angusto dove si fermano per bere o per mangiare persone di tutte le età. 

Cibo buono, servizio semplice. Leggermente alti i prezzi in proporzione a ciò che offrono.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We had a very comfortable Christmas Eve dinner at BXL East, with nice enough food, mostly moules cooked in every way and sauce possible, and a good bottle of white wine. The bill came to $86, with a gratuity charge at 18% of $15.48 (together with tax), coming to a total of $109.11. The bill has written on it 'service is not included'. I may well be stupid, but what is a gratuity if it is not a service charge? Someone, please tell me!
reviewTitle: Nice place, shame about the service charges

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We stopped here before a concert. It was very busy but we lucked out and got a table quickly. The beers were amazing and we just had calamari but it was delicious and the dipping sauce made it even better. It's not cheap but nothing is in NYC.

placeAddress: 125 W 43rd St, New York City, NY 10036
reviewText: We had dinner with our two small children and although it was very busy the service was great and the food generous and tasty. We had a very generous serve of mussels which was delivered to our table promptly and our wine and water was always refreshed. If your kids don't like a lot of noise and hustle and bustle this might not be the spot to go for dinner.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: This restaurant and microbrewery is a great place.  We went twice in one week while visiting.  All the beers were full bodied, rich and tasty.  The aged beef burger ( medium rare) was to my liking and the regular cheeseburger was to my wife's liking.  All the food was hot and delicious!  It even has a nice garden area outside which was more quiet than inside!  We really enjoyed this unique joint!!!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
So happy to have the opportunity to visit twice in the ACC tourney week.

Great beers (duh, everyone knows this)
Cool bottle shop

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Their beer was fine; good even. Was pretty crowded, which is to be expected I suppose. Most impressive thing for me was the other drafts on tap and the fact that you could basically pour small/medium/regular sizes of everything.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
Three Brewing is a really quaint, chill bar tucked away in Brooklyn. Unlike nearby Brooklyn Brewery, this spot is lesser known and seems more geared to locals. While spacious, the brewery does get pretty packed especially on weekends so you might be left with standing room only. There is also a great outdoor spot for summer days. Get there early if you are in a large group and want a table! 

Wine and cocktail are offered but strongly suggest trying one of their signatures ever. I am no beer connoisseur (my favorite beer is bud light) but even I was able to appreciate their flavors of beer. My favorite is the Unreliable Narrator which is infused with mango flavor and light in taste perfect for summertime. If you like stouts try the Russian Imperial which has the high alcohol content of any of the beers offered.
reviewTitle: Low-Key Brewery With Great Beer Selection

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: This is a brewery with a little bit of everything.  Great beer, a food counter, coffee shop and tiny, but well appointed bottle shop.  Nice people and a great guest tap selection as well.  Highly recommended.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: My daughter lives nearby so we stopped here for some beers and a quick bite before going to the Barclay Center.  The beer selection is great, we sampled quite a few.  The wine and other cocktails are just okay, but it is called Threes Brewery.  We ordered some food from the restaurant window in the front, but waited a long time for some eh food.  Last time we were here they had the best pizza being served that I have tasted since my college days!!  But now it is just greasy fare.  Bring back the pizza!!!!  The coffee cafe upstairs is great.
reviewTitle: Fun Place with Great Beer Selection, but food eh.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Ótimas cervejas próprias e de outros locais,comida boa e informal,valeu a pena pelas ótimas cervejas.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: We called in here for a few drinks before a game at Barclays.  The beer is good but it gets a bit difficult to get them when it gets crowded.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: 土曜日に行ったのですが、店内もガーデンも地元の若者でいっぱいでした。気軽にオーダーするなら、キャッシュオンデリバリーのカウンターがよいのですが、混雑しているのでオーダーのタイミングが重要かも。でも、スタッフがうまく順番にオーダーを聞いてくれました。そのへんで立ち飲みしていてもよいですし、パティオのベンチに座ってのんでもOK。気取らないカジュアルな雰囲気です。
reviewTitle: 地元の若者に大人気のブリュワリー

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
I got to my hotel late and with parking at a premium I decided to walk to some place close that was recommended by the hotel staff. When you walk in there is a sign that says order food here. There's probably about 10 pub food options in all ranging from nachos to burgers. This place is purely for drinking with food as a side.

They did however have grass fed beef. After you order they give you a number on a stick and tell you to choose some place to sit. After a while someone delivers you food by sliding it roughly across the table. 

I got the cheeseburger with bacon for an additional cost. It came with lettuce, onion, tomatoes and pickles. It was cooked okay but was dry and tasted salty.

The establishment looked beautiful upon entering and was packed with 20 and 30 something social drinkers.

I can get a better burger for less just about anywhere and would not return here.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Actually the craft beer that I had 'Short Attention Span IPA' was very tasty. Nice! The in house eatery, 'The Meat Hook' dish I got 'The Meat Plate' was a bit to be desired. Just a few slabs of different types of meat and a few  olives, small pickles with some small onions 'at least I think that's what they were? Probably should of got the tacos? It was, yeah, just okay. Nothing to put on them as of oil or even mustard. Seemed a bit trendy yet hey I'm just a Midwesterner from Minnesnowta don't you know!
reviewTitle: Maybe just come for the Craft Beer!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Visited during the day with my husband. The food is average but the setup to purchase drinks and food can get confusing for a tourist. The fries was wayyyy to salty for me! My burger was average. I've heard the vibe is better at night.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
Threes brewing ofrece varias cervezas, tanto propias (muy buenas), como de otras cervecerías. 
El lugar está muy bueno, cuenta con un patio excelente para los días con buen clima.
La comida está separada de otro local que queda en el mismo espacio, pero funcionan separados.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
マイクロブリュワリーによるバーですが、醸造所といった趣はなく、おしゃれなバーですね。入店後すぐフードカウンターがあり、定期的にショップがいれかわるとか。私が訪れた際はブルックリンキッチンに出店するミートフックのバーガーショップでした。
ビールはピルスナーを注文。美味しかったですが、クラフトビール屋のバーにしては雰囲気が洗練されすぎているような。もっとローカル感があってもいいと思うのですが、あまり感じられませんでした。
reviewTitle: クラフトビールが楽しめるバー

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
I had the chance to visit Threes Brewing again.  This time, a Mexican restaurant (I don't remember the name) is handling the kitchen duties, and I was able to enjoy some of their cuisine.  Threes Brewing invites different restaurants to come by and spend some time providing food to the guests.

My friends and I arrived between 7:30 and 7:45, and the space was so crowded we couldn't find anywhere to sit.  Even the outside tables in the back were full.  We briefly shared a spot with some folks who were there before us who were kind enough to let us use half of their table for just a bit.  The only drawback I can think of to this establishment is that if you wish to eat, it may be difficult to find a time when you can get a table.

They make a nice variety of beers here in the brewery.  I tried two of them, and they were both refreshing summery-type beers, but I don't remember their specific names.  They have something to please just about every kind of beer lover I think... several IPA, a white ale, and a stout or two.
reviewTitle: another enjoyable visit to Threes Brewing, but it gets very crowded

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Nice spot, good bar, lot's of interesting beer, small tasting portions. Changes monthly for food invitational. Right now, Mexican. Very good snack food, tacos, nachos etc. Backyard patio, rustic, pleasant.
reviewTitle: Nice spot off the beaten path

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Around the corner from the Fairfield Inn, this lively brewery is a neighborhood gem. Terrific brews - highly recommend the Table Brew - and the food was delicious. The menu changes regularly - street tacos when I was there - and coming from Denver where street tacos are the best, I was pleasantly surprised how good they were here in NYC. Friendly staff, and the garden out back is a nice place to hang out on a warm night. Highly recommended!!!

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: Nice spacious patio out back with tables for two or picnic tables that are good for groups. Good place for a date, friends, even families (a few babies and strollers were welcomed by staff).

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText:
Had lunch here with friends & family, the place has a good vibe, a good selection of local beers & wines, although a bit overpriced.
The food was very good & went down a treat. 
Think it's very good chefs changing all the time like a pop up restaurant, so the menu changes regularly.
Sorry to only give it four stars due to the price of the drink.

placeAddress: 333 Douglass St, Brooklyn, NY 11217-3115
reviewText: When traveling with my brother, there's going to be a microbrewery stop.  This was close to the hotel, so we went there.  The did not offer flights, but they did offer free tastings of the ones you wanted to try so that was pretty awesome.  We ordered a cheese tray which was expensive and very small - but this is New York.  The employees were as friendly as they had time to be.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
My friend and I travelled to NYC for her birthday - and to take a Macaron class!
We found Mille-Feuille thru Groupon, had excellent help thru STEVEN with a mix-up on our reservation - and sailed thru the class with Dimitri, the French pastry chef.
The 6 other classmates were fun, and Dimitri was very patient and thorough and
answered every question that came up!  And we came home with 25 yummy macarons each!

And the quiche Lorraine that we ordered for an early lunch before the class was FABULOUS!  WHAT A great FIND - SUCH A CUTE LITTLE BAKERY....we plan to take classes here each time we come to NYC.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My son and I took this class and it was very well taught and a lot of fun! Great location in the west village and cozy bakery.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Stunning bakery that serves the best French macaroons! Could go there every day and more! A real gem in NY!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The instructor was great! His name was Dimitri and I think he teaches most classes. It was very user friendly, having experienced bakers to newbies in our class, everyone was able to go home with amazing croissants. I will definitely be make for the macaron making class!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I took this class with my mom and we had a great time. We loved that it was a small group, the instructor was very kind and dynamic, and the macaroons were delicious. It was a great forum to learn the technique and ask questions. Thank you!!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
Closed for upgrades of the display case
i was looking for good listed place to take amid day dessert
but no way only this was best in my way
i hope to come back sooner for  good dessert
reviewTitle: Closed for upgrades of the display case

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: The most difficult class of them all, but the chef makes you feel like you are actually mastering the art, and you get to go through every step of the process. Be prepared to eat croissants for a while, because you leave with a dozen of them, plus dough for another batch. A lot of fun, and even as a beginner you'll make really good croissants!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: They pre-measure and combine things before you arrive. You simply mix with a spatula and press the mixer on. If you think you'll truly learn how to make macarons, you don't really. It's fun, but I thought we would get to make from beginning to end.
reviewTitle: Don't truly come out of it learning how to make macarons

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I took the French Macaron Class here, and I loved it.  It was informative, paced well, and I definitely learned the process.  I wish we had a chance to work with the egg white separation, as that's what I really wanted to learn (everything was pre-measured, we mixed & whipped the egg whites), but the class was overall great.  I went on my own, most folks had a friend or family member, but it wasn't an issue.  I'd highly recommend!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Registered to attend the French Macaron preparation class and it was fabulous! Our instructor provided us an apron, the recipe, and first everyone washed their hands. I was so glad he did this! Hygiene is very important when baking. I'm not sure on the spelling of Dmitri, our instructor therefore he has to forgive me if I've misspelled his name.
