Dmitri was patient and explained the nuisance to making perfect French macarons. You take home what you make. Had a great time! Would definitely go back and take another class. Note, the bakery is very cozy.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: It was a small group of 8. We were taught how to mix the batter and we piped the macarons on our own. It's a good class to take. Would recommend it!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: went there by accidents...loved mostly what they made from the cronuts, macaroon, coffee....its a must to stop and see their lovely delicious products. small cafe yet its cozy and the owner is great, he teach some pastry class and i was able to book a class for making macaroon with my 8 years old daughter. loved it. will come back for more baking lessons :)
reviewTitle: little great french cafe in NYU...

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I just took a macaron baking class here with a friend. It was such an informative and fun experience. Pierre taught the group some really helpful techniques and was both patient and knowledgable about his craft.  Such an adorable little bakery and a very inspirational vibe .......especially the jazz music on the radio (I always listen to jazz music when I bake so it was perfect !!).  We each made 24 macarons to bring home and they turned out really yummy. Such a perfect way to spend a Saturday afternoon in Manhattan ! Thank you for offering this class. Looking forward to using my macaron kit at home and to taking one of the other baking classes offered at Mille-Feuille.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
My niece and I planned this activity to celebrate her 20th birthday. We had such a great time. The place and atmosphere was fun.  The chef/instructor made everyone feel comfortable and was easy to follow directions.  The macarons that we made looked/and tasted liked they were made by a professional chef.
I would definitely recommend this activity. It a nice way to spend the afternoon.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: Great time all around making Macarons. Dimitri was an awesome instructor and made it super easy for us!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My 15-year-old daughter and I took the macaron class at Mille Feuille. It was a lot of fun, and our instructor was very knowledgable and patient. I actually think we could make them at home with a little practice. We left with a lot of yummy and beautiful macarons and some great memories!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: We had a great time learning to make macaroons. The instructor was very patient and showed everything step by step. The best part was seeing the results of our work, and trying them and sharing with our friends and family!

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: I took a macaron baking class recently and it was amazing! Pier was so patient, knowledgeable, and professional. I highly recommend to take this class. I had so much fun and brought home 24 macarons that I personally made.

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText: My friend and I signed up for a baking class. Did not know what to expect and ended up with a great experience. Dimitri was very patient and detailed with his teaching Everybody was friendly. The baked products are very delicious ,highly recommend it to try it

placeAddress: 552 Laguardia Pl between 3rd Street & Bleecker, New York City, NY 10012-1459
reviewText:
My daughter is interning in NYC for the summer - so for her 21st birthday I wanted to do something special with her.  Every time we are in NYC, we see shows so I wanted something unexpected.  Since going to college, she has become a macaron connoisseur.  While we had always talked about trying to make them, after looking at all the steps involved I knew it would be a disaster (I'm not much of a cook/baker)  When I saw Le Mille Feuille's macaron class, I knew that would be a great birthday present and fun experience for both of us.  And they did not disappoint.

With only 8 people in the class, each of us received individual attention.  While I'm not much of a baker, there were a couple of people in our class with much higher baking skills.  However, I never felt uncomfortable.  The teacher (wish I could remember his name because he was very French and wonderful) was patient with all of us and met each of us at our level.  It was a blast and well worth the cost.  The macarons were unbelievably tasty and I actually feel like we could make them on our own now!  One of the best things we have ever done in NYC!  We'd love to take the croissant class next time we are in town!

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Had the sausage meatballs and there were outstanding.  Service was great.  Very classy and a bit pricey but it was worth it.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Six of us from out of town needed a place to eat that was walking distance to our hotels - so this was the choice.  not knowing what we'd get and having eating a lot of bad hotel attached restaurant food in our day, we all left the table full and extremely happy with our meals. not sure I will ever be in the area again to go back but would recommend it to those who are.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: okay. just had breakfast. wait staff were nice and the chef was very personable and accommodating. may try dinner next time if we stay there.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: Both my wife and I had panini's  for lunch. They were just OK. Nothing special. Very expensive especially for what we had. Would not bother to stop again if for some reason I'm off the beaten path again.
reviewTitle: Nothing special except the high price

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
The restaurant was convenient - next door to my hotel - so I thought I'd try it.  It was not crowded, but still took a while to get seated and acknowledged.  Staff was not friendly, generally speaking.

Ordered risotto with scallops, a special that night.  Took a looong time to get it.  Had a basket of pretty stale bread in the meantime.  Came with olive oil and butter which I liked.  

The risotto was fairly bad.  I guess there were scallops in it, but just fragments.  Almost seemed like canned.  On the plus side, it was served hot, and the portion good.  

Had two glasses of wine - dinner was $44 before tip - this was just dinner for one.  In that price range I expect at least pleasant service.  

The place was comfortable and convenient, but I don't think I'd go back.  Seems they do a lot of weddings and funerals - the one energetic person in the place was the gal coordinating a wedding with the bride and groom - I should have sat with them!  They were having more fun than the poor business schlub who just wanted a decent dinner.
reviewTitle: Pretty bad, even by hotel restaurant standards

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: It's OK, but after all you're in NY. Surely you can find somewhere better to eat. Had dinner only one night, and it was not bad. Not great, but edible. I would say 6 out of 10. Prices are appropriate for the area.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: We stumbled upon it by accident.  We wanted to go for a drink and had been told that the Hilton had a nice rooftop.  Well, the rooftop was closed because it was too early (they open at 9:00 pm) and Lorenzo's is right next door and part of the Hilton.  I asked for the Chicken Marsala which came with spinach and mashed potatoes.  The marsala sauce was quite different from any other I have ever had.  It was dark, dark, almost black.  The spinach was tasteless and the mashed potatoes could have been better seasoned.  It was edible but could have been better for the price.  The ambiance was romantic and fine.  There was a piano player.  The waiter and bus boys were quite attentive to us.  It was a pleasant evening overall, perhaps we should have asked for different things on the menu.  Would we go back?  Yes, why not.  And this time around try something new.  Go with children? No.
reviewTitle: A Hidden Restaurant Cabaret on Staten Island

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText: The service was great in the dining room.  I had the special which was Lamb over risotto with peas and mushrooms.  The favor and presentation were wonderful.  The calmari panella has an asian influence and was very good.

placeAddress: 1100 South Avenue Hilton Garden Inn New York/Staten Island, Staten Island, NY 10314
reviewText:
This was  our second visit to the restaurant.  We enjoyed the experience the first time, so it was a no brainer as to where we were eating with our second visit to the area.
They have a piano player which lends to the pleasant atmosphere.
The food both times was very good.  The service was also very good.
Favorites:  Lemon Chello Salad, Gniocchi and the Whole Wheat Pasta with sundried tomatoes.
They offer a nice selection of bread with butter, olive oil w/ spices and a vegtable spread.
Salads run about $8 for a good size.  Entree start at around $15 and up.
The House wines were decent.
We did not try any deserts...we were to full from the meal.
The resturant is located in the Hilton Garden, but you wouldn't know it once you were inside the resturant.

Enjoy!!
